38 // Standard combined includes:
39 #include <algorithm>
40 #include <cmath>
41 #include <cstdint>
42 #include <exception>
43 #include <fstream>
44 #include <functional>
45 #include <iomanip>
46 #include <iostream>
47 #include <iterator>
48 #include <limits>
49 #include <locale>
50 #include <map>
51 #include <memory>
52 #include <numeric>
53 #include <set>
54 #include <sstream>
55 #include <stdexcept>
56 #include <string>
57 #include <tuple>
58 #include <type_traits>
59 #include <utility>
60 #include <vector>

62 #define CLI11_VERSION_MAJOR 2
63 #define CLI11_VERSION_MINOR 0
64 #define CLI11_VERSION_PATCH 0
65 #define CLI11_VERSION "2.0.0"
66 
67 // The following version macro is very similar to the one in pybind11
68 #if !(defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
69 #if __cplusplus >= 201402L
70 #define CLI11_CPP14
71 #if __cplusplus >= 201703L
72 #define CLI11_CPP17
73 #if __cplusplus > 201703L
74 #define CLI11_CPP20
75 #endif
76 #endif
77 #endif
78 #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L
79 // MSVC sets _MSVC_LANG rather than __cplusplus (supposedly until the standard
80 // is fully implemented) Unless you use the /Zc:__cplusplus flag on Visual
81 // Studio 2017 15.7 Preview 3 or newer
82 #if _MSVC_LANG >= 201402L
83 #define CLI11_CPP14
84 #if _MSVC_LANG > 201402L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
85 #define CLI11_CPP17
86 #if __MSVC_LANG > 201703L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
87 #define CLI11_CPP20
88 #endif
89 #endif
90 #endif
91 #endif
92 
93 #if defined(CLI11_CPP14)
94 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) [[deprecated(reason)]]
95 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
96 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __declspec(deprecated(reason))
97 #else
98 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __attribute__((deprecated(reason)))
99 #endif
100 
101 // C standard library
102 // Only needed for existence checking
103 #if defined CLI11_CPP17 && defined __has_include && \
104  !defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
105 #if __has_include(<filesystem>)
106 // Filesystem cannot be used if targeting macOS < 10.15
107 #if defined __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED && \
108  __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 101500
109 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
110 #else
111 #include <filesystem>
112 #if defined __cpp_lib_filesystem && __cpp_lib_filesystem >= 201703
113 #if defined _GLIBCXX_RELEASE && _GLIBCXX_RELEASE >= 9
114 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
115 #elif defined(__GLIBCXX__)
116 // if we are using gcc and Version <9 default to no filesystem
117 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
118 #else
119 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
120 #endif
121 #else
122 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
123 #endif
124 #endif
125 #endif
126 #endif
127 
128 #if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
129 #include <filesystem> // NOLINT(build/include)
130 #else
131 #include <sys/stat.h>
132 #include <sys/types.h>
133 #endif

135 namespace CLI {
136 
140 namespace enums {
141 
143 template <typename T,
144  typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type>
145 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &in, const T &item) {
146  // make sure this is out of the detail namespace otherwise it won't be found
147  // when needed
148  return in << static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(item);
149 }
150 
151 } // namespace enums
152 
154 using enums::operator<<;
155 
156 namespace detail {
160 constexpr int expected_max_vector_size{1 << 29};
161 // Based on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/236129/split-a-string-in-c
163 inline std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &s, char delim) {
164  std::vector<std::string> elems;
165  // Check to see if empty string, give consistent result
166  if (s.empty()) {
167  elems.emplace_back();
168  } else {
169  std::stringstream ss;
170  ss.str(s);
171  std::string item;
172  while (std::getline(ss, item, delim)) {
173  elems.push_back(item);
174  }
175  }
176  return elems;
177 }
178 
180 template <typename T> std::string join(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
181  std::ostringstream s;
182  auto beg = std::begin(v);
183  auto end = std::end(v);
184  if (beg != end)
185  s << *beg++;
186  while (beg != end) {
187  s << delim << *beg++;
188  }
189  return s.str();
190 }
191 
193 template <typename T, typename Callable,
194  typename = typename std::enable_if<
195  !std::is_constructible<std::string, Callable>::value>::type>
196 std::string join(const T &v, Callable func, std::string delim = ",") {
197  std::ostringstream s;
198  auto beg = std::begin(v);
199  auto end = std::end(v);
200  auto loc = s.tellp();
201  while (beg != end) {
202  auto nloc = s.tellp();
203  if (nloc > loc) {
204  s << delim;
205  loc = nloc;
206  }
207  s << func(*beg++);
208  }
209  return s.str();
210 }
211 
213 template <typename T> std::string rjoin(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
214  std::ostringstream s;
215  for (std::size_t start = 0; start < v.size(); start++) {
216  if (start > 0)
217  s << delim;
218  s << v[v.size() - start - 1];
219  }
220  return s.str();
221 }
222 
223 // Based roughly on
224 // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25829143/c-trim-whitespace-from-a-string
225 
227 inline std::string &ltrim(std::string &str) {
228  auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char ch) {
229  return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale());
230  });
231  str.erase(str.begin(), it);
232  return str;
233 }
234 
236 inline std::string &ltrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
237  auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [&filter](char ch) {
238  return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos;
239  });
240  str.erase(str.begin(), it);
241  return str;
242 }
243 
245 inline std::string &rtrim(std::string &str) {
246  auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [](char ch) {
247  return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale());
248  });
249  str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
250  return str;
251 }
252 
254 inline std::string &rtrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
255  auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [&filter](char ch) {
256  return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos;
257  });
258  str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
259  return str;
260 }
261 
263 inline std::string &trim(std::string &str) { return ltrim(rtrim(str)); }
264 
266 inline std::string &trim(std::string &str, const std::string filter) {
267  return ltrim(rtrim(str, filter), filter);
268 }
269 
271 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str) {
272  std::string s = str;
273  return trim(s);
274 }
275 
277 inline std::string &remove_quotes(std::string &str) {
278  if (str.length() > 1 && (str.front() == '"' || str.front() == '\'')) {
279  if (str.front() == str.back()) {
280  str.pop_back();
281  str.erase(str.begin(), str.begin() + 1);
282  }
283  }
284  return str;
285 }
286 
289 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str,
290  const std::string &filter) {
291  std::string s = str;
292  return trim(s, filter);
293 }
295 inline std::ostream &format_help(std::ostream &out, std::string name,
296  const std::string &description,
297  std::size_t wid) {
298  name = " " + name;
299  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << std::left << name;
300  if (!description.empty()) {
301  if (name.length() >= wid)
302  out << "\n" << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
303  for (const char c : description) {
304  out.put(c);
305  if (c == '\n') {
306  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
307  }
308  }
309  }
310  out << "\n";
311  return out;
312 }
313 
315 inline std::ostream &format_aliases(std::ostream &out,
316  const std::vector<std::string> &aliases,
317  std::size_t wid) {
318  if (!aliases.empty()) {
319  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << " aliases: ";
320  bool front = true;
321  for (const auto &alias : aliases) {
322  if (!front) {
323  out << ", ";
324  } else {
325  front = false;
326  }
327  out << alias;
328  }
329  out << "\n";
330  }
331  return out;
332 }
333 
335 template <typename T> bool valid_first_char(T c) {
336  return std::isalnum(c, std::locale()) || c == '_' || c == '?' || c == '@';
337 }
338 
340 template <typename T> bool valid_later_char(T c) {
341  return valid_first_char(c) || c == '.' || c == '-';
342 }
343 
345 inline bool valid_name_string(const std::string &str) {
346  if (str.empty() || !valid_first_char(str[0]))
347  return false;
348  for (auto c : str.substr(1))
349  if (!valid_later_char(c))
350  return false;
351  return true;
352 }
353 
355 inline bool is_separator(const std::string &str) {
356  static const std::string sep("%%");
357  return (str.empty() || str == sep);
358 }
359 
361 inline bool isalpha(const std::string &str) {
362  return std::all_of(str.begin(), str.end(),
363  [](char c) { return std::isalpha(c, std::locale()); });
364 }
365 
367 inline std::string to_lower(std::string str) {
368  std::transform(std::begin(str), std::end(str), std::begin(str),
369  [](const std::string::value_type &x) {
370  return std::tolower(x, std::locale());
371  });
372  return str;
373 }
374 
376 inline std::string remove_underscore(std::string str) {
377  str.erase(std::remove(std::begin(str), std::end(str), '_'), std::end(str));
378  return str;
379 }
380 
382 inline std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from,
383  std::string to) {
384 
385  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
386 
387  while ((start_pos = str.find(from, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
388  str.replace(start_pos, from.length(), to);
389  start_pos += to.length();
390  }
391 
392  return str;
393 }
394 
396 inline bool has_default_flag_values(const std::string &flags) {
397  return (flags.find_first_of("{!") != std::string::npos);
398 }
399 
400 inline void remove_default_flag_values(std::string &flags) {
401  auto loc = flags.find_first_of('{');
402  while (loc != std::string::npos) {
403  auto finish = flags.find_first_of("},", loc + 1);
404  if ((finish != std::string::npos) && (flags[finish] == '}')) {
405  flags.erase(flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(loc),
406  flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(finish) +
407  1);
408  }
409  loc = flags.find_first_of('{', loc + 1);
410  }
411  flags.erase(std::remove(flags.begin(), flags.end(), '!'), flags.end());
412 }
413 
416 inline std::ptrdiff_t find_member(std::string name,
417  const std::vector<std::string> names,
418  bool ignore_case = false,
419  bool ignore_underscore = false) {
420  auto it = std::end(names);
421  if (ignore_case) {
422  if (ignore_underscore) {
423  name = detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(name));
424  it = std::find_if(
425  std::begin(names), std::end(names),
426  [&name](std::string local_name) {
427  return detail::to_lower(
428  detail::remove_underscore(local_name)) == name;
429  });
430  } else {
431  name = detail::to_lower(name);
432  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names),
433  [&name](std::string local_name) {
434  return detail::to_lower(local_name) == name;
435  });
436  }
437 
438  } else if (ignore_underscore) {
439  name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
440  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names),
441  [&name](std::string local_name) {
442  return detail::remove_underscore(local_name) ==
443  name;
444  });
445  } else {
446  it = std::find(std::begin(names), std::end(names), name);
447  }
448 
449  return (it != std::end(names)) ? (it - std::begin(names)) : (-1);
450 }
451 
455 template <typename Callable>
456 inline std::string find_and_modify(std::string str, std::string trigger,
457  Callable modify) {
458  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
459  while ((start_pos = str.find(trigger, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
460  start_pos = modify(str, start_pos);
461  }
462  return str;
463 }
464 
467 inline std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str,
468  char delimiter = '\0') {
469 
470  const std::string delims("\'\"`");
471  auto find_ws = [delimiter](char ch) {
472  return (delimiter == '\0')
473  ? (std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()) != 0)
474  : (ch == delimiter);
475  };
476  trim(str);
477 
478  std::vector<std::string> output;
479  bool embeddedQuote = false;
480  char keyChar = ' ';
481  while (!str.empty()) {
482  if (delims.find_first_of(str[0]) != std::string::npos) {
483  keyChar = str[0];
484  auto end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
485  while ((end != std::string::npos) &&
486  (str[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
487  end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
488  embeddedQuote = true;
489  }
490  if (end != std::string::npos) {
491  output.push_back(str.substr(1, end - 1));
492  if (end + 2 < str.size()) {
493  str = str.substr(end + 2);
494  } else {
495  str.clear();
496  }
497 
498  } else {
499  output.push_back(str.substr(1));
500  str = "";
501  }
502  } else {
503  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(str), std::end(str), find_ws);
504  if (it != std::end(str)) {
505  std::string value = std::string(str.begin(), it);
506  output.push_back(value);
507  str = std::string(it + 1, str.end());
508  } else {
509  output.push_back(str);
510  str = "";
511  }
512  }
513  // transform any embedded quotes into the regular character
514  if (embeddedQuote) {
515  output.back() =
516  find_and_replace(output.back(), std::string("\\") + keyChar,
517  std::string(1, keyChar));
518  embeddedQuote = false;
519  }
520  trim(str);
521  }
522  return output;
523 }
524 
529 inline std::string fix_newlines(const std::string &leader, std::string input) {
530  std::string::size_type n = 0;
531  while (n != std::string::npos && n < input.size()) {
532  n = input.find('\n', n);
533  if (n != std::string::npos) {
534  input = input.substr(0, n + 1) + leader + input.substr(n + 1);
535  n += leader.size();
536  }
537  }
538  return input;
539 }
540 
546 inline std::size_t escape_detect(std::string &str, std::size_t offset) {
547  auto next = str[offset + 1];
548  if ((next == '\"') || (next == '\'') || (next == '`')) {
549  auto astart = str.find_last_of("-/ \"\'`", offset - 1);
550  if (astart != std::string::npos) {
551  if (str[astart] == ((str[offset] == '=') ? '-' : '/'))
552  str[offset] = ' '; // interpret this as a space so the split_up
553  // works properly
554  }
555  }
556  return offset + 1;
557 }
558 
560 inline std::string &add_quotes_if_needed(std::string &str) {
561  if ((str.front() != '"' && str.front() != '\'') ||
562  str.front() != str.back()) {
563  char quote = str.find('"') < str.find('\'') ? '\'' : '"';
564  if (str.find(' ') != std::string::npos) {
565  str.insert(0, 1, quote);
566  str.append(1, quote);
567  }
568  }
569  return str;
570 }
571 
572 } // namespace detail
573 
574 // Use one of these on all error classes.
575 // These are temporary and are undef'd at the end of this file.
576 #define CLI11_ERROR_DEF(parent, name) \
577 protected: \
578  name(std::string ename, std::string msg, int exit_code) \
579  : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
580  name(std::string ename, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) \
581  : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
582  \
583 public: \
584  name(std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) \
585  : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
586  name(std::string msg, int exit_code) \
587  : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {}
588 
589 // This is added after the one above if a class is used directly and builds its
590 // own message
591 #define CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(name) \
592  explicit name(std::string msg) : name(#name, msg, ExitCodes::name) {}
593 
597 enum class ExitCodes {
598  Success = 0,
599  IncorrectConstruction = 100,
600  BadNameString,
601  OptionAlreadyAdded,
602  FileError,
603  ConversionError,
604  ValidationError,
605  RequiredError,
606  RequiresError,
607  ExcludesError,
608  ExtrasError,
609  ConfigError,
610  InvalidError,
611  HorribleError,
612  OptionNotFound,
613  ArgumentMismatch,
614  BaseClass = 127
615 };
616 
617 // Error definitions
618 
625 
627 class Error : public std::runtime_error {
628  int actual_exit_code;
629  std::string error_name{"Error"};
630 
631 public:
632  int get_exit_code() const { return actual_exit_code; }
633 
634  std::string get_name() const { return error_name; }
635 
636  Error(std::string name, std::string msg,
637  int exit_code = static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::BaseClass))
638  : runtime_error(msg), actual_exit_code(exit_code),
639  error_name(std::move(name)) {}
640 
641  Error(std::string name, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code)
642  : Error(name, msg, static_cast<int>(exit_code)) {}
643 };
644 
645 // Note: Using Error::Error constructors does not work on GCC 4.7
646 
648 class ConstructionError : public Error {
649  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ConstructionError)
650 };
651 
654 class IncorrectConstruction : public ConstructionError {
655  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, IncorrectConstruction)
656  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(IncorrectConstruction)
657  static IncorrectConstruction PositionalFlag(std::string name) {
658  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Flags cannot be positional");
659  }
660  static IncorrectConstruction Set0Opt(std::string name) {
661  return IncorrectConstruction(
662  name + ": Cannot set 0 expected, use a flag instead");
663  }
664  static IncorrectConstruction SetFlag(std::string name) {
665  return IncorrectConstruction(
666  name + ": Cannot set an expected number for flags");
667  }
668  static IncorrectConstruction ChangeNotVector(std::string name) {
669  return IncorrectConstruction(
670  name + ": You can only change the expected arguments for vectors");
671  }
672  static IncorrectConstruction AfterMultiOpt(std::string name) {
673  return IncorrectConstruction(
674  name + ": You can't change expected arguments after you've changed "
675  "the multi option policy!");
676  }
677  static IncorrectConstruction MissingOption(std::string name) {
678  return IncorrectConstruction("Option " + name + " is not defined");
679  }
680  static IncorrectConstruction MultiOptionPolicy(std::string name) {
681  return IncorrectConstruction(name +
682  ": multi_option_policy only works for "
683  "flags and exact value options");
684  }
685 };
686 
688 class BadNameString : public ConstructionError {
689  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, BadNameString)
690  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(BadNameString)
691  static BadNameString OneCharName(std::string name) {
692  return BadNameString("Invalid one char name: " + name);
693  }
694  static BadNameString BadLongName(std::string name) {
695  return BadNameString("Bad long name: " + name);
696  }
697  static BadNameString DashesOnly(std::string name) {
698  return BadNameString("Must have a name, not just dashes: " + name);
699  }
700  static BadNameString MultiPositionalNames(std::string name) {
701  return BadNameString("Only one positional name allowed, remove: " +
702  name);
703  }
704 };
705 
707 class OptionAlreadyAdded : public ConstructionError {
708  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, OptionAlreadyAdded)
709  explicit OptionAlreadyAdded(std::string name)
710  : OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " is already added",
711  ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded) {}
712  static OptionAlreadyAdded Requires(std::string name, std::string other) {
713  return OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " requires " + other,
714  ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded);
715  }
716  static OptionAlreadyAdded Excludes(std::string name, std::string other) {
717  return OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " excludes " + other,
718  ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded);
719  }
720 };
721 
722 // Parsing errors
723 
725 class ParseError : public Error {
726  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ParseError)
727 };
728 
729 // Not really "errors"
730 
732 class Success : public ParseError {
733  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, Success)
734  Success()
735  : Success("Successfully completed, should be caught and quit",
736  ExitCodes::Success) {}
737 };
738 
740 class CallForHelp : public Success {
741  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForHelp)
742  CallForHelp()
743  : CallForHelp(
744  "This should be caught in your main function, see examples",
745  ExitCodes::Success) {}
746 };
747 
749 class CallForAllHelp : public Success {
750  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForAllHelp)
751  CallForAllHelp()
752  : CallForAllHelp(
753  "This should be caught in your main function, see examples",
754  ExitCodes::Success) {}
755 };
756 
758 class CallForVersion : public Success {
759  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForVersion)
760  CallForVersion()
761  : CallForVersion(
762  "This should be caught in your main function, see examples",
763  ExitCodes::Success) {}
764 };
765 
768 class RuntimeError : public ParseError {
769  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RuntimeError)
770  explicit RuntimeError(int exit_code = 1)
771  : RuntimeError("Runtime error", exit_code) {}
772 };
773 
775 class FileError : public ParseError {
776  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, FileError)
777  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(FileError)
778  static FileError Missing(std::string name) {
779  return FileError(name + " was not readable (missing?)");
780  }
781 };
782 
785 class ConversionError : public ParseError {
786  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConversionError)
787  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConversionError)
788  ConversionError(std::string member, std::string name)
789  : ConversionError("The value " + member +
790  " is not an allowed value for " + name) {}
791  ConversionError(std::string name, std::vector<std::string> results)
792  : ConversionError("Could not convert: " + name + " = " +
793  detail::join(results)) {}
794  static ConversionError TooManyInputsFlag(std::string name) {
795  return ConversionError(name + ": too many inputs for a flag");
796  }
797  static ConversionError TrueFalse(std::string name) {
798  return ConversionError(name + ": Should be true/false or a number");
799  }
800 };
801 
803 class ValidationError : public ParseError {
804  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ValidationError)
805  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ValidationError)
806  explicit ValidationError(std::string name, std::string msg)
807  : ValidationError(name + ": " + msg) {}
808 };
809 
811 class RequiredError : public ParseError {
812  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiredError)
813  explicit RequiredError(std::string name)
814  : RequiredError(name + " is required", ExitCodes::RequiredError) {}
815  static RequiredError Subcommand(std::size_t min_subcom) {
816  if (min_subcom == 1) {
817  return RequiredError("A subcommand");
818  }
819  return RequiredError("Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_subcom) +
820  " subcommands",
821  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
822  }
823  static RequiredError Option(std::size_t min_option, std::size_t max_option,
824  std::size_t used,
825  const std::string &option_list) {
826  if ((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used == 0))
827  return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
828  if ((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used > 1)) {
829  return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list +
830  "] is required and " +
831  std::to_string(used) + " were given",
832  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
833  }
834  if ((min_option == 1) && (used == 0))
835  return RequiredError("At least 1 option from [" + option_list +
836  "]");
837  if (used < min_option) {
838  return RequiredError(
839  "Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_option) +
840  " options used and only " + std::to_string(used) +
841  "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
842  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
843  }
844  if (max_option == 1)
845  return RequiredError("Requires at most 1 options be given from [" +
846  option_list + "]",
847  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
848 
849  return RequiredError("Requires at most " + std::to_string(max_option) +
850  " options be used and " +
851  std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" +
852  option_list + "]",
853  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
854  }
855 };
856 
858 class ArgumentMismatch : public ParseError {
859  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ArgumentMismatch)
860  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ArgumentMismatch)
861  ArgumentMismatch(std::string name, int expected, std::size_t received)
862  : ArgumentMismatch(expected > 0
863  ? ("Expected exactly " +
864  std::to_string(expected) + " arguments to " +
865  name + ", got " + std::to_string(received))
866  : ("Expected at least " +
867  std::to_string(-expected) + " arguments to " +
868  name + ", got " + std::to_string(received)),
869  ExitCodes::ArgumentMismatch) {}
870 
871  static ArgumentMismatch AtLeast(std::string name, int num,
872  std::size_t received) {
873  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At least " + std::to_string(num) +
874  " required but received " +
875  std::to_string(received));
876  }
877  static ArgumentMismatch AtMost(std::string name, int num,
878  std::size_t received) {
879  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At Most " + std::to_string(num) +
880  " required but received " +
881  std::to_string(received));
882  }
883  static ArgumentMismatch TypedAtLeast(std::string name, int num,
884  std::string type) {
885  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + std::to_string(num) +
886  " required " + type + " missing");
887  }
888  static ArgumentMismatch FlagOverride(std::string name) {
889  return ArgumentMismatch(name + " was given a disallowed flag override");
890  }
891 };
892 
894 class RequiresError : public ParseError {
895  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiresError)
896  RequiresError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
897  : RequiresError(curname + " requires " + subname,
898  ExitCodes::RequiresError) {}
899 };
900 
902 class ExcludesError : public ParseError {
903  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExcludesError)
904  ExcludesError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
905  : ExcludesError(curname + " excludes " + subname,
906  ExitCodes::ExcludesError) {}
907 };
908 
910 class ExtrasError : public ParseError {
911  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExtrasError)
912  explicit ExtrasError(std::vector<std::string> args)
913  : ExtrasError((args.size() > 1
914  ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
915  : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
916  detail::rjoin(args, " "),
917  ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
918  ExtrasError(const std::string &name, std::vector<std::string> args)
919  : ExtrasError(name,
920  (args.size() > 1
921  ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
922  : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
923  detail::rjoin(args, " "),
924  ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
925 };
926 
928 class ConfigError : public ParseError {
929  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConfigError)
930  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConfigError)
931  static ConfigError Extras(std::string item) {
932  return ConfigError("INI was not able to parse " + item);
933  }
934  static ConfigError NotConfigurable(std::string item) {
935  return ConfigError(
936  item + ": This option is not allowed in a configuration file");
937  }
938 };
939 
941 class InvalidError : public ParseError {
942  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, InvalidError)
943  explicit InvalidError(std::string name)
944  : InvalidError(name + ": Too many positional arguments with unlimited "
945  "expected args",
946  ExitCodes::InvalidError) {}
947 };
948 
952 class HorribleError : public ParseError {
953  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, HorribleError)
954  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(HorribleError)
955 };
956 
957 // After parsing
958 
960 class OptionNotFound : public Error {
961  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, OptionNotFound)
962  explicit OptionNotFound(std::string name)
963  : OptionNotFound(name + " not found", ExitCodes::OptionNotFound) {}
964 };
965 
966 #undef CLI11_ERROR_DEF
967 #undef CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE
968 
970 
971 // Type tools
972 
973 // Utilities for type enabling
974 namespace detail {
975 // Based generally on https://rmf.io/cxx11/almost-static-if
977 enum class enabler {};
978 
980 constexpr enabler dummy = {};
981 } // namespace detail
982 
989 template <bool B, class T = void>
990 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
991 
993 template <typename... Ts> struct make_void { using type = void; };
994 
997 template <typename... Ts> using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
998 
1001 template <bool B, class T, class F>
1002 using conditional_t = typename std::conditional<B, T, F>::type;
1003 
1005 template <typename T> struct is_bool : std::false_type {};
1006 
1008 template <> struct is_bool<bool> : std::true_type {};
1009 
1011 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr : std::false_type {};
1012 
1015 template <typename T>
1016 struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1017 
1020 template <typename T>
1021 struct is_shared_ptr<const std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1022 
1024 template <typename T> struct is_copyable_ptr {
1025  static bool const value =
1026  is_shared_ptr<T>::value || std::is_pointer<T>::value;
1027 };
1028 
1030 template <typename T> struct IsMemberType { using type = T; };
1031 
1033 template <> struct IsMemberType<const char *> { using type = std::string; };
1034 
1035 namespace detail {
1036 
1037 // These are utilities for IsMember and other transforming objects
1038 
1041 
1043 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct element_type {
1044  using type = T;
1045 };
1046 
1047 template <typename T>
1048 struct element_type<T,
1049  typename std::enable_if<is_copyable_ptr<T>::value>::type> {
1050  using type = typename std::pointer_traits<T>::element_type;
1051 };
1052 
1055 template <typename T> struct element_value_type {
1056  using type = typename element_type<T>::type::value_type;
1057 };
1058 
1061 template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct pair_adaptor : std::false_type {
1062  using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1063  using first_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1064  using second_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1065 
1067  template <typename Q>
1068  static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1069  return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1070  }
1072  template <typename Q>
1073  static auto second(Q &&pair_value)
1074  -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1075  return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1076  }
1077 };
1078 
1082 template <typename T>
1083 struct pair_adaptor<T,
1084  conditional_t<false,
1085  void_t<typename T::value_type::first_type,
1086  typename T::value_type::second_type>,
1087  void>> : std::true_type {
1088  using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1089  using first_type =
1090  typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::first_type>::type;
1091  using second_type =
1092  typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::second_type>::type;
1093 
1095  template <typename Q>
1096  static auto first(Q &&pair_value)
1097  -> decltype(std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1098  return std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1099  }
1101  template <typename Q>
1102  static auto second(Q &&pair_value)
1103  -> decltype(std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1104  return std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1105  }
1106 };
1107 
1108 // Warning is suppressed due to "bug" in gcc<5.0 and gcc 7.0 with c++17 enabled
1109 // that generates a Wnarrowing warning in the unevaluated context even if the
1110 // function that was using this wasn't used. The standard says narrowing in
1111 // brace initialization shouldn't be allowed but for backwards compatibility gcc
1112 // allows it in some contexts. It is a little fuzzy what happens in template
1113 // constructs and I think that was something GCC took a little while to work
1114 // out. But regardless some versions of gcc generate a warning when they
1115 // shouldn't from the following code so that should be suppressed
1116 #ifdef __GNUC__
1117 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
1118 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnarrowing"
1119 #endif
1120 // check for constructibility from a specific type and copy assignable used in
1121 // the parse detection
1122 template <typename T, typename C> class is_direct_constructible {
1123  template <typename TT, typename CC>
1124  static auto test(int, std::true_type) -> decltype(
1125 // NVCC warns about narrowing conversions here
1126 #ifdef __CUDACC__
1127 #pragma diag_suppress 2361
1128 #endif
1129  TT { std::declval<CC>() }
1130 #ifdef __CUDACC__
1131 #pragma diag_default 2361
1132 #endif
1133  ,
1134  std::is_move_assignable<TT>());
1135 
1136  template <typename TT, typename CC>
1137  static auto test(int, std::false_type) -> std::false_type;
1138 
1139  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1140 
1141 public:
1142  static constexpr bool value = decltype(
1143  test<T, C>(0, typename std::is_constructible<T, C>::type()))::value;
1144 };
1145 #ifdef __GNUC__
1146 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
1147 #endif
1148 
1149 // Check for output streamability
1150 // Based on
1151 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22758291/how-can-i-detect-if-a-type-can-be-streamed-to-an-stdostream
1152 
1153 template <typename T, typename S = std::ostringstream> class is_ostreamable {
1154  template <typename TT, typename SS>
1155  static auto test(int)
1156  -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() << std::declval<TT>(),
1157  std::true_type());
1158 
1159  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1160 
1161 public:
1162  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1163 };
1164 
1166 template <typename T, typename S = std::istringstream> class is_istreamable {
1167  template <typename TT, typename SS>
1168  static auto test(int)
1169  -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() >> std::declval<TT &>(),
1170  std::true_type());
1171 
1172  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1173 
1174 public:
1175  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1176 };
1177 
1179 template <typename T> class is_complex {
1180  template <typename TT>
1181  static auto test(int)
1182  -> decltype(std::declval<TT>().real(), std::declval<TT>().imag(),
1183  std::true_type());
1184 
1185  template <typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1186 
1187 public:
1188  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T>(0))::value;
1189 };
1190 
1192 template <typename T, enable_if_t<is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
1193  detail::dummy>
1194 bool from_stream(const std::string &istring, T &obj) {
1195  std::istringstream is;
1196  is.str(istring);
1197  is >> obj;
1198  return !is.fail() && !is.rdbuf()->in_avail();
1199 }
1200 
1201 template <typename T, enable_if_t<!is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
1202  detail::dummy>
1203 bool from_stream(const std::string & /*istring*/, T & /*obj*/) {
1204  return false;
1205 }
1206 
1207 // check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1208 template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1209 struct is_mutable_container : std::false_type {};
1210 
1215 template <typename T>
1216 struct is_mutable_container<
1217  T, conditional_t<
1218  false,
1219  void_t<typename T::value_type, decltype(std::declval<T>().end()),
1220  decltype(std::declval<T>().clear()),
1221  decltype(std::declval<T>().insert(
1222  std::declval<decltype(std::declval<T>().end())>(),
1223  std::declval<const typename T::value_type &>()))>,
1224  void>>
1225  : public conditional_t<std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value,
1226  std::false_type, std::true_type> {};
1227 
1228 // check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1229 template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1230 struct is_readable_container : std::false_type {};
1231 
1236 template <typename T>
1237 struct is_readable_container<
1238  T, conditional_t<false,
1239  void_t<decltype(std::declval<T>().end()),
1240  decltype(std::declval<T>().begin())>,
1241  void>> : public std::true_type {};
1242 
1243 // check to see if an object is a wrapper (fail by default)
1244 template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct is_wrapper : std::false_type {};
1245 
1246 // check if an object is a wrapper (it has a value_type defined)
1247 template <typename T>
1248 struct is_wrapper<T, conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type>, void>>
1249  : public std::true_type {};
1250 
1251 // Check for tuple like types, as in classes with a tuple_size type trait
1252 template <typename S> class is_tuple_like {
1253  template <typename SS>
1254  // static auto test(int)
1255  // -> decltype(std::conditional<(std::tuple_size<SS>::value > 0),
1256  // std::true_type, std::false_type>::type());
1257  static auto test(int)
1258  -> decltype(std::tuple_size<typename std::decay<SS>::type>::value,
1259  std::true_type{});
1260  template <typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1261 
1262 public:
1263  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<S>(0))::value;
1264 };
1265 
1267 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value,
1268  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1269 auto to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(std::forward<T>(value)) {
1270  return std::forward<T>(value);
1271 }
1272 
1274 template <typename T,
1275  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1276  !std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value,
1277  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1278 std::string to_string(const T &value) {
1279  return std::string(value);
1280 }
1281 
1283 template <typename T,
1284  enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<std::string, T>::value &&
1285  !std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1286  is_ostreamable<T>::value,
1287  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1288 std::string to_string(T &&value) {
1289  std::stringstream stream;
1290  stream << value;
1291  return stream.str();
1292 }
1293 
1296 template <typename T,
1297  enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1298  !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1299  !is_readable_container<
1300  typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::value,
1301  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1302 std::string to_string(T &&) {
1303  return std::string{};
1304 }
1305 
1307 template <typename T,
1308  enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1309  !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1310  is_readable_container<T>::value,
1311  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1312 std::string to_string(T &&variable) {
1313  std::vector<std::string> defaults;
1314  auto cval = variable.begin();
1315  auto end = variable.end();
1316  while (cval != end) {
1317  defaults.emplace_back(CLI::detail::to_string(*cval));
1318  ++cval;
1319  }
1320  return std::string("[" + detail::join(defaults) + "]");
1321 }
1322 
1324 template <
1325  typename T1, typename T2, typename T,
1326  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1327 auto checked_to_string(T &&value)
1328  -> decltype(to_string(std::forward<T>(value))) {
1329  return to_string(std::forward<T>(value));
1330 }
1331 
1333 template <
1334  typename T1, typename T2, typename T,
1335  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1336 std::string checked_to_string(T &&) {
1337  return std::string{};
1338 }
1340 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<T>::value,
1341  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1342 std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1343  return std::to_string(value);
1344 }
1346 template <typename T,
1347  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1348 std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1349  return std::to_string(
1350  static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(value));
1351 }
1353 template <typename T,
1354  enable_if_t<!std::is_enum<T>::value && !std::is_arithmetic<T>::value,
1355  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1356 auto value_string(const T &value) -> decltype(to_string(value)) {
1357  return to_string(value);
1358 }
1359 
1361 template <typename T, typename def, typename Enable = void>
1362 struct wrapped_type {
1363  using type = def;
1364 };
1365 
1367 template <typename T, typename def>
1368 struct wrapped_type<T, def,
1369  typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1370  using type = typename T::value_type;
1371 };
1372 
1374 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count_base {
1375  static const int value{0};
1376 };
1377 
1379 template <typename T>
1380 struct type_count_base<
1381  T, typename std::enable_if<!is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1382  !is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
1383  !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1384  static constexpr int value{1};
1385 };
1386 
1388 template <typename T>
1389 struct type_count_base<
1390  T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1391  !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1392  static constexpr int value{std::tuple_size<T>::value};
1393 };
1394 
1397 template <typename T>
1398 struct type_count_base<
1399  T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1400  static constexpr int value{type_count_base<typename T::value_type>::value};
1401 };
1402 
1404 
1406 template <typename T> struct subtype_count;
1407 
1409 template <typename T> struct subtype_count_min;
1410 
1412 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count {
1413  static const int value{0};
1414 };
1415 
1417 template <typename T>
1418 struct type_count<T,
1419  typename std::enable_if<
1420  !is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1421  !is_complex<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1422  static constexpr int value{1};
1423 };
1424 
1426 template <typename T>
1427 struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1428  static constexpr int value{2};
1429 };
1430 
1433 template <typename T>
1434 struct type_count<
1435  T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1436  static constexpr int value{subtype_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1437 };
1438 
1441 template <typename T>
1442 struct type_count<
1443  T, typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1444  !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1445  !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1446  static constexpr int value{type_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1447 };
1448 
1450 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1451 constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type
1452 tuple_type_size() {
1453  return 0;
1454 }
1455 
1457 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1458  constexpr typename std::enable_if <
1459  I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size() {
1460  return subtype_count<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value +
1461  tuple_type_size<T, I + 1>();
1462 }
1463 
1466 template <typename T>
1467 struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1468  static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size<T, 0>()};
1469 };
1470 
1472 template <typename T> struct subtype_count {
1473  static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container<T>::value
1474  ? expected_max_vector_size
1475  : type_count<T>::value};
1476 };
1477 
1479 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count_min {
1480  static const int value{0};
1481 };
1482 
1484 template <typename T>
1485 struct type_count_min<
1486  T, typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
1487  !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1488  !is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1489  !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1490  static constexpr int value{type_count<T>::value};
1491 };
1492 
1494 template <typename T>
1495 struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1496  static constexpr int value{1};
1497 };
1498 
1501 template <typename T>
1502 struct type_count_min<
1503  T, typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1504  !is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1505  static constexpr int value{
1506  subtype_count_min<typename T::value_type>::value};
1507 };
1508 
1510 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1511 constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type
1512 tuple_type_size_min() {
1513  return 0;
1514 }
1515 
1517 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1518  constexpr typename std::enable_if <
1519  I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size_min() {
1520  return subtype_count_min<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value +
1521  tuple_type_size_min<T, I + 1>();
1522 }
1523 
1526 template <typename T>
1527 struct type_count_min<T,
1528  typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1529  static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size_min<T, 0>()};
1530 };
1531 
1533 template <typename T> struct subtype_count_min {
1534  static constexpr int value{
1535  is_mutable_container<T>::value
1536  ? ((type_count<T>::value < expected_max_vector_size)
1537  ? type_count<T>::value
1538  : 0)
1539  : type_count_min<T>::value};
1540 };
1541 
1543 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct expected_count {
1544  static const int value{0};
1545 };
1546 
1548 template <typename T>
1549 struct expected_count<T,
1550  typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
1551  !is_wrapper<T>::value &&
1552  !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1553  static constexpr int value{1};
1554 };
1556 template <typename T>
1557 struct expected_count<
1558  T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1559  static constexpr int value{expected_max_vector_size};
1560 };
1561 
1563 template <typename T>
1564 struct expected_count<T,
1565  typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
1566  is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1567  static constexpr int value{expected_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1568 };
1569 
1570 // Enumeration of the different supported categorizations of objects
1571 enum class object_category : int {
1572  char_value = 1,
1573  integral_value = 2,
1574  unsigned_integral = 4,
1575  enumeration = 6,
1576  boolean_value = 8,
1577  floating_point = 10,
1578  number_constructible = 12,
1579  double_constructible = 14,
1580  integer_constructible = 16,
1581  // string like types
1582  string_assignable = 23,
1583  string_constructible = 24,
1584  other = 45,
1585  // special wrapper or container types
1586  wrapper_value = 50,
1587  complex_number = 60,
1588  tuple_value = 70,
1589  container_value = 80,
1590 
1591 };
1592 
1594 
1596 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct classify_object {
1597  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::other};
1598 };
1599 
1601 template <typename T>
1602 struct classify_object<
1603  T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1604  !std::is_same<T, char>::value &&
1605  std::is_signed<T>::value && !is_bool<T>::value &&
1606  !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1607  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integral_value};
1608 };
1609 
1611 template <typename T>
1612 struct classify_object<
1613  T, typename std::enable_if<
1614  std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value &&
1615  !std::is_same<T, char>::value && !is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1616  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::unsigned_integral};
1617 };
1618 
1620 template <typename T>
1621 struct classify_object<T,
1622  typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<T, char>::value &&
1623  !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1624  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::char_value};
1625 };
1626 
1628 template <typename T>
1629 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1630  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::boolean_value};
1631 };
1632 
1634 template <typename T>
1635 struct classify_object<
1636  T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value>::type> {
1637  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::floating_point};
1638 };
1639 
1641 template <typename T>
1642 struct classify_object<
1643  T, typename std::enable_if<
1644  !std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1645  std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value>::type> {
1646  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_assignable};
1647 };
1648 
1650 template <typename T>
1651 struct classify_object<
1652  T, typename std::enable_if<
1653  !std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1654  !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1655  (type_count<T>::value == 1) &&
1656  std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value>::type> {
1657  static constexpr object_category value{
1658  object_category::string_constructible};
1659 };
1660 
1662 template <typename T>
1663 struct classify_object<T,
1664  typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1665  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::enumeration};
1666 };
1667 
1668 template <typename T>
1669 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1670  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::complex_number};
1671 };
1672 
1675 template <typename T> struct uncommon_type {
1676  using type = typename std::conditional<
1677  !std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1678  !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1679  !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value &&
1680  !is_complex<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
1681  !std::is_enum<T>::value,
1682  std::true_type, std::false_type>::type;
1683  static constexpr bool value = type::value;
1684 };
1685 
1687 template <typename T>
1688 struct classify_object<
1689  T, typename std::enable_if<(
1690  !is_mutable_container<T>::value && is_wrapper<T>::value &&
1691  !is_tuple_like<T>::value && uncommon_type<T>::value)>::type> {
1692  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wrapper_value};
1693 };
1694 
1696 template <typename T>
1697 struct classify_object<
1698  T, typename std::enable_if<
1699  uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1700  !is_wrapper<T>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1701  is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1702  static constexpr object_category value{
1703  object_category::number_constructible};
1704 };
1705 
1707 template <typename T>
1708 struct classify_object<
1709  T,
1710  typename std::enable_if<
1711  uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1712  !is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1713  is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1714  static constexpr object_category value{
1715  object_category::integer_constructible};
1716 };
1717 
1719 template <typename T>
1720 struct classify_object<
1721  T, typename std::enable_if<
1722  uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1723  !is_wrapper<T>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1724  !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1725  static constexpr object_category value{
1726  object_category::double_constructible};
1727 };
1728 
1730 template <typename T>
1731 struct classify_object<
1732  T, typename std::enable_if<
1733  is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1734  ((type_count<T>::value >= 2 && !is_wrapper<T>::value) ||
1735  (uncommon_type<T>::value &&
1736  !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1737  !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value))>::type> {
1738  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::tuple_value};
1739  // the condition on this class requires it be like a tuple, but on some
1740  // compilers (like Xcode) tuples can be constructed from just the first
1741  // element so tuples of <string, int,int> can be constructed from a string,
1742  // which could lead to issues so there are two variants of the condition,
1743  // the first isolates things with a type size >=2 mainly to get tuples on
1744  // Xcode with the exception of wrappers, the second is the main one and just
1745  // separating out those cases that are caught by other object
1746  // classifications
1747 };
1748 
1750 template <typename T>
1751 struct classify_object<
1752  T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1753  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::container_value};
1754 };
1755 
1756 // Type name print
1757 
1761 
1762 template <typename T,
1763  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::char_value,
1764  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1765 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1766  return "CHAR";
1767 }
1768 
1769 template <
1770  typename T,
1771  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
1772  classify_object<T>::value ==
1773  object_category::integer_constructible,
1774  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1775 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1776  return "INT";
1777 }
1778 
1779 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1780  object_category::unsigned_integral,
1781  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1782 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1783  return "UINT";
1784 }
1785 
1786 template <
1787  typename T,
1788  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point ||
1789  classify_object<T>::value ==
1790  object_category::number_constructible ||
1791  classify_object<T>::value ==
1792  object_category::double_constructible,
1793  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1794 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1795  return "FLOAT";
1796 }
1797 
1799 template <typename T,
1800  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration,
1801  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1802 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1803  return "ENUM";
1804 }
1805 
1807 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1808  object_category::boolean_value,
1809  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1810 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1811  return "BOOLEAN";
1812 }
1813 
1815 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1816  object_category::complex_number,
1817  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1818 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1819  return "COMPLEX";
1820 }
1821 
1823 template <typename T,
1824  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value >=
1825  object_category::string_assignable &&
1826  classify_object<T>::value <= object_category::other,
1827  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1828 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1829  return "TEXT";
1830 }
1832 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1833  object_category::tuple_value &&
1834  type_count_base<T>::value >= 2,
1835  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1836 std::string type_name(); // forward declaration
1837 
1839 template <
1840  typename T,
1841  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::container_value ||
1842  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
1843  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1844 std::string type_name(); // forward declaration
1845 
1847 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1848  object_category::tuple_value &&
1849  type_count_base<T>::value == 1,
1850  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1851 inline std::string type_name() {
1852  return type_name<
1853  typename std::decay<typename std::tuple_element<0, T>::type>::type>();
1854 }
1855 
1857 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1858 inline
1859  typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, std::string>::type
1860  tuple_name() {
1861  return std::string{};
1862 }
1863 
1865 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1866 inline
1867  typename std::enable_if<(I < type_count_base<T>::value), std::string>::type
1868  tuple_name() {
1869  std::string str =
1870  std::string(type_name<typename std::decay<
1871  typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::type>()) +
1872  ',' + tuple_name<T, I + 1>();
1873  if (str.back() == ',')
1874  str.pop_back();
1875  return str;
1876 }
1877 
1879 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1880  object_category::tuple_value &&
1881  type_count_base<T>::value >= 2,
1882  detail::enabler>>
1883 inline std::string type_name() {
1884  auto tname = std::string(1, '[') + tuple_name<T, 0>();
1885  tname.push_back(']');
1886  return tname;
1887 }
1888 
1890 template <
1891  typename T,
1892  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::container_value ||
1893  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
1894  detail::enabler>>
1895 inline std::string type_name() {
1896  return type_name<typename T::value_type>();
1897 }
1898 
1899 // Lexical cast
1900 
1902 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
1903  detail::dummy>
1904 bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept {
1905  if (input.empty()) {
1906  return false;
1907  }
1908  char *val = nullptr;
1909  std::uint64_t output_ll = std::strtoull(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1910  output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1911  return val == (input.c_str() + input.size()) &&
1912  static_cast<std::uint64_t>(output) == output_ll;
1913 }
1914 
1916 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_signed<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
1917  detail::dummy>
1918 bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept {
1919  if (input.empty()) {
1920  return false;
1921  }
1922  char *val = nullptr;
1923  std::int64_t output_ll = std::strtoll(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1924  output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1925  return val == (input.c_str() + input.size()) &&
1926  static_cast<std::int64_t>(output) == output_ll;
1927 }
1928 
1930 inline std::int64_t to_flag_value(std::string val) {
1931  static const std::string trueString("true");
1932  static const std::string falseString("false");
1933  if (val == trueString) {
1934  return 1;
1935  }
1936  if (val == falseString) {
1937  return -1;
1938  }
1939  val = detail::to_lower(val);
1940  std::int64_t ret;
1941  if (val.size() == 1) {
1942  if (val[0] >= '1' && val[0] <= '9') {
1943  return (static_cast<std::int64_t>(val[0]) - '0');
1944  }
1945  switch (val[0]) {
1946  case '0':
1947  case 'f':
1948  case 'n':
1949  case '-':
1950  ret = -1;
1951  break;
1952  case 't':
1953  case 'y':
1954  case '+':
1955  ret = 1;
1956  break;
1957  default:
1958  throw std::invalid_argument("unrecognized character");
1959  }
1960  return ret;
1961  }
1962  if (val == trueString || val == "on" || val == "yes" || val == "enable") {
1963  ret = 1;
1964  } else if (val == falseString || val == "off" || val == "no" ||
1965  val == "disable") {
1966  ret = -1;
1967  } else {
1968  ret = std::stoll(val);
1969  }
1970  return ret;
1971 }
1972 
1974 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1975  object_category::integral_value ||
1976  classify_object<T>::value ==
1977  object_category::unsigned_integral,
1978  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1979 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1980  return integral_conversion(input, output);
1981 }
1982 
1984 template <typename T,
1985  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::char_value,
1986  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1987 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1988  if (input.size() == 1) {
1989  output = static_cast<T>(input[0]);
1990  return true;
1991  }
1992  return integral_conversion(input, output);
1993 }
1994 
1996 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
1997  object_category::boolean_value,
1998  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1999 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2000  try {
2001  auto out = to_flag_value(input);
2002  output = (out > 0);
2003  return true;
2004  } catch (const std::invalid_argument &) {
2005  return false;
2006  } catch (const std::out_of_range &) {
2007  // if the number is out of the range of a 64 bit value then it is still
2008  // a number and for this purpose is still valid all we care about the
2009  // sign
2010  output = (input[0] != '-');
2011  return true;
2012  }
2013 }
2014 
2016 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
2017  object_category::floating_point,
2018  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2019 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2020  if (input.empty()) {
2021  return false;
2022  }
2023  char *val = nullptr;
2024  auto output_ld = std::strtold(input.c_str(), &val);
2025  output = static_cast<T>(output_ld);
2026  return val == (input.c_str() + input.size());
2027 }
2028 
2030 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
2031  object_category::complex_number,
2032  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2033 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2034  using XC = typename wrapped_type<T, double>::type;
2035  XC x{0.0}, y{0.0};
2036  auto str1 = input;
2037  bool worked = false;
2038  auto nloc = str1.find_last_of("+-");
2039  if (nloc != std::string::npos && nloc > 0) {
2040  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1.substr(0, nloc), x);
2041  str1 = str1.substr(nloc);
2042  if (str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j')
2043  str1.pop_back();
2044  worked = worked && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
2045  } else {
2046  if (str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
2047  str1.pop_back();
2048  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
2049  x = XC{0};
2050  } else {
2051  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, x);
2052  y = XC{0};
2053  }
2054  }
2055  if (worked) {
2056  output = T{x, y};
2057  return worked;
2058  }
2059  return from_stream(input, output);
2060 }
2061 
2063 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
2064  object_category::string_assignable,
2065  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2066 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2067  output = input;
2068  return true;
2069 }
2070 
2072 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
2073  object_category::string_constructible,
2074  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2075 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2076  output = T(input);
2077  return true;
2078 }
2079 
2081 template <typename T,
2082  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration,
2083  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2084 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2085  typename std::underlying_type<T>::type val;
2086  if (!integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2087  return false;
2088  }
2089  output = static_cast<T>(val);
2090  return true;
2091 }
2092 
2094 template <
2095  typename T,
2096  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2097  std::is_assignable<T &, typename T::value_type>::value,
2098  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2099 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2100  typename T::value_type val;
2101  if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2102  output = val;
2103  return true;
2104  }
2105  return from_stream(input, output);
2106 }
2107 
2108 template <
2109  typename T,
2110  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2111  !std::is_assignable<T &, typename T::value_type>::value &&
2112  std::is_assignable<T &, T>::value,
2113  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2114 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2115  typename T::value_type val;
2116  if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2117  output = T{val};
2118  return true;
2119  }
2120  return from_stream(input, output);
2121 }
2122 
2124 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
2125  object_category::number_constructible,
2126  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2127 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2128  int val;
2129  if (integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2130  output = T(val);
2131  return true;
2132  } else {
2133  double dval;
2134  if (lexical_cast(input, dval)) {
2135  output = T{dval};
2136  return true;
2137  }
2138  }
2139  return from_stream(input, output);
2140 }
2141 
2143 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
2144  object_category::integer_constructible,
2145  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2146 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2147  int val;
2148  if (integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2149  output = T(val);
2150  return true;
2151  }
2152  return from_stream(input, output);
2153 }
2154 
2156 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value ==
2157  object_category::double_constructible,
2158  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2159 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2160  double val;
2161  if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2162  output = T{val};
2163  return true;
2164  }
2165  return from_stream(input, output);
2166 }
2167 
2169 template <typename T,
2170  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other &&
2171  std::is_assignable<T &, int>::value,
2172  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2173 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2174  int val;
2175  if (integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2176 #ifdef _MSC_VER
2177 #pragma warning(push)
2178 #pragma warning(disable : 4800)
2179 #endif
2180  // with Atomic<XX> this could produce a warning due to the conversion
2181  // but if atomic gets here it is an old style so will most likely still
2182  // work
2183  output = val;
2184 #ifdef _MSC_VER
2185 #pragma warning(pop)
2186 #endif
2187  return true;
2188  }
2189  // LCOV_EXCL_START
2190  // This version of cast is only used for odd cases in an older compilers the
2191  // fail over from_stream is tested elsewhere an not relevant for coverage
2192  // here
2193  return from_stream(input, output);
2194  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
2195 }
2196 
2198 template <typename T,
2199  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other &&
2200  !std::is_assignable<T &, int>::value,
2201  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2202 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2203  static_assert(is_istreamable<T>::value,
2204  "option object type must have a lexical cast overload or "
2205  "streaming input operator(>>) defined, if it "
2206  "is convertible from another type use the add_option<T, "
2207  "XC>(...) with XC being the known type");
2208  return from_stream(input, output);
2209 }
2210 
2213 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2214  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2215  (classify_object<AssignTo>::value ==
2216  object_category::string_assignable ||
2217  classify_object<AssignTo>::value ==
2218  object_category::string_constructible),
2219  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2220 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2221  return lexical_cast(input, output);
2222 }
2223 
2225 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2226  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2227  std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2228  classify_object<AssignTo>::value !=
2229  object_category::string_assignable &&
2230  classify_object<AssignTo>::value !=
2231  object_category::string_constructible,
2232  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2233 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2234  if (input.empty()) {
2235  output = AssignTo{};
2236  return true;
2237  }
2238 
2239  return lexical_cast(input, output);
2240 }
2241 
2243 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2244  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2245  !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2246  classify_object<AssignTo>::value ==
2247  object_category::wrapper_value,
2248  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2249 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2250  if (input.empty()) {
2251  typename AssignTo::value_type emptyVal{};
2252  output = emptyVal;
2253  return true;
2254  }
2255  return lexical_cast(input, output);
2256 }
2257 
2260 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2261  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2262  !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2263  classify_object<AssignTo>::value !=
2264  object_category::wrapper_value &&
2265  std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, int>::value,
2266  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2267 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2268  if (input.empty()) {
2269  output = 0;
2270  return true;
2271  }
2272  int val;
2273  if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2274  output = val;
2275  return true;
2276  }
2277  return false;
2278 }
2279 
2282 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2283  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2284  std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo &>::value,
2285  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2286 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2287  ConvertTo val{};
2288  bool parse_result =
2289  (!input.empty()) ? lexical_cast<ConvertTo>(input, val) : true;
2290  if (parse_result) {
2291  output = val;
2292  }
2293  return parse_result;
2294 }
2295 
2298 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2299  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2300  !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo &>::value &&
2301  std::is_move_assignable<AssignTo>::value,
2302  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2303 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2304  ConvertTo val{};
2305  bool parse_result =
2306  input.empty() ? true : lexical_cast<ConvertTo>(input, val);
2307  if (parse_result) {
2308  output = AssignTo(val); // use () form of constructor to allow some
2309  // implicit conversions
2310  }
2311  return parse_result;
2312 }
2313 
2315 template <
2316  typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2317  enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value <= object_category::other &&
2318  classify_object<AssignTo>::value <=
2319  object_category::wrapper_value,
2320  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2321 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings,
2322  AssignTo &output) {
2323  return lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2324 }
2325 
2328 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2329  enable_if_t<(type_count<AssignTo>::value <= 2) &&
2330  expected_count<AssignTo>::value == 1 &&
2331  is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value &&
2332  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2333  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2334 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings,
2335  AssignTo &output) {
2336  // the remove const is to handle pair types coming from a container
2337  typename std::remove_const<
2338  typename std::tuple_element<0, ConvertTo>::type>::type v1;
2339  typename std::tuple_element<1, ConvertTo>::type v2;
2340  bool retval = lexical_assign<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings[0], v1);
2341  if (strings.size() > 1) {
2342  retval = retval &&
2343  lexical_assign<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings[1], v2);
2344  }
2345  if (retval) {
2346  output = AssignTo{v1, v2};
2347  }
2348  return retval;
2349 }
2350 
2352 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2353  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2354  is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2355  type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1,
2356  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2357 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings,
2358  AssignTo &output) {
2359  output.erase(output.begin(), output.end());
2360  for (const auto &elem : strings) {
2361  typename AssignTo::value_type out;
2362  bool retval = lexical_assign<typename AssignTo::value_type,
2363  typename ConvertTo::value_type>(elem, out);
2364  if (!retval) {
2365  return false;
2366  }
2367  output.insert(output.end(), std::move(out));
2368  }
2369  return (!output.empty());
2370 }
2371 
2373 template <
2374  class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2375  enable_if_t<is_complex<ConvertTo>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2376 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings,
2377  AssignTo &output) {
2378 
2379  if (strings.size() >= 2 && !strings[1].empty()) {
2380  using XC2 = typename wrapped_type<ConvertTo, double>::type;
2381  XC2 x{0.0}, y{0.0};
2382  auto str1 = strings[1];
2383  if (str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
2384  str1.pop_back();
2385  }
2386  auto worked = detail::lexical_cast(strings[0], x) &&
2387  detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
2388  if (worked) {
2389  output = ConvertTo{x, y};
2390  }
2391  return worked;
2392  } else {
2393  return lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2394  }
2395 }
2396 
2399 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2400  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2401  (expected_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1) &&
2402  (type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1),
2403  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2404 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings,
2405  AssignTo &output) {
2406  bool retval = true;
2407  output.clear();
2408  output.reserve(strings.size());
2409  for (const auto &elem : strings) {
2410 
2411  output.emplace_back();
2412  retval =
2413  retval && lexical_assign<typename AssignTo::value_type, ConvertTo>(
2414  elem, output.back());
2415  }
2416  return (!output.empty()) && retval;
2417 }
2418 
2419 // forward declaration
2420 
2422 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2423  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2424  is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2425  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2426  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2427 bool lexical_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output);
2428 
2430 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2431  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2432  is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2433  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != 2 &&
2434  ((type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2) ||
2435  (type_count<ConvertTo>::value >
2436  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value)),
2437  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2438 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings,
2439  AssignTo &output);
2440 
2442 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2443  enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value &&
2444  is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value &&
2445  (type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value !=
2446  type_count<ConvertTo>::value ||
2447  type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2448  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2449 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings,
2450  AssignTo &output); // forward declaration
2451 
2454 template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo,
2455  enable_if_t<!is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value &&
2456  !is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2457  classify_object<ConvertTo>::value !=
2458  object_category::wrapper_value &&
2459  (is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value ||
2460  type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2461  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2462 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings,
2463  AssignTo &output) {
2464 
2465  if (strings.size() > 1 ||
2466  (!strings.empty() && !(strings.front().empty()))) {
2467  ConvertTo val;
2468  auto retval = lexical_conversion<ConvertTo, ConvertTo>(strings, val);
2469  output = AssignTo{val};
2470  return retval;
2471  }
2472  output = AssignTo{};
2473  return true;
2474 }
2475 
2478 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo, std::size_t I>
2479 inline
2480  typename std::enable_if<(I >= type_count_base<AssignTo>::value), bool>::type
2481  tuple_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &, AssignTo &) {
2482  return true;
2483 }
2484 
2487 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2488 inline typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2489  type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1,
2490  bool>::type
2491 tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2492  auto retval = lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2493  strings.erase(strings.begin());
2494  return retval;
2495 }
2496 
2499 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2500 inline typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2501  (type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 1) &&
2502  type_count<ConvertTo>::value ==
2503  type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value,
2504  bool>::type
2505 tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2506  auto retval = lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings, output);
2507  strings.erase(strings.begin(),
2508  strings.begin() + type_count<ConvertTo>::value);
2509  return retval;
2510 }
2511 
2514 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2515 inline typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value ||
2516  type_count<ConvertTo>::value !=
2517  type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value,
2518  bool>::type
2519 tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2520 
2521  std::size_t index{subtype_count_min<ConvertTo>::value};
2522  const std::size_t mx_count{subtype_count<ConvertTo>::value};
2523  const std::size_t mx{(std::max)(mx_count, strings.size())};
2524 
2525  while (index < mx) {
2526  if (is_separator(strings[index])) {
2527  break;
2528  }
2529  ++index;
2530  }
2531  bool retval = lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(
2532  std::vector<std::string>(strings.begin(),
2533  strings.begin() +
2534  static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(index)),
2535  output);
2536  strings.erase(strings.begin(),
2537  strings.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(index) + 1);
2538  return retval;
2539 }
2540 
2542 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo, std::size_t I>
2543 inline
2544  typename std::enable_if<(I < type_count_base<AssignTo>::value), bool>::type
2545  tuple_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output) {
2546  bool retval = true;
2547  using ConvertToElement = typename std::conditional<
2548  is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value,
2549  typename std::tuple_element<I, ConvertTo>::type, ConvertTo>::type;
2550  if (!strings.empty()) {
2551  retval = retval && tuple_type_conversion<
2552  typename std::tuple_element<I, AssignTo>::type,
2553  ConvertToElement>(strings, std::get<I>(output));
2554  }
2555  retval = retval && tuple_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo, I + 1>(
2556  std::move(strings), output);
2557  return retval;
2558 }
2559 
2561 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2562  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2563  is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2564  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2565  detail::enabler>>
2566 bool lexical_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output) {
2567  output.clear();
2568  while (!strings.empty()) {
2569 
2570  typename std::remove_const<typename std::tuple_element<
2571  0, typename ConvertTo::value_type>::type>::type v1;
2572  typename std::tuple_element<1, typename ConvertTo::value_type>::type v2;
2573  bool retval =
2574  tuple_type_conversion<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings, v1);
2575  if (!strings.empty()) {
2576  retval =
2577  retval &&
2578  tuple_type_conversion<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings, v2);
2579  }
2580  if (retval) {
2581  output.insert(output.end(), typename AssignTo::value_type{v1, v2});
2582  } else {
2583  return false;
2584  }
2585  }
2586  return (!output.empty());
2587 }
2588 
2591 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2592  enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value &&
2593  is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value &&
2594  (type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value !=
2595  type_count<ConvertTo>::value ||
2596  type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2597  detail::enabler>>
2598 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings,
2599  AssignTo &output) {
2600  static_assert(!is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value ||
2601  type_count_base<AssignTo>::value ==
2602  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value,
2603  "if the conversion type is defined as a tuple it must be the "
2604  "same size as the type you are converting to");
2605  return tuple_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo, 0>(strings, output);
2606 }
2607 
2610 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2611  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2612  is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2613  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != 2 &&
2614  ((type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2) ||
2615  (type_count<ConvertTo>::value >
2616  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value)),
2617  detail::enabler>>
2618 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings,
2619  AssignTo &output) {
2620  bool retval = true;
2621  output.clear();
2622  std::vector<std::string> temp;
2623  std::size_t ii{0};
2624  std::size_t icount{0};
2625  std::size_t xcm{type_count<ConvertTo>::value};
2626  auto ii_max = strings.size();
