2627  while (ii < ii_max) {
2628  temp.push_back(strings[ii]);
2629  ++ii;
2630  ++icount;
2631  if (icount == xcm || is_separator(temp.back()) || ii == ii_max) {
2632  if (static_cast<int>(xcm) > type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value &&
2633  is_separator(temp.back())) {
2634  temp.pop_back();
2635  }
2636  typename AssignTo::value_type temp_out;
2637  retval =
2638  retval && lexical_conversion<typename AssignTo::value_type,
2639  typename ConvertTo::value_type>(
2640  temp, temp_out);
2641  temp.clear();
2642  if (!retval) {
2643  return false;
2644  }
2645  output.insert(output.end(), std::move(temp_out));
2646  icount = 0;
2647  }
2648  }
2649  return retval;
2650 }
2651 
2653 template <typename AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2654  enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value ==
2655  object_category::wrapper_value &&
2656  std::is_assignable<ConvertTo &, ConvertTo>::value,
2657  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2658 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings,
2659  AssignTo &output) {
2660  if (strings.empty() || strings.front().empty()) {
2661  output = ConvertTo{};
2662  return true;
2663  }
2664  typename ConvertTo::value_type val;
2665  if (lexical_conversion<typename ConvertTo::value_type,
2666  typename ConvertTo::value_type>(strings, val)) {
2667  output = ConvertTo{val};
2668  return true;
2669  }
2670  return false;
2671 }
2672 
2674 template <typename AssignTo, class ConvertTo,
2675  enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value ==
2676  object_category::wrapper_value &&
2677  !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo>::value,
2678  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2679 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings,
2680  AssignTo &output) {
2681  using ConvertType = typename ConvertTo::value_type;
2682  if (strings.empty() || strings.front().empty()) {
2683  output = ConvertType{};
2684  return true;
2685  }
2686  ConvertType val;
2687  if (lexical_conversion<typename ConvertTo::value_type,
2688  typename ConvertTo::value_type>(strings, val)) {
2689  output = val;
2690  return true;
2691  }
2692  return false;
2693 }
2694 
2701 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
2702  detail::dummy>
2703 void sum_flag_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &flags, T &output) {
2704  std::int64_t count{0};
2705  for (auto &flag : flags) {
2706  count += detail::to_flag_value(flag);
2707  }
2708  output = (count > 0) ? static_cast<T>(count) : T{0};
2709 }
2710 
2717 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_signed<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
2718  detail::dummy>
2719 void sum_flag_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &flags, T &output) {
2720  std::int64_t count{0};
2721  for (auto &flag : flags) {
2722  count += detail::to_flag_value(flag);
2723  }
2724  output = static_cast<T>(count);
2725 }
2726 
2727 #ifdef _MSC_VER
2728 #pragma warning(push)
2729 #pragma warning(disable : 4800)
2730 #endif
2731 // with Atomic<XX> this could produce a warning due to the conversion but if
2732 // atomic gets here it is an old style so will most likely still work
2733 
2740 template <typename T,
2741  enable_if_t<!std::is_signed<T>::value && !std::is_unsigned<T>::value,
2742  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2743 void sum_flag_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &flags, T &output) {
2744  std::int64_t count{0};
2745  for (auto &flag : flags) {
2746  count += detail::to_flag_value(flag);
2747  }
2748  std::string out = detail::to_string(count);
2749  lexical_cast(out, output);
2750 }
2751 
2752 #ifdef _MSC_VER
2753 #pragma warning(pop)
2754 #endif
2755 
2756 } // namespace detail
2757 
2758 namespace detail {
2759 
2760 // Returns false if not a short option. Otherwise, sets opt name and rest and
2761 // returns true
2762 inline bool split_short(const std::string &current, std::string &name,
2763  std::string &rest) {
2764  if (current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '-' &&
2765  valid_first_char(current[1])) {
2766  name = current.substr(1, 1);
2767  rest = current.substr(2);
2768  return true;
2769  }
2770  return false;
2771 }
2772 
2773 // Returns false if not a long option. Otherwise, sets opt name and other side
2774 // of = and returns true
2775 inline bool split_long(const std::string &current, std::string &name,
2776  std::string &value) {
2777  if (current.size() > 2 && current.substr(0, 2) == "--" &&
2778  valid_first_char(current[2])) {
2779  auto loc = current.find_first_of('=');
2780  if (loc != std::string::npos) {
2781  name = current.substr(2, loc - 2);
2782  value = current.substr(loc + 1);
2783  } else {
2784  name = current.substr(2);
2785  value = "";
2786  }
2787  return true;
2788  }
2789  return false;
2790 }
2791 
2792 // Returns false if not a windows style option. Otherwise, sets opt name and
2793 // value and returns true
2794 inline bool split_windows_style(const std::string &current, std::string &name,
2795  std::string &value) {
2796  if (current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '/' &&
2797  valid_first_char(current[1])) {
2798  auto loc = current.find_first_of(':');
2799  if (loc != std::string::npos) {
2800  name = current.substr(1, loc - 1);
2801  value = current.substr(loc + 1);
2802  } else {
2803  name = current.substr(1);
2804  value = "";
2805  }
2806  return true;
2807  }
2808  return false;
2809 }
2810 
2811 // Splits a string into multiple long and short names
2812 inline std::vector<std::string> split_names(std::string current) {
2813  std::vector<std::string> output;
2814  std::size_t val;
2815  while ((val = current.find(",")) != std::string::npos) {
2816  output.push_back(trim_copy(current.substr(0, val)));
2817  current = current.substr(val + 1);
2818  }
2819  output.push_back(trim_copy(current));
2820  return output;
2821 }
2822 
2824 inline std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>>
2825 get_default_flag_values(const std::string &str) {
2826  std::vector<std::string> flags = split_names(str);
2827  flags.erase(std::remove_if(flags.begin(), flags.end(),
2828  [](const std::string &name) {
2829  return ((name.empty()) ||
2830  (!(((name.find_first_of('{') !=
2831  std::string::npos) &&
2832  (name.back() == '}')) ||
2833  (name[0] == '!'))));
2834  }),
2835  flags.end());
2836  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> output;
2837  output.reserve(flags.size());
2838  for (auto &flag : flags) {
2839  auto def_start = flag.find_first_of('{');
2840  std::string defval = "false";
2841  if ((def_start != std::string::npos) && (flag.back() == '}')) {
2842  defval = flag.substr(def_start + 1);
2843  defval.pop_back();
2844  flag.erase(def_start, std::string::npos);
2845  }
2846  flag.erase(0, flag.find_first_not_of("-!"));
2847  output.emplace_back(flag, defval);
2848  }
2849  return output;
2850 }
2851 
2853 inline std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>,
2854  std::string>
2855 get_names(const std::vector<std::string> &input) {
2856 
2857  std::vector<std::string> short_names;
2858  std::vector<std::string> long_names;
2859  std::string pos_name;
2860 
2861  for (std::string name : input) {
2862  if (name.length() == 0) {
2863  continue;
2864  }
2865  if (name.length() > 1 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] != '-') {
2866  if (name.length() == 2 && valid_first_char(name[1]))
2867  short_names.emplace_back(1, name[1]);
2868  else
2869  throw BadNameString::OneCharName(name);
2870  } else if (name.length() > 2 && name.substr(0, 2) == "--") {
2871  name = name.substr(2);
2872  if (valid_name_string(name))
2873  long_names.push_back(name);
2874  else
2875  throw BadNameString::BadLongName(name);
2876  } else if (name == "-" || name == "--") {
2877  throw BadNameString::DashesOnly(name);
2878  } else {
2879  if (pos_name.length() > 0)
2880  throw BadNameString::MultiPositionalNames(name);
2881  pos_name = name;
2882  }
2883  }
2884 
2885  return std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>,
2886  std::string>(short_names, long_names, pos_name);
2887 }
2888 
2889 } // namespace detail
2890 
2891 class App;
2892 
2894 struct ConfigItem {
2896  std::vector<std::string> parents{};
2897 
2899  std::string name{};
2900 
2902  std::vector<std::string> inputs{};
2903 
2905  std::string fullname() const {
2906  std::vector<std::string> tmp = parents;
2907  tmp.emplace_back(name);
2908  return detail::join(tmp, ".");
2909  }
2910 };
2911 
2913 class Config {
2914 protected:
2915  std::vector<ConfigItem> items{};
2916 
2917 public:
2919  virtual std::string to_config(const App *, bool, bool,
2920  std::string) const = 0;
2921 
2923  virtual std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &) const = 0;
2924 
2926  virtual std::string to_flag(const ConfigItem &item) const {
2927  if (item.inputs.size() == 1) {
2928  return item.inputs.at(0);
2929  }
2930  throw ConversionError::TooManyInputsFlag(item.fullname());
2931  }
2932 
2935  std::vector<ConfigItem> from_file(const std::string &name) {
2936  std::ifstream input{name};
2937  if (!input.good())
2938  throw FileError::Missing(name);
2939 
2940  return from_config(input);
2941  }
2942 
2944  virtual ~Config() = default;
2945 };
2946 
2948 class ConfigBase : public Config {
2949 protected:
2951  char commentChar = '#';
2953  char arrayStart = '[';
2955  char arrayEnd = ']';
2957  char arraySeparator = ',';
2959  char valueDelimiter = '=';
2961  char stringQuote = '"';
2963  char characterQuote = '\'';
2964 
2965 public:
2966  std::string to_config(const App * /*app*/, bool default_also,
2967  bool write_description,
2968  std::string prefix) const override;
2969 
2970  std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &input) const override;
2972  ConfigBase *comment(char cchar) {
2973  commentChar = cchar;
2974  return this;
2975  }
2977  ConfigBase *arrayBounds(char aStart, char aEnd) {
2978  arrayStart = aStart;
2979  arrayEnd = aEnd;
2980  return this;
2981  }
2983  ConfigBase *arrayDelimiter(char aSep) {
2984  arraySeparator = aSep;
2985  return this;
2986  }
2988  ConfigBase *valueSeparator(char vSep) {
2989  valueDelimiter = vSep;
2990  return this;
2991  }
2993  ConfigBase *quoteCharacter(char qString, char qChar) {
2994  stringQuote = qString;
2995  characterQuote = qChar;
2996  return this;
2997  }
2998 };
2999 
3001 using ConfigTOML = ConfigBase;
3002 
3004 class ConfigINI : public ConfigTOML {
3005 
3006 public:
3007  ConfigINI() {
3008  commentChar = ';';
3009  arrayStart = '\0';
3010  arrayEnd = '\0';
3011  arraySeparator = ' ';
3012  valueDelimiter = '=';
3013  }
3014 };
3015 
3016 class Option;
3017 
3019 
3027 
3029 class Validator {
3030 protected:
3032  std::function<std::string()> desc_function_{[]() { return std::string{}; }};
3033 
3036  std::function<std::string(std::string &)> func_{
3037  [](std::string &) { return std::string{}; }};
3039  std::string name_{};
3041  int application_index_ = -1;
3043  bool active_{true};
3045  bool non_modifying_{false};
3046 
3047 public:
3048  Validator() = default;
3050  explicit Validator(std::string validator_desc)
3051  : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }) {}
3053  Validator(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op,
3054  std::string validator_desc, std::string validator_name = "")
3055  : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }),
3056  func_(std::move(op)), name_(std::move(validator_name)) {}
3058  Validator &operation(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op) {
3059  func_ = std::move(op);
3060  return *this;
3061  }
3064  std::string operator()(std::string &str) const {
3065  std::string retstring;
3066  if (active_) {
3067  if (non_modifying_) {
3068  std::string value = str;
3069  retstring = func_(value);
3070  } else {
3071  retstring = func_(str);
3072  }
3073  }
3074  return retstring;
3075  }
3076 
3079  std::string operator()(const std::string &str) const {
3080  std::string value = str;
3081  return (active_) ? func_(value) : std::string{};
3082  }
3083 
3085  Validator &description(std::string validator_desc) {
3086  desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
3087  return *this;
3088  }
3090  Validator description(std::string validator_desc) const {
3091  Validator newval(*this);
3092  newval.desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
3093  return newval;
3094  }
3096  std::string get_description() const {
3097  if (active_) {
3098  return desc_function_();
3099  }
3100  return std::string{};
3101  }
3103  Validator &name(std::string validator_name) {
3104  name_ = std::move(validator_name);
3105  return *this;
3106  }
3108  Validator name(std::string validator_name) const {
3109  Validator newval(*this);
3110  newval.name_ = std::move(validator_name);
3111  return newval;
3112  }
3114  const std::string &get_name() const { return name_; }
3116  Validator &active(bool active_val = true) {
3117  active_ = active_val;
3118  return *this;
3119  }
3121  Validator active(bool active_val = true) const {
3122  Validator newval(*this);
3123  newval.active_ = active_val;
3124  return newval;
3125  }
3126 
3128  Validator &non_modifying(bool no_modify = true) {
3129  non_modifying_ = no_modify;
3130  return *this;
3131  }
3133  Validator &application_index(int app_index) {
3134  application_index_ = app_index;
3135  return *this;
3136  }
3138  Validator application_index(int app_index) const {
3139  Validator newval(*this);
3140  newval.application_index_ = app_index;
3141  return newval;
3142  }
3144  int get_application_index() const { return application_index_; }
3146  bool get_active() const { return active_; }
3147 
3150  bool get_modifying() const { return !non_modifying_; }
3151 
3154  Validator operator&(const Validator &other) const {
3155  Validator newval;
3156 
3157  newval._merge_description(*this, other, " AND ");
3158 
3159  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3160  const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f1 = func_;
3161  const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f2 =
3162  other.func_;
3163 
3164  newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
3165  std::string s1 = f1(input);
3166  std::string s2 = f2(input);
3167  if (!s1.empty() && !s2.empty())
3168  return std::string("(") + s1 + ") AND (" + s2 + ")";
3169  else
3170  return s1 + s2;
3171  };
3172 
3173  newval.active_ = (active_ & other.active_);
3174  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3175  return newval;
3176  }
3177 
3180  Validator operator|(const Validator &other) const {
3181  Validator newval;
3182 
3183  newval._merge_description(*this, other, " OR ");
3184 
3185  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3186  const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f1 = func_;
3187  const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f2 = other.func_;
3188 
3189  newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
3190  std::string s1 = f1(input);
3191  std::string s2 = f2(input);
3192  if (s1.empty() || s2.empty())
3193  return std::string();
3194 
3195  return std::string("(") + s1 + ") OR (" + s2 + ")";
3196  };
3197  newval.active_ = (active_ & other.active_);
3198  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3199  return newval;
3200  }
3201 
3203  Validator operator!() const {
3204  Validator newval;
3205  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = desc_function_;
3206  newval.desc_function_ = [dfunc1]() {
3207  auto str = dfunc1();
3208  return (!str.empty()) ? std::string("NOT ") + str : std::string{};
3209  };
3210  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3211  const std::function<std::string(std::string & res)> &f1 = func_;
3212 
3213  newval.func_ = [f1, dfunc1](std::string &test) -> std::string {
3214  std::string s1 = f1(test);
3215  if (s1.empty()) {
3216  return std::string("check ") + dfunc1() +
3217  " succeeded improperly";
3218  }
3219  return std::string{};
3220  };
3221  newval.active_ = active_;
3222  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3223  return newval;
3224  }
3225 
3226 private:
3227  void _merge_description(const Validator &val1, const Validator &val2,
3228  const std::string &merger) {
3229 
3230  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = val1.desc_function_;
3231  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc2 = val2.desc_function_;
3232 
3233  desc_function_ = [=]() {
3234  std::string f1 = dfunc1();
3235  std::string f2 = dfunc2();
3236  if ((f1.empty()) || (f2.empty())) {
3237  return f1 + f2;
3238  }
3239  return std::string(1, '(') + f1 + ')' + merger + '(' + f2 + ')';
3240  };
3241  }
3242 }; // namespace CLI
3243 
3245 class CustomValidator : public Validator {
3246 public:
3247 };
3248 // The implementation of the built in validators is using the Validator class;
3249 // the user is only expected to use the const (static) versions (since there's
3250 // no setup). Therefore, this is in detail.
3251 namespace detail {
3252 
3254 enum class path_type { nonexistent, file, directory };
3255 
3256 #if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
3257 inline path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
3259  std::error_code ec;
3260  auto stat = std::filesystem::status(file, ec);
3261  if (ec) {
3262  return path_type::nonexistent;
3263  }
3264  switch (stat.type()) {
3265  case std::filesystem::file_type::none:
3266  case std::filesystem::file_type::not_found:
3267  return path_type::nonexistent;
3268  case std::filesystem::file_type::directory:
3269  return path_type::directory;
3270  case std::filesystem::file_type::symlink:
3271  case std::filesystem::file_type::block:
3272  case std::filesystem::file_type::character:
3273  case std::filesystem::file_type::fifo:
3274  case std::filesystem::file_type::socket:
3275  case std::filesystem::file_type::regular:
3276  case std::filesystem::file_type::unknown:
3277  default:
3278  return path_type::file;
3279  }
3280 }
3281 #else
3282 inline path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
3284 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
3285  struct __stat64 buffer;
3286  if (_stat64(file, &buffer) == 0) {
3287  return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory
3288  : path_type::file;
3289  }
3290 #else
3291  struct stat buffer;
3292  if (stat(file, &buffer) == 0) {
3293  return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory
3294  : path_type::file;
3295  }
3296 #endif
3297  return path_type::nonexistent;
3298 }
3299 #endif
3300 class ExistingFileValidator : public Validator {
3302 public:
3303  ExistingFileValidator() : Validator("FILE") {
3304  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3305  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3306  if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
3307  return "File does not exist: " + filename;
3308  }
3309  if (path_result == path_type::directory) {
3310  return "File is actually a directory: " + filename;
3311  }
3312  return std::string();
3313  };
3314  }
3315 };
3316 
3318 class ExistingDirectoryValidator : public Validator {
3319 public:
3320  ExistingDirectoryValidator() : Validator("DIR") {
3321  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3322  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3323  if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
3324  return "Directory does not exist: " + filename;
3325  }
3326  if (path_result == path_type::file) {
3327  return "Directory is actually a file: " + filename;
3328  }
3329  return std::string();
3330  };
3331  }
3332 };
3333 
3335 class ExistingPathValidator : public Validator {
3336 public:
3337  ExistingPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(existing)") {
3338  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3339  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3340  if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
3341  return "Path does not exist: " + filename;
3342  }
3343  return std::string();
3344  };
3345  }
3346 };
3347 
3349 class NonexistentPathValidator : public Validator {
3350 public:
3351  NonexistentPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(non-existing)") {
3352  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3353  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3354  if (path_result != path_type::nonexistent) {
3355  return "Path already exists: " + filename;
3356  }
3357  return std::string();
3358  };
3359  }
3360 };
3361 
3363 class IPV4Validator : public Validator {
3364 public:
3365  IPV4Validator() : Validator("IPV4") {
3366  func_ = [](std::string &ip_addr) {
3367  auto result = CLI::detail::split(ip_addr, '.');
3368  if (result.size() != 4) {
3369  return std::string(
3370  "Invalid IPV4 address must have four parts (") +
3371  ip_addr + ')';
3372  }
3373  int num;
3374  for (const auto &var : result) {
3375  bool retval = detail::lexical_cast(var, num);
3376  if (!retval) {
3377  return std::string("Failed parsing number (") + var + ')';
3378  }
3379  if (num < 0 || num > 255) {
3380  return std::string(
3381  "Each IP number must be between 0 and 255 ") +
3382  var;
3383  }
3384  }
3385  return std::string();
3386  };
3387  }
3388 };
3389 
3390 } // namespace detail
3391 
3392 // Static is not needed here, because global const implies static.
3393 
3395 const detail::ExistingFileValidator ExistingFile;
3396 
3398 const detail::ExistingDirectoryValidator ExistingDirectory;
3399 
3401 const detail::ExistingPathValidator ExistingPath;
3402 
3404 const detail::NonexistentPathValidator NonexistentPath;
3405 
3407 const detail::IPV4Validator ValidIPV4;
3408 
3410 template <typename DesiredType> class TypeValidator : public Validator {
3411 public:
3412  explicit TypeValidator(const std::string &validator_name)
3413  : Validator(validator_name) {
3414  func_ = [](std::string &input_string) {
3415  auto val = DesiredType();
3416  if (!detail::lexical_cast(input_string, val)) {
3417  return std::string("Failed parsing ") + input_string +
3418  " as a " + detail::type_name<DesiredType>();
3419  }
3420  return std::string();
3421  };
3422  }
3423  TypeValidator() : TypeValidator(detail::type_name<DesiredType>()) {}
3424 };
3425 
3427 const TypeValidator<double> Number("NUMBER");
3428 
3430 class Range : public Validator {
3431 public:
3436  template <typename T>
3437  Range(T min, T max, const std::string &validator_name = std::string{})
3438  : Validator(validator_name) {
3439  if (validator_name.empty()) {
3440  std::stringstream out;
3441  out << detail::type_name<T>() << " in [" << min << " - " << max
3442  << "]";
3443  description(out.str());
3444  }
3445 
3446  func_ = [min, max](std::string &input) {
3447  T val;
3448  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
3449  if ((!converted) || (val < min || val > max))
3450  return std::string("Value ") + input + " not in range " +
3451  std::to_string(min) + " to " + std::to_string(max);
3452 
3453  return std::string();
3454  };
3455  }
3456 
3458  template <typename T>
3459  explicit Range(T max, const std::string &validator_name = std::string{})
3460  : Range(static_cast<T>(0), max, validator_name) {}
3461 };
3462 
3464 const Range NonNegativeNumber(std::numeric_limits<double>::max(),
3465  "NONNEGATIVE");
3466 
3469 const Range PositiveNumber(std::numeric_limits<double>::min(),
3470  std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), "POSITIVE");
3471 
3473 class Bound : public Validator {
3474 public:
3479  template <typename T> Bound(T min, T max) {
3480  std::stringstream out;
3481  out << detail::type_name<T>() << " bounded to [" << min << " - " << max
3482  << "]";
3483  description(out.str());
3484 
3485  func_ = [min, max](std::string &input) {
3486  T val;
3487  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
3488  if (!converted) {
3489  return std::string("Value ") + input +
3490  " could not be converted";
3491  }
3492  if (val < min)
3493  input = detail::to_string(min);
3494  else if (val > max)
3495  input = detail::to_string(max);
3496 
3497  return std::string{};
3498  };
3499  }
3500 
3502  template <typename T>
3503  explicit Bound(T max) : Bound(static_cast<T>(0), max) {}
3504 };
3505 
3506 namespace detail {
3507 template <
3508  typename T,
3509  enable_if_t<is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value,
3510  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3511 auto smart_deref(T value) -> decltype(*value) {
3512  return *value;
3513 }
3514 
3515 template <typename T,
3516  enable_if_t<
3517  !is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value,
3518  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3519 typename std::remove_reference<T>::type &smart_deref(T &value) {
3520  return value;
3521 }
3523 template <typename T> std::string generate_set(const T &set) {
3524  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3525  using iteration_type_t =
3526  typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the
3527  // object pair
3528  std::string out(1, '{');
3529  out.append(detail::join(
3530  detail::smart_deref(set),
3531  [](const iteration_type_t &v) {
3532  return detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v);
3533  },
3534  ","));
3535  out.push_back('}');
3536  return out;
3537 }
3538 
3540 template <typename T>
3541 std::string generate_map(const T &map, bool key_only = false) {
3542  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3543  using iteration_type_t =
3544  typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the
3545  // object pair
3546  std::string out(1, '{');
3547  out.append(detail::join(
3548  detail::smart_deref(map),
3549  [key_only](const iteration_type_t &v) {
3550  std::string res{
3551  detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v))};
3552 
3553  if (!key_only) {
3554  res.append("->");
3555  res += detail::to_string(
3556  detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3557  }
3558  return res;
3559  },
3560  ","));
3561  out.push_back('}');
3562  return out;
3563 }
3564 
3565 template <typename C, typename V> struct has_find {
3566  template <typename CC, typename VV>
3567  static auto test(int)
3568  -> decltype(std::declval<CC>().find(std::declval<VV>()),
3569  std::true_type());
3570  template <typename, typename>
3571  static auto test(...) -> decltype(std::false_type());
3572 
3573  static const auto value = decltype(test<C, V>(0))::value;
3574  using type = std::integral_constant<bool, value>;
3575 };
3576 
3578 template <typename T, typename V,
3579  enable_if_t<!has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3580 auto search(const T &set, const V &val)
3581  -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3582  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3583  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3584  auto it = std::find_if(
3585  std::begin(setref), std::end(setref),
3586  [&val](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
3587  return (detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v) == val);
3588  });
3589  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3590 }
3591 
3593 template <typename T, typename V,
3594  enable_if_t<has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3595 auto search(const T &set, const V &val)
3596  -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3597  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3598  auto it = setref.find(val);
3599  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3600 }
3601 
3603 template <typename T, typename V>
3604 auto search(const T &set, const V &val,
3605  const std::function<V(V)> &filter_function)
3606  -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3607  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3608  // do the potentially faster first search
3609  auto res = search(set, val);
3610  if ((res.first) || (!(filter_function))) {
3611  return res;
3612  }
3613  // if we haven't found it do the longer linear search with all the element
3614  // translations
3615  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3616  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref),
3617  [&](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
3618  V a{detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v)};
3619  a = filter_function(a);
3620  return (a == val);
3621  });
3622  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3623 }
3624 
3625 // the following suggestion was made by Nikita Ofitserov(@himikof)
3626 // done in templates to prevent compiler warnings on negation of unsigned
3627 // numbers
3628 
3630 template <typename T>
3631 inline typename std::enable_if<std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type
3632 overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
3633  if ((a > 0) == (b > 0)) {
3634  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / (std::abs)(a) <
3635  (std::abs)(b));
3636  } else {
3637  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() / (std::abs)(a) >
3638  -(std::abs)(b));
3639  }
3640 }
3642 template <typename T>
3643 inline typename std::enable_if<!std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type
3644 overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
3645  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / a < b);
3646 }
3647 
3650 template <typename T>
3651 typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value, bool>::type
3652 checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
3653  if (a == 0 || b == 0 || a == 1 || b == 1) {
3654  a *= b;
3655  return true;
3656  }
3657  if (a == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() ||
3658  b == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)()) {
3659  return false;
3660  }
3661  if (overflowCheck(a, b)) {
3662  return false;
3663  }
3664  a *= b;
3665  return true;
3666 }
3667 
3669 template <typename T>
3670 typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value, bool>::type
3671 checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
3672  T c = a * b;
3673  if (std::isinf(c) && !std::isinf(a) && !std::isinf(b)) {
3674  return false;
3675  }
3676  a = c;
3677  return true;
3678 }
3679 
3680 } // namespace detail
3682 class IsMember : public Validator {
3683 public:
3684  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3685 
3687  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3688  IsMember(std::initializer_list<T> values, Args &&... args)
3689  : IsMember(std::vector<T>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3690 
3692  template <typename T>
3693  explicit IsMember(T &&set) : IsMember(std::forward<T>(set), nullptr) {}
3694 
3698  template <typename T, typename F>
3699  explicit IsMember(T set, F filter_function) {
3700 
3701  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have
3702  // ::value_type if the type does not have first_type and second_type,
3703  // these are both value_type
3704  using element_t =
3705  typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers
3706  // if needed
3707  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<
3708  element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3709 
3710  using local_item_t =
3711  typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // This will convert bad types
3712  // to good ones (const char *
3713  // to std::string)
3714 
3715  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if
3716  // not one already
3717  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3718 
3719  // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of
3720  // the set contents
3721  desc_function_ = [set]() {
3722  return detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set));
3723  };
3724 
3725  // This is the function that validates
3726  // It stores a copy of the set pointer-like, so shared_ptr will stay
3727  // alive
3728  func_ = [set, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3729  local_item_t b;
3730  if (!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
3731  throw ValidationError(input); // name is added later
3732  }
3733  if (filter_fn) {
3734  b = filter_fn(b);
3735  }
3736  auto res = detail::search(set, b, filter_fn);
3737  if (res.first) {
3738  // Make sure the version in the input string is identical to the
3739  // one in the set
3740  if (filter_fn) {
3741  input = detail::value_string(
3742  detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(*(res.second)));
3743  }
3744 
3745  // Return empty error string (success)
3746  return std::string{};
3747  }
3748 
3749  // If you reach this point, the result was not found
3750  return input + " not in " +
3751  detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set));
3752  };
3753  }
3754 
3757  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3758  IsMember(T &&set, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2,
3759  Args &&... other)
3760  : IsMember(
3761  std::forward<T>(set),
3762  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) {
3763  return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a));
3764  },
3765  other...) {}
3766 };
3767 
3769 template <typename T>
3770 using TransformPairs = std::vector<std::pair<std::string, T>>;
3771 
3773 class Transformer : public Validator {
3774 public:
3775  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3776 
3778  template <typename... Args>
3779  Transformer(
3780  std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values,
3781  Args &&... args)
3782  : Transformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values),
3783  std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3784 
3786  template <typename T>
3787  explicit Transformer(T &&mapping)
3788  : Transformer(std::forward<T>(mapping), nullptr) {}
3789 
3793  template <typename T, typename F>
3794  explicit Transformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
3795 
3796  static_assert(
3797  detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
3798  "mapping must produce value pairs");
3799  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have
3800  // ::value_type if the type does not have first_type and second_type,
3801  // these are both value_type
3802  using element_t =
3803  typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers
3804  // if needed
3805  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<
3806  element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3807  using local_item_t =
3808  typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to
3809  // good ones (const char * to
3810  // std::string)
3811 
3812  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if
3813  // not one already
3814  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3815 
3816  // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of
3817  // the set contents
3818  desc_function_ = [mapping]() {
3819  return detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping));
3820  };
3821 
3822  func_ = [mapping, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3823  local_item_t b;
3824  if (!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
3825  return std::string();
3826  // there is no possible way we can match anything in the mapping
3827  // if we can't convert so just return
3828  }
3829  if (filter_fn) {
3830  b = filter_fn(b);
3831  }
3832  auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
3833  if (res.first) {
3834  input = detail::value_string(
3835  detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
3836  }
3837  return std::string{};
3838  };
3839  }
3840 
3842  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3843  Transformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2,
3844  Args &&... other)
3845  : Transformer(
3846  std::forward<T>(mapping),
3847  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) {
3848  return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a));
3849  },
3850  other...) {}
3851 };
3852 
3854 class CheckedTransformer : public Validator {
3855 public:
3856  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3857 
3859  template <typename... Args>
3860  CheckedTransformer(
3861  std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values,
3862  Args &&... args)
3863  : CheckedTransformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values),
3864  std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3865 
3867  template <typename T>
3868  explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping)
3869  : CheckedTransformer(std::move(mapping), nullptr) {}
3870 
3874  template <typename T, typename F>
3875  explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
3876 
3877  static_assert(
3878  detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
3879  "mapping must produce value pairs");
3880  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have
3881  // ::value_type if the type does not have first_type and second_type,
3882  // these are both value_type
3883  using element_t =
3884  typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers
3885  // if needed
3886  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<
3887  element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3888  using local_item_t =
3889  typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to
3890  // good ones (const char * to
3891  // std::string)
3892  using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<
3893  element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
3894 
3895  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if
3896  // not one already
3897  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3898 
3899  auto tfunc = [mapping]() {
3900  std::string out("value in ");
3901  out += detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)) + " OR {";
3902  out += detail::join(
3903  detail::smart_deref(mapping),
3904  [](const iteration_type_t &v) {
3905  return detail::to_string(
3906  detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3907  },
3908  ",");
3909  out.push_back('}');
3910  return out;
3911  };
3912 
3913  desc_function_ = tfunc;
3914 
3915  func_ = [mapping, tfunc, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3916  local_item_t b;
3917  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, b);
3918  if (converted) {
3919  if (filter_fn) {
3920  b = filter_fn(b);
3921  }
3922  auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
3923  if (res.first) {
3924  input = detail::value_string(
3925  detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
3926  return std::string{};
3927  }
3928  }
3929  for (const auto &v : detail::smart_deref(mapping)) {
3930  auto output_string = detail::value_string(
3931  detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3932  if (output_string == input) {
3933  return std::string();
3934  }
3935  }
3936 
3937  return "Check " + input + " " + tfunc() + " FAILED";
3938  };
3939  }
3940 
3942  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3943  CheckedTransformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1,
3944  filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&... other)
3945  : CheckedTransformer(
3946  std::forward<T>(mapping),
3947  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) {
3948  return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a));
3949  },
3950  other...) {}
3951 };
3952 
3954 inline std::string ignore_case(std::string item) {
3955  return detail::to_lower(item);
3956 }
3957 
3960 inline std::string ignore_underscore(std::string item) {
3961  return detail::remove_underscore(item);
3962 }
3963 
3966 inline std::string ignore_space(std::string item) {
3967  item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), ' '),
3968  std::end(item));
3969  item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), '\t'),
3970  std::end(item));
3971  return item;
3972 }
3973 
3985 class AsNumberWithUnit : public Validator {
3986 public:
3991  enum Options {
3992  CASE_SENSITIVE = 0,
3993  CASE_INSENSITIVE = 1,
3994  UNIT_OPTIONAL = 0,
3995  UNIT_REQUIRED = 2,
3996  DEFAULT = CASE_INSENSITIVE | UNIT_OPTIONAL
3997  };
3998 
3999  template <typename Number>
4000  explicit AsNumberWithUnit(std::map<std::string, Number> mapping,
4001  Options opts = DEFAULT,
4002  const std::string &unit_name = "UNIT") {
4003  description(generate_description<Number>(unit_name, opts));
4004  validate_mapping(mapping, opts);
4005 
4006  // transform function
4007  func_ = [mapping, opts](std::string &input) -> std::string {
4008  Number num;
4009 
4010  detail::rtrim(input);
4011  if (input.empty()) {
4012  throw ValidationError("Input is empty");
4013  }
4014 
4015  // Find split position between number and prefix
4016  auto unit_begin = input.end();
4017  while (unit_begin > input.begin() &&
4018  std::isalpha(*(unit_begin - 1), std::locale())) {
4019  --unit_begin;
4020  }
4021 
4022  std::string unit{unit_begin, input.end()};
4023  input.resize(static_cast<std::size_t>(
4024  std::distance(input.begin(), unit_begin)));
4025  detail::trim(input);
4026 
4027  if (opts & UNIT_REQUIRED && unit.empty()) {
4028  throw ValidationError("Missing mandatory unit");
4029  }
4030  if (opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
4031  unit = detail::to_lower(unit);
4032  }
4033  if (unit.empty()) {
4034  if (!detail::lexical_cast(input, num)) {
4035  throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input +
4036  " could not be converted to " +
4037  detail::type_name<Number>());
4038  }
4039  // No need to modify input if no unit passed
4040  return {};
4041  }
4042 
4043  // find corresponding factor
4044  auto it = mapping.find(unit);
4045  if (it == mapping.end()) {
4046  throw ValidationError(unit +
4047  " unit not recognized. "
4048  "Allowed values: " +
4049  detail::generate_map(mapping, true));
4050  }
4051 
4052  if (!input.empty()) {
4053  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, num);
4054  if (!converted) {
4055  throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input +
4056  " could not be converted to " +
4057  detail::type_name<Number>());
4058  }
4059  // perform safe multiplication
4060  bool ok = detail::checked_multiply(num, it->second);
4061  if (!ok) {
4062  throw ValidationError(detail::to_string(num) +
4063  " multiplied by " + unit +
4064  " factor would cause number "
4065  "overflow. Use smaller value.");
4066  }
4067  } else {
4068  num = static_cast<Number>(it->second);
4069  }
4070 
4071  input = detail::to_string(num);
4072 
4073  return {};
4074  };
4075  }
4076 
4077 private:
4080  template <typename Number>
4081  static void validate_mapping(std::map<std::string, Number> &mapping,
4082  Options opts) {
4083  for (auto &kv : mapping) {
4084  if (kv.first.empty()) {
4085  throw ValidationError("Unit must not be empty.");
4086  }
4087  if (!detail::isalpha(kv.first)) {
4088  throw ValidationError("Unit must contain only letters.");
4089  }
4090  }
4091 
4092  // make all units lowercase if CASE_INSENSITIVE
4093  if (opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
4094  std::map<std::string, Number> lower_mapping;
4095  for (auto &kv : mapping) {
4096  auto s = detail::to_lower(kv.first);
4097  if (lower_mapping.count(s)) {
4098  throw ValidationError(
4099  std::string("Several matching lowercase unit "
4100  "representations are found: ") +
4101  s);
4102  }
4103  lower_mapping[detail::to_lower(kv.first)] = kv.second;
4104  }
4105  mapping = std::move(lower_mapping);
4106  }
4107  }
4108 
4110  template <typename Number>
4111  static std::string generate_description(const std::string &name,
4112  Options opts) {
4113  std::stringstream out;
4114  out << detail::type_name<Number>() << ' ';
4115  if (opts & UNIT_REQUIRED) {
4116  out << name;
4117  } else {
4118  out << '[' << name << ']';
4119  }
4120  return out.str();
4121  }
4122 };
4123 
4133 class AsSizeValue : public AsNumberWithUnit {
4134 public:
4135  using result_t = std::uint64_t;
4136 
4144  explicit AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000)
4145  : AsNumberWithUnit(get_mapping(kb_is_1000)) {
4146  if (kb_is_1000) {
4147  description("SIZE [b, kb(=1000b), kib(=1024b), ...]");
4148  } else {
4149  description("SIZE [b, kb(=1024b), ...]");
4150  }
4151  }
4152 
4153 private:
4155  static std::map<std::string, result_t> init_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
4156  std::map<std::string, result_t> m;
4157  result_t k_factor = kb_is_1000 ? 1000 : 1024;
4158  result_t ki_factor = 1024;
4159  result_t k = 1;
4160  result_t ki = 1;
4161  m["b"] = 1;
4162  for (std::string p : {"k", "m", "g", "t", "p", "e"}) {
4163  k *= k_factor;
4164  ki *= ki_factor;
4165  m[p] = k;
4166  m[p + "b"] = k;
4167  m[p + "i"] = ki;
4168  m[p + "ib"] = ki;
4169  }
4170  return m;
4171  }
4172 
4174  static std::map<std::string, result_t> get_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
4175  if (kb_is_1000) {
4176  static auto m = init_mapping(true);
4177  return m;
4178  } else {
4179  static auto m = init_mapping(false);
4180  return m;
4181  }
4182  }
4183 };
4184 
4185 namespace detail {
4190 inline std::pair<std::string, std::string>
4191 split_program_name(std::string commandline) {
4192  // try to determine the programName
4193  std::pair<std::string, std::string> vals;
4194  trim(commandline);
4195  auto esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4196  while (detail::check_path(commandline.substr(0, esp).c_str()) !=
4197  path_type::file) {
4198  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', esp + 1);
4199  if (esp == std::string::npos) {
4200  // if we have reached the end and haven't found a valid file just
4201  // assume the first argument is the program name
4202  if (commandline[0] == '"' || commandline[0] == '\'' ||
4203  commandline[0] == '`') {
4204  bool embeddedQuote = false;
4205  auto keyChar = commandline[0];
4206  auto end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
4207  while ((end != std::string::npos) &&
4208  (commandline[end - 1] ==
4209  '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
4210  end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
4211  embeddedQuote = true;
4212  }
4213  if (end != std::string::npos) {
4214  vals.first = commandline.substr(1, end - 1);
4215  esp = end + 1;
4216  if (embeddedQuote) {
4217  vals.first = find_and_replace(
4218  vals.first, std::string("\\") + keyChar,
4219  std::string(1, keyChar));
4220  embeddedQuote = false;
4221  }
4222  } else {
4223  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4224  }
4225  } else {
4226  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4227  }
4228 
4229  break;
4230  }
4231  }
4232  if (vals.first.empty()) {
4233  vals.first = commandline.substr(0, esp);
4234  rtrim(vals.first);
4235  }
4236 
4237  // strip the program name
4238  vals.second = (esp != std::string::npos) ? commandline.substr(esp + 1)
4239  : std::string{};
4240  ltrim(vals.second);
4241  return vals;
4242 }
4243 
4244 } // namespace detail
4246 
4247 class Option;
4248 class App;
4249 
4254 
4255 enum class AppFormatMode {
4256  Normal,
4257  All,
4258  Sub,
4259 };
4260 
4265 class FormatterBase {
4266 protected:
4269 
4271  std::size_t column_width_{30};
4272 
4275  std::map<std::string, std::string> labels_{};
4276 
4280 
4281 public:
4282  FormatterBase() = default;
4283  FormatterBase(const FormatterBase &) = default;
4284  FormatterBase(FormatterBase &&) = default;
4285 
4287  virtual ~FormatterBase() noexcept {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4288 
4290  virtual std::string make_help(const App *, std::string,
4291  AppFormatMode) const = 0;
4292 
4296 
4298  void label(std::string key, std::string val) { labels_[key] = val; }
4299 
4301  void column_width(std::size_t val) { column_width_ = val; }
4302 
4306 
4308  std::string get_label(std::string key) const {
4309  if (labels_.find(key) == labels_.end())
4310  return key;
4311  else
4312  return labels_.at(key);
4313  }
4314 
4316  std::size_t get_column_width() const { return column_width_; }
4317 
4319 };
4320 
4322 class FormatterLambda final : public FormatterBase {
4323  using funct_t =
4324  std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)>;
4325 
4327  funct_t lambda_;
4328 
4329 public:
4331  explicit FormatterLambda(funct_t funct) : lambda_(std::move(funct)) {}
4332 
4334  ~FormatterLambda() noexcept override {
4335  } // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4336 
4338  std::string make_help(const App *app, std::string name,
4339  AppFormatMode mode) const override {
4340  return lambda_(app, name, mode);
4341  }
4342 };
4343 
4347 class Formatter : public FormatterBase {
4348 public:
4349  Formatter() = default;
4350  Formatter(const Formatter &) = default;
4351  Formatter(Formatter &&) = default;
4352 
4355 
4358  virtual std::string make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional,
4359  std::vector<const Option *> opts) const;
4360 
4362  virtual std::string make_positionals(const App *app) const;
4363 
4365  std::string make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
4366 
4368  virtual std::string make_subcommands(const App *app,
4369  AppFormatMode mode) const;
4370 
4372  virtual std::string make_subcommand(const App *sub) const;
4373 
4375  virtual std::string make_expanded(const App *sub) const;
4376 
4378  virtual std::string make_footer(const App *app) const;
4379 
4381  virtual std::string make_description(const App *app) const;
4382 
4384  virtual std::string make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const;
4385 
4387  std::string make_help(const App * /*app*/, std::string,
4388  AppFormatMode) const override;
4389 
4393 
4395  virtual std::string make_option(const Option *opt,
4396  bool is_positional) const {
4397  std::stringstream out;
4398  detail::format_help(
4399  out, make_option_name(opt, is_positional) + make_option_opts(opt),
4400  make_option_desc(opt), column_width_);
4401  return out.str();
4402  }
4403 
4405  virtual std::string make_option_name(const Option *, bool) const;
4406 
4409  virtual std::string make_option_opts(const Option *) const;
4410 
4413  virtual std::string make_option_desc(const Option *) const;
4414 
4416  virtual std::string make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const;
4417 
4419 };
4420 
4421 using results_t = std::vector<std::string>;
4423 using callback_t = std::function<bool(const results_t &)>;
4424 
4425 class Option;
4426 class App;
4427 
4428 using Option_p = std::unique_ptr<Option>;
4430 enum class MultiOptionPolicy : char {
4431  Throw,
4432  TakeLast,
4433  TakeFirst,
4434  Join,
4435  TakeAll
4437 };
4438 
4442 template <typename CRTP> class OptionBase {
4443  friend App;
4444 
4445 protected:
4447  std::string group_ = std::string("Options");
4448 
4450  bool required_{false};
4451 
4453  bool ignore_case_{false};
4454 
4456  bool ignore_underscore_{false};
4457 
4459  bool configurable_{true};
4460 
4462  bool disable_flag_override_{false};
4463 
4465  char delimiter_{'\0'};
4466 
4468  bool always_capture_default_{false};
4469 
4471  MultiOptionPolicy multi_option_policy_{MultiOptionPolicy::Throw};
4472 
4474  template <typename T> void copy_to(T *other) const {
4475  other->group(group_);
4476  other->required(required_);
4477  other->ignore_case(ignore_case_);
4478  other->ignore_underscore(ignore_underscore_);
4479  other->configurable(configurable_);
4480  other->disable_flag_override(disable_flag_override_);
4481  other->delimiter(delimiter_);
4482  other->always_capture_default(always_capture_default_);
4483  other->multi_option_policy(multi_option_policy_);
4484  }
4485 
4486 public:
4487  // setters
4488 
4490  CRTP *group(const std::string &name) {
4491  group_ = name;
4492  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4493  }
4494 
4496  CRTP *required(bool value = true) {
4497  required_ = value;
4498  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4499  }
4500 
4502  CRTP *mandatory(bool value = true) { return required(value); }
4503 
4504  CRTP *always_capture_default(bool value = true) {
4505  always_capture_default_ = value;
4506  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4507  }
4508 
4509  // Getters
4510 
4512  const std::string &get_group() const { return group_; }
4513 
4515  bool get_required() const { return required_; }
4516 
4518  bool get_ignore_case() const { return ignore_case_; }
4519 
4521  bool get_ignore_underscore() const { return ignore_underscore_; }
4522 
4524  bool get_configurable() const { return configurable_; }
4525 
4527  bool get_disable_flag_override() const { return disable_flag_override_; }
4528 
4530  char get_delimiter() const { return delimiter_; }
4531 
4534  bool get_always_capture_default() const { return always_capture_default_; }
4535 
4537  MultiOptionPolicy get_multi_option_policy() const {
4538  return multi_option_policy_;
4539  }
4540 
4541  // Shortcuts for multi option policy
4542 
4544  CRTP *take_last() {
4545  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4546  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
4547  return self;
4548  }
4549 
4551  CRTP *take_first() {
4552  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4553  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst);
4554  return self;
4555  }
4556 
4558  CRTP *take_all() {
4559  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4560  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
4561  return self;
4562  }
4563 
4565  CRTP *join() {
4566  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4567  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
4568  return self;
4569  }
4570 
4572  CRTP *join(char delim) {
4573  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4574  self->delimiter_ = delim;
4575  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
4576  return self;
4577  }
4578 
4580  CRTP *configurable(bool value = true) {
4581  configurable_ = value;
4582  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4583  }
4584 
4586  CRTP *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
4587  delimiter_ = value;
4588  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4589  }
4590 };
4591 
4594 class OptionDefaults : public OptionBase<OptionDefaults> {
4595 public:
4596  OptionDefaults() = default;
4597 
4598  // Methods here need a different implementation if they are Option vs.
4599  // OptionDefault
4600 
4602  OptionDefaults *
4603  multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
4604  multi_option_policy_ = value;
4605  return this;
4606  }
4607 
4609  OptionDefaults *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
4610  ignore_case_ = value;
4611  return this;
4612  }
4613 
4615  OptionDefaults *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
4616  ignore_underscore_ = value;
4617  return this;
4618  }
4619 
4621  OptionDefaults *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
4622  disable_flag_override_ = value;
4623  return this;
4624  }
4625 
4628  OptionDefaults *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
4629  delimiter_ = value;
4630  return this;
4631  }
4632 };
4633 
4634 class Option : public OptionBase<Option> {
4635  friend App;
4636 
4637 protected:
4640 
4642  std::vector<std::string> snames_{};
4643 
4645  std::vector<std::string> lnames_{};
4646 
4650  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> default_flag_values_{};
4651 
4653  std::vector<std::string> fnames_{};
4654 
4656  std::string pname_{};
4657 
4659  std::string envname_{};
4660 
4664 
4666  std::string description_{};
4667 
4670  std::string default_str_{};
4671 
4674  std::string option_text_{};
4675 
4680  std::function<std::string()> type_name_{[]() { return std::string(); }};
4681 
4683  std::function<std::string()> default_function_{};
4684 
4688 
4691  int type_size_max_{1};
4693  int type_size_min_{1};
4694 
4696  int expected_min_{1};
4698  int expected_max_{1};
4699 
4701  std::vector<Validator> validators_{};
4702 
4704  std::set<Option *> needs_{};
4705 
4707  std::set<Option *> excludes_{};
4708 
4712 
4714  App *parent_{nullptr};
4715 
4717  callback_t callback_{};
4718 
4722 
4724  results_t results_{};
4726  results_t proc_results_{};
4728  enum class option_state : char {
4729  parsing = 0,
4730  validated = 2,
4731  reduced = 4,
4732  callback_run = 6,
4733  };
4735  option_state current_option_state_{option_state::parsing};
4737  bool allow_extra_args_{false};
4739  bool flag_like_{false};
4741  bool run_callback_for_default_{false};
4744  bool inject_separator_{false};
4746 
4749  Option(std::string option_name, std::string option_description,
4750  callback_t callback, App *parent)
4751  : description_(std::move(option_description)), parent_(parent),
4752  callback_(std::move(callback)) {
4753  std::tie(snames_, lnames_, pname_) =
4754  detail::get_names(detail::split_names(option_name));
4755  }
4756 
4757 public:
4760 
4761  Option(const Option &) = delete;
4762  Option &operator=(const Option &) = delete;
4763 
4765  std::size_t count() const { return results_.size(); }
4766 
4768  bool empty() const { return results_.empty(); }
4769 
4771  explicit operator bool() const { return !empty(); }
4772 
4774  void clear() {
4775  results_.clear();
4776  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4777  }
4778 
4782 
4784  Option *expected(int value) {
4785  if (value < 0) {
4786  expected_min_ = -value;
4787  if (expected_max_ < expected_min_) {
4788  expected_max_ = expected_min_;
4789  }
4790  allow_extra_args_ = true;
4791  flag_like_ = false;
4792  } else if (value == detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
4793  expected_min_ = 1;
4794  expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4795  allow_extra_args_ = true;
4796  flag_like_ = false;
4797  } else {
4798  expected_min_ = value;
4799  expected_max_ = value;
4800  flag_like_ = (expected_min_ == 0);
4801  }
4802  return this;
4803  }
4804 
4806  Option *expected(int value_min, int value_max) {
4807  if (value_min < 0) {
4808  value_min = -value_min;
4809  }
4810 
4811  if (value_max < 0) {
4812  value_max = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4813  }
4814  if (value_max < value_min) {
4815  expected_min_ = value_max;
4816  expected_max_ = value_min;
4817  } else {
4818  expected_max_ = value_max;
4819  expected_min_ = value_min;
4820  }
4821 
4822  return this;
4823  }
4826  Option *allow_extra_args(bool value = true) {
4827  allow_extra_args_ = value;
4828  return this;
4829  }
4831  bool get_allow_extra_args() const { return allow_extra_args_; }
4832 
4836  Option *run_callback_for_default(bool value = true) {
4837  run_callback_for_default_ = value;
4838  return this;
4839  }
4841  bool get_run_callback_for_default() const {
4842  return run_callback_for_default_;
4843  }
4844 
4846  Option *check(Validator validator, const std::string &validator_name = "") {
4847  validator.non_modifying();
4848  validators_.push_back(std::move(validator));
4849  if (!validator_name.empty())
4850  validators_.back().name(validator_name);
4851  return this;
4852  }
4853 
4856  Option *check(std::function<std::string(const std::string &)> Validator,
4857  std::string Validator_description = "",
4858  std::string Validator_name = "") {
4859  validators_.emplace_back(Validator, std::move(Validator_description),
4860  std::move(Validator_name));
4861  validators_.back().non_modifying();
4862  return this;
4863  }
4864 
4866  Option *transform(Validator Validator,
4867  const std::string &Validator_name = "") {
4868  validators_.insert(validators_.begin(), std::move(Validator));
4869  if (!Validator_name.empty())
4870  validators_.front().name(Validator_name);
4871  return this;
4872  }
4873 
4875  Option *transform(const std::function<std::string(std::string)> &func,
4876  std::string transform_description = "",
4877  std::string transform_name = "") {
4878  validators_.insert(validators_.begin(),
4879  Validator(
4880  [func](std::string &val) {
4881  val = func(val);
4882  return std::string{};
4883  },
4884  std::move(transform_description),
4885  std::move(transform_name)));
4886 
4887  return this;
4888  }
4889 
4892  Option *each(const std::function<void(std::string)> &func) {
4893  validators_.emplace_back(
4894  [func](std::string &inout) {
4895  func(inout);
4896  return std::string{};
4897  },
4898  std::string{});
4899  return this;
4900  }
4902  Validator *get_validator(const std::string &Validator_name = "") {
4903  for (auto &Validator : validators_) {
4904  if (Validator_name == Validator.get_name()) {
4905  return &Validator;
4906  }
4907  }
4908  if ((Validator_name.empty()) && (!validators_.empty())) {
4909  return &(validators_.front());
4910  }
4911  throw OptionNotFound(std::string{"Validator "} + Validator_name +
4912  " Not Found");
4913  }
4914 
4916  Validator *get_validator(int index) {
4917  // This is an signed int so that it is not equivalent to a pointer.
4918  if (index >= 0 && index < static_cast<int>(validators_.size())) {
4919  return &(validators_[static_cast<decltype(validators_)::size_type>(
4920  index)]);
4921  }
4922  throw OptionNotFound("Validator index is not valid");
4923  }
4924 
4926  Option *needs(Option *opt) {
4927  if (opt != this) {
4928  needs_.insert(opt);
4929  }
4930  return this;
4931  }
4932 
4934  template <typename T = App> Option *needs(std::string opt_name) {
4935  auto opt = static_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
4936  if (opt == nullptr) {
4937  throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
4938  }
4939  return needs(opt);
4940  }
4941 
4943  template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG>
4944  Option *needs(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
4945  needs(opt);
4946  return needs(opt1, args...);
4947  }
4948 
4951  bool remove_needs(Option *opt) {
4952  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(needs_), std::end(needs_), opt);
4953 
4954  if (iterator == std::end(needs_)) {
4955  return false;
4956  }
4957  needs_.erase(iterator);
4958  return true;
4959  }
4960 
4962  Option *excludes(Option *opt) {
4963  if (opt == this) {
4964  throw(IncorrectConstruction("and option cannot exclude itself"));
4965  }
4966  excludes_.insert(opt);
4967 
4968  // Help text should be symmetric - excluding a should exclude b
4969  opt->excludes_.insert(this);
4970 
4971  // Ignoring the insert return value, excluding twice is now allowed.
4972  // (Mostly to allow both directions to be excluded by user, even though
4973  // the library does it for you.)
4974 
4975  return this;
4976  }
4977 
4979  template <typename T = App> Option *excludes(std::string opt_name) {
4980  auto opt = static_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
4981  if (opt == nullptr) {
4982  throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
4983  }
4984  return excludes(opt);
4985  }
4986 
4988  template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG>
4989  Option *excludes(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
4990  excludes(opt);
4991  return excludes(opt1, args...);
4992  }
4993 
4996  bool remove_excludes(Option *opt) {
4997  auto iterator =
4998  std::find(std::begin(excludes_), std::end(excludes_), opt);
4999 
5000  if (iterator == std::end(excludes_)) {
5001  return false;
5002  }
5003  excludes_.erase(iterator);
5004  return true;
5005  }
5006 
5008  Option *envname(std::string name) {
5009  envname_ = std::move(name);
5010  return this;
5011  }
5012 
5017  template <typename T = App> Option *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
5018  if (!ignore_case_ && value) {
5019  ignore_case_ = value;
5020  auto *parent = static_cast<T *>(parent_);
5021  for (const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
5022  if (opt.get() == this) {
5023  continue;
5024  }
5025  auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
5026  if (!omatch.empty()) {
5027  ignore_case_ = false;
5028  throw OptionAlreadyAdded(
5029  "adding ignore case caused a name conflict with " +
5030  omatch);
5031  }
5032  }
5033  } else {
5034  ignore_case_ = value;
5035  }
5036  return this;
5037  }
5038 
5043  template <typename T = App> Option *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
5044 
5045  if (!ignore_underscore_ && value) {
5046  ignore_underscore_ = value;
5047  auto *parent = static_cast<T *>(parent_);
5048  for (const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
5049  if (opt.get() == this) {
5050  continue;
5051  }
5052  auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
5053  if (!omatch.empty()) {
5054  ignore_underscore_ = false;
5055  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore underscore caused "
5056  "a name conflict with " +
5057  omatch);
5058  }
5059  }
5060  } else {
5061  ignore_underscore_ = value;
5062  }
5063  return this;
5064  }
5065 
5067  Option *
5068  multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
5069  if (value != multi_option_policy_) {
5070  if (multi_option_policy_ == MultiOptionPolicy::Throw &&
5071  expected_max_ == detail::expected_max_vector_size &&
5072  expected_min_ >
5073  1) { // this bizarre condition is to maintain backwards
5074  // compatibility with the previous behavior of
5075  // expected_ with vectors
5076  expected_max_ = expected_min_;
5077  }
5078  multi_option_policy_ = value;
5079  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5080  }
5081  return this;
5082  }
5083 
5085  Option *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
5086  disable_flag_override_ = value;
5087  return this;
5088  }
5092 
5094  int get_type_size() const { return type_size_min_; }
5095 
5097  int get_type_size_min() const { return type_size_min_; }
5099  int get_type_size_max() const { return type_size_max_; }
5100 
5102  int get_inject_separator() const { return inject_separator_; }
5103 
5105  std::string get_envname() const { return envname_; }
5106 
5108  std::set<Option *> get_needs() const { return needs_; }
5109 
5111  std::set<Option *> get_excludes() const { return excludes_; }
5112 
5114  std::string get_default_str() const { return default_str_; }
5115 
5117  callback_t get_callback() const { return callback_; }
5118 
5120  const std::vector<std::string> &get_lnames() const { return lnames_; }
5121 
5123  const std::vector<std::string> &get_snames() const { return snames_; }
5124 
5126  const std::vector<std::string> &get_fnames() const { return fnames_; }
5128  const std::string &get_single_name() const {
5129  if (!lnames_.empty()) {
5130  return lnames_[0];
5131  }
5132  if (!pname_.empty()) {
5133  return pname_;
5134  }
5135  if (!snames_.empty()) {
5136  return snames_[0];
5137  }
5138  return envname_;
5139  }
5141  int get_expected() const { return expected_min_; }
5142 
5144  int get_expected_min() const { return expected_min_; }
5146  int get_expected_max() const { return expected_max_; }
5147 
5149  int get_items_expected_min() const {
5150  return type_size_min_ * expected_min_;
5151  }
5152 
5155  int get_items_expected_max() const {
5156  int t = type_size_max_;
5157  return detail::checked_multiply(t, expected_max_)
5158  ? t
5159  : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5160  }
5162  int get_items_expected() const { return get_items_expected_min(); }
5163 
5165  bool get_positional() const { return pname_.length() > 0; }
5166 
5168  bool nonpositional() const { return (snames_.size() + lnames_.size()) > 0; }
5169 
5171  bool has_description() const { return description_.length() > 0; }
5172 
5174  const std::string &get_description() const { return description_; }
5175 
5177  Option *description(std::string option_description) {
5178  description_ = std::move(option_description);
5179  return this;
5180  }
5181 
5182  Option *option_text(std::string text) {
5183  option_text_ = std::move(text);
5184  return this;
5185  }
5186 
5187  const std::string &get_option_text() const { return option_text_; }
5188 
5192 
5197  std::string get_name(bool positional = false,
5198  bool all_options = false
5199  ) const {
5200  if (get_group().empty())
5201  return {}; // Hidden
5202 
5203  if (all_options) {
5204 
5205  std::vector<std::string> name_list;
5206 
5209  if ((positional && (!pname_.empty())) ||
5210  (snames_.empty() && lnames_.empty())) {
5211  name_list.push_back(pname_);
5212  }
5213  if ((get_items_expected() == 0) && (!fnames_.empty())) {
5214  for (const std::string &sname : snames_) {
5215  name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
5216  if (check_fname(sname)) {
5217  name_list.back() +=
5218  "{" + get_flag_value(sname, "") + "}";
5219  }
5220  }
5221 
5222  for (const std::string &lname : lnames_) {
5223  name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
5224  if (check_fname(lname)) {
5225  name_list.back() +=
5226  "{" + get_flag_value(lname, "") + "}";
5227  }
5228  }
5229  } else {
5230  for (const std::string &sname : snames_)
5231  name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
5232 
5233  for (const std::string &lname : lnames_)
5234  name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
5235  }
5236 
5237  return detail::join(name_list);
5238  }
5239 
5240  // This returns the positional name no matter what
5241  if (positional)
5242  return pname_;
5243 
5244  // Prefer long name
5245  if (!lnames_.empty())
5246  return std::string(2, '-') + lnames_[0];
5247 
5248  // Or short name if no long name
5249  if (!snames_.empty())
5250  return std::string(1, '-') + snames_[0];
5251 
5252  // If positional is the only name, it's okay to use that
5253  return pname_;
5254  }
5255 
5259 
5261  void run_callback() {
5262 
5263  if (current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
5264  _validate_results(results_);
5265  current_option_state_ = option_state::validated;
5266  }
5267 
5268  if (current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
5269  _reduce_results(proc_results_, results_);
5270  current_option_state_ = option_state::reduced;
5271  }
5272  if (current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced) {
5273  current_option_state_ = option_state::callback_run;
5274  if (!(callback_)) {
5275  return;
5276  }
5277  const results_t &send_results =
5278  proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
5279  bool local_result = callback_(send_results);
5280 
5281  if (!local_result)
5282  throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
5283  }
5284  }
5285 
5287  const std::string &matching_name(const Option &other) const {
5288  static const std::string estring;
5289  for (const std::string &sname : snames_)
5290  if (other.check_sname(sname))
5291  return sname;
5292  for (const std::string &lname : lnames_)
5293  if (other.check_lname(lname))
5294  return lname;
5295 
5296  if (ignore_case_ ||
5297  ignore_underscore_) { // We need to do the inverse, in case we are
5298  // ignore_case or ignore underscore
5299  for (const std::string &sname : other.snames_)
5300  if (check_sname(sname))
5301  return sname;
5302  for (const std::string &lname : other.lnames_)
5303  if (check_lname(lname))
5304  return lname;
5305  }
5306  return estring;
5307  }
5310  bool operator==(const Option &other) const {
5311  return !matching_name(other).empty();
5312  }
5313 
5316  bool check_name(const std::string &name) const {
5317 
5318  if (name.length() > 2 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] == '-')
5319  return check_lname(name.substr(2));
5320  if (name.length() > 1 && name.front() == '-')
5321  return check_sname(name.substr(1));
5322  if (!pname_.empty()) {
5323  std::string local_pname = pname_;
5324  std::string local_name = name;
5325  if (ignore_underscore_) {
5326  local_pname = detail::remove_underscore(local_pname);
5327  local_name = detail::remove_underscore(local_name);
5328  }
5329  if (ignore_case_) {
5330  local_pname = detail::to_lower(local_pname);
5331  local_name = detail::to_lower(local_name);
5332  }
5333  if (local_name == local_pname) {
5334  return true;
5335  }
5336  }
5337 
5338  if (!envname_.empty()) {
5339  // this needs to be the original since envname_ shouldn't match on
5340  // case insensitivity
5341  return (name == envname_);
5342  }
5343  return false;
5344  }
5345 
5347  bool check_sname(std::string name) const {
5348  return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), snames_, ignore_case_) >=
5349  0);
5350  }
5351 
5353  bool check_lname(std::string name) const {
5354  return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), lnames_, ignore_case_,
5355  ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
5356  }
5357 
5359  bool check_fname(std::string name) const {
5360  if (fnames_.empty()) {
5361  return false;
5362  }
5363  return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), fnames_, ignore_case_,
5364  ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
5365  }
5366 
5369  std::string get_flag_value(const std::string &name,
5370  std::string input_value) const {
5371  static const std::string trueString{"true"};
5372  static const std::string falseString{"false"};
5373  static const std::string emptyString{"{}"};
5374  // check for disable flag override_
5375  if (disable_flag_override_) {
5376  if (!((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString))) {
5377  auto default_ind = detail::find_member(
5378  name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
5379  if (default_ind >= 0) {
5380  // We can static cast this to std::size_t because it is more
5381  // than 0 in this block
5382  if (default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(
5383  default_ind)]
5384  .second != input_value) {
5385  throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
5386  }
5387  } else {
5388  if (input_value != trueString) {
5389  throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
5390  }
5391  }
5392  }
5393  }
5394  auto ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_,
5395  ignore_underscore_);
5396  if ((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString)) {
5397  if (flag_like_) {
5398  return (ind < 0)
5399  ? trueString
5400  : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)]
5401  .second;
5402  } else {
5403  return (ind < 0)
5404  ? default_str_
5405  : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)]
5406  .second;
5407  }
5408  }
5409  if (ind < 0) {
5410  return input_value;
5411  }
5412  if (default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second ==
5413  falseString) {
5414  try {
5415  auto val = detail::to_flag_value(input_value);
5416  return (val == 1)
5417  ? falseString
5418  : (val == (-1) ? trueString : std::to_string(-val));
5419  } catch (const std::invalid_argument &) {
5420  return input_value;
5421  }
5422  } else {
5423  return input_value;
5424  }
5425  }
5426 
5428  Option *add_result(std::string s) {
5429  _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
5430  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5431  return this;
5432  }
5433 
5436  Option *add_result(std::string s, int &results_added) {
5437  results_added = _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
5438  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5439  return this;
5440  }
5441 
5443  Option *add_result(std::vector<std::string> s) {
5444  for (auto &str : s) {
5445  _add_result(std::move(str), results_);
5446  }
5447  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5448  return this;
5449  }
5450 
5452  const results_t &results() const { return results_; }
5453 
5455  results_t reduced_results() const {
5456  results_t res = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
5457  if (current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
5458  if (current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
5459  res = results_;
5460  _validate_results(res);
5461  }
5462  if (!res.empty()) {
5463  results_t extra;
5464  _reduce_results(extra, res);
5465  if (!extra.empty()) {
5466  res = std::move(extra);
5467  }
5468  }
5469  }
5470  return res;
5471  }
5472 
5474  template <typename T> void results(T &output) const {
5475  bool retval;
5476  if (current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced ||
5477  (results_.size() == 1 && validators_.empty())) {
5478  const results_t &res =
5479  (proc_results_.empty()) ? results_ : proc_results_;
5480  retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
5481  } else {
5482  results_t res;
5483  if (results_.empty()) {
5484  if (!default_str_.empty()) {
5485  // _add_results takes an rvalue only
5486  _add_result(std::string(default_str_), res);
5487  _validate_results(res);
5488  results_t extra;
5489  _reduce_results(extra, res);
5490  if (!extra.empty()) {
5491  res = std::move(extra);
5492  }
5493  } else {
5494  res.emplace_back();
5495  }
5496  } else {
5497  res = reduced_results();
5498  }
5499  retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
5500  }
5501  if (!retval) {
5502  throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
5503  }
5504  }
5505 
5507  template <typename T> T as() const {
5508  T output;
5509  results(output);
5510  return output;
5511  }
5512 
5514  bool get_callback_run() const {
5515  return (current_option_state_ == option_state::callback_run);
5516  }
5517 
5521 
5523  Option *type_name_fn(std::function<std::string()> typefun) {
5524  type_name_ = std::move(typefun);
5525  return this;
5526  }
5527 
5529  Option *type_name(std::string typeval) {
5530  type_name_fn([typeval]() { return typeval; });
5531  return this;
5532  }
5533 
5535  Option *type_size(int option_type_size) {
5536  if (option_type_size < 0) {
5537  // this section is included for backwards compatibility
5538  type_size_max_ = -option_type_size;
5539  type_size_min_ = -option_type_size;
5540  expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5541  } else {
5542  type_size_max_ = option_type_size;
5543  if (type_size_max_ < detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
5544  type_size_min_ = option_type_size;
5545  } else {
5546  inject_separator_ = true;
5547  }
5548  if (type_size_max_ == 0)
5549  required_ = false;
5550  }
5551  return this;
5552  }
5554  Option *type_size(int option_type_size_min, int option_type_size_max) {
5555  if (option_type_size_min < 0 || option_type_size_max < 0) {
5556  // this section is included for backwards compatibility
5557  expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5558  option_type_size_min = (std::abs)(option_type_size_min);
5559  option_type_size_max = (std::abs)(option_type_size_max);
5560  }
5561 
5562  if (option_type_size_min > option_type_size_max) {
5563  type_size_max_ = option_type_size_min;
5564  type_size_min_ = option_type_size_max;
5565  } else {
5566  type_size_min_ = option_type_size_min;
5567  type_size_max_ = option_type_size_max;
5568  }
5569  if (type_size_max_ == 0) {
5570  required_ = false;
5571  }
5572  if (type_size_max_ >= detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
5573  inject_separator_ = true;
5574  }
5575  return this;
5576  }
5577 
5579  void inject_separator(bool value = true) { inject_separator_ = value; }
5580 
5582  Option *default_function(const std::function<std::string()> &func) {
5583  default_function_ = func;
5584  return this;
5585  }
5586 
5589  Option *capture_default_str() {
5590  if (default_function_) {
5591  default_str_ = default_function_();
5592  }
5593  return this;
5594  }
5595 
5598  Option *default_str(std::string val) {
5599  default_str_ = std::move(val);
5600  return this;
5601  }
5602 
5606  template <typename X> Option *default_val(const X &val) {
5607  std::string val_str = detail::to_string(val);
5608  auto old_option_state = current_option_state_;
5609  results_t old_results{std::move(results_)};
5610  results_.clear();
5611  try {
5612  add_result(val_str);
5613  if (run_callback_for_default_) {
5614  run_callback(); // run callback sets the state we need to reset
5615  // it again
5616  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5617  } else {
5618  _validate_results(results_);
5619  current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
5620  }
5621  } catch (const CLI::Error &) {
5622  // this should be done
5623  results_ = std::move(old_results);
5624  current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
5625  throw;
5626  }
5627  results_ = std::move(old_results);
5628  default_str_ = std::move(val_str);
5629  return this;
5630  }
5631 
5633  std::string get_type_name() const {
5634  std::string full_type_name = type_name_();
5635  if (!validators_.empty()) {
5636  for (auto &Validator : validators_) {
5637  std::string vtype = Validator.get_description();
5638  if (!vtype.empty()) {
5639  full_type_name += ":" + vtype;
5640  }
5641  }
5642  }
5643  return full_type_name;
5644  }
5645 
5646 private:
5648  void _validate_results(results_t &res) const {
5649  // Run the Validators (can change the string)
5650  if (!validators_.empty()) {
5651  if (type_size_max_ >
5652  1) { // in this context index refers to the index in the type
5653  int index = 0;
5654  if (get_items_expected_max() < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
5655  multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
5656  // create a negative index for the earliest ones
5657  index =
5658  get_items_expected_max() - static_cast<int>(res.size());
5659  }
5660 
5661  for (std::string &result : res) {
5662  if (detail::is_separator(result) &&
5663  type_size_max_ != type_size_min_ && index >= 0) {
5664  index = 0; // reset index for variable size chunks
5665  continue;
5666  }
5667  auto err_msg = _validate(
5668  result,
5669  (index >= 0) ? (index % type_size_max_) : index);
5670  if (!err_msg.empty())
5671  throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
5672  ++index;
5673  }
5674  } else {
5675  int index = 0;
5676  if (expected_max_ < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
5677  multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
5678  // create a negative index for the earliest ones
5679  index = expected_max_ - static_cast<int>(res.size());
5680  }
5681  for (std::string &result : res) {
5682  auto err_msg = _validate(result, index);
5683  ++index;
5684  if (!err_msg.empty())
5685  throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
5686  }
5687  }
5688  }
5689  }
5690 
5694  void _reduce_results(results_t &res, const results_t &original) const {
5695 
5696  // max num items expected or length of vector, always at least 1
5697  // Only valid for a trimming policy
5698 
5699  res.clear();
