5700  // Operation depends on the policy setting
5701  switch (multi_option_policy_) {
5702  case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll:
5703  break;
5704  case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast: {
5705  // Allow multi-option sizes (including 0)
5706  std::size_t trim_size =
5707  std::min<std::size_t>(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(
5708  get_items_expected_max(), 1)),
5709  original.size());
5710  if (original.size() != trim_size) {
5711  res.assign(
5712  original.end() -
5713  static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size),
5714  original.end());
5715  }
5716  } break;
5717  case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst: {
5718  std::size_t trim_size =
5719  std::min<std::size_t>(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(
5720  get_items_expected_max(), 1)),
5721  original.size());
5722  if (original.size() != trim_size) {
5723  res.assign(
5724  original.begin(),
5725  original.begin() +
5726  static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size));
5727  }
5728  } break;
5729  case MultiOptionPolicy::Join:
5730  if (results_.size() > 1) {
5731  res.push_back(detail::join(
5732  original,
5733  std::string(1, (delimiter_ == '\0') ? '\n' : delimiter_)));
5734  }
5735  break;
5736  case MultiOptionPolicy::Throw:
5737  default: {
5738  auto num_min = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_min());
5739  auto num_max = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_max());
5740  if (num_min == 0) {
5741  num_min = 1;
5742  }
5743  if (num_max == 0) {
5744  num_max = 1;
5745  }
5746  if (original.size() < num_min) {
5747  throw ArgumentMismatch::AtLeast(
5748  get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_min), original.size());
5749  }
5750  if (original.size() > num_max) {
5751  throw ArgumentMismatch::AtMost(
5752  get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_max), original.size());
5753  }
5754  break;
5755  }
5756  }
5757  }
5758 
5759  // Run a result through the Validators
5760  std::string _validate(std::string &result, int index) const {
5761  std::string err_msg;
5762  if (result.empty() && expected_min_ == 0) {
5763  // an empty with nothing expected is allowed
5764  return err_msg;
5765  }
5766  for (const auto &vali : validators_) {
5767  auto v = vali.get_application_index();
5768  if (v == -1 || v == index) {
5769  try {
5770  err_msg = vali(result);
5771  } catch (const ValidationError &err) {
5772  err_msg = err.what();
5773  }
5774  if (!err_msg.empty())
5775  break;
5776  }
5777  }
5778 
5779  return err_msg;
5780  }
5781 
5783  int _add_result(std::string &&result, std::vector<std::string> &res) const {
5784  int result_count = 0;
5785  if (allow_extra_args_ && !result.empty() && result.front() == '[' &&
5786  result.back() == ']') { // this is now a vector string likely from
5787  // the default or user entry
5788  result.pop_back();
5789 
5790  for (auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result.substr(1), ',')) {
5791  if (!var.empty()) {
5792  result_count += _add_result(std::move(var), res);
5793  }
5794  }
5795  return result_count;
5796  }
5797  if (delimiter_ == '\0') {
5798  res.push_back(std::move(result));
5799  ++result_count;
5800  } else {
5801  if ((result.find_first_of(delimiter_) != std::string::npos)) {
5802  for (const auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result, delimiter_)) {
5803  if (!var.empty()) {
5804  res.push_back(var);
5805  ++result_count;
5806  }
5807  }
5808  } else {
5809  res.push_back(std::move(result));
5810  ++result_count;
5811  }
5812  }
5813  return result_count;
5814  }
5815 }; // namespace CLI
5816 
5817 #ifndef CLI11_PARSE
5818 #define CLI11_PARSE(app, argc, argv) \
5819  try { \
5820  (app).parse((argc), (argv)); \
5821  } catch (const CLI::ParseError &e) { \
5822  return (app).exit(e); \
5823  }
5824 #endif
5825 
5826 namespace detail {
5827 enum class Classifier {
5828  NONE,
5829  POSITIONAL_MARK,
5830  SHORT,
5831  LONG,
5832  WINDOWS_STYLE,
5833  SUBCOMMAND,
5834  SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR
5835 };
5836 struct AppFriend;
5837 } // namespace detail
5838 
5839 namespace FailureMessage {
5840 std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e);
5841 std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e);
5842 } // namespace FailureMessage
5843 
5845 
5846 enum class config_extras_mode : char { error = 0, ignore, capture };
5847 
5848 class App;
5849 
5850 using App_p = std::shared_ptr<App>;
5851 
5852 class Option_group;
5854 
5859 class App {
5860  friend Option;
5861  friend detail::AppFriend;
5862 
5863 protected:
5864  // This library follows the Google style guide for member names ending in
5865  // underscores
5866 
5869 
5871  std::string name_{};
5872 
5874  std::string description_{};
5875 
5877  bool allow_extras_{false};
5878 
5882  config_extras_mode allow_config_extras_{config_extras_mode::ignore};
5883 
5886  bool prefix_command_{false};
5887 
5890  bool has_automatic_name_{false};
5891 
5894  bool required_{false};
5895 
5898  bool disabled_{false};
5899 
5901  bool pre_parse_called_{false};
5902 
5906  bool immediate_callback_{false};
5907 
5909  std::function<void(std::size_t)> pre_parse_callback_{};
5910 
5912  std::function<void()> parse_complete_callback_{};
5913 
5915  std::function<void()> final_callback_{};
5916 
5920 
5922  OptionDefaults option_defaults_{};
5923 
5925  std::vector<Option_p> options_{};
5926 
5930 
5932  std::string footer_{};
5933 
5936  std::function<std::string()> footer_callback_{};
5937 
5939  Option *help_ptr_{nullptr};
5940 
5942  Option *help_all_ptr_{nullptr};
5943 
5945  Option *version_ptr_{nullptr};
5946 
5949  std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> formatter_{new Formatter()};
5950 
5952  std::function<std::string(const App *, const Error &e)> failure_message_{
5953  FailureMessage::simple};
5954 
5958 
5959  using missing_t = std::vector<std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>>;
5960 
5966  missing_t missing_{};
5967 
5969  std::vector<Option *> parse_order_{};
5970 
5972  std::vector<App *> parsed_subcommands_{};
5973 
5975  std::set<App *> exclude_subcommands_{};
5976 
5979  std::set<Option *> exclude_options_{};
5980 
5984  std::set<App *> need_subcommands_{};
5985 
5988  std::set<Option *> need_options_{};
5989 
5993 
5995  std::vector<App_p> subcommands_{};
5996 
5998  bool ignore_case_{false};
5999 
6001  bool ignore_underscore_{false};
6002 
6005  bool fallthrough_{false};
6006 
6009  bool allow_windows_style_options_{
6010 #ifdef _WIN32
6011  true
6012 #else
6013  false
6014 #endif
6015  };
6018  bool positionals_at_end_{false};
6019 
6020  enum class startup_mode : char { stable, enabled, disabled };
6023  startup_mode default_startup{startup_mode::stable};
6024 
6027  bool configurable_{false};
6028 
6031  bool validate_positionals_{false};
6032 
6035  bool silent_{false};
6036 
6038  std::uint32_t parsed_{0U};
6039 
6041  std::size_t require_subcommand_min_{0};
6042 
6045  std::size_t require_subcommand_max_{0};
6046 
6048  std::size_t require_option_min_{0};
6049 
6051  std::size_t require_option_max_{0};
6052 
6054  App *parent_{nullptr};
6055 
6057  std::string group_{"Subcommands"};
6058 
6060  std::vector<std::string> aliases_{};
6061 
6065 
6067  Option *config_ptr_{nullptr};
6068 
6071  std::shared_ptr<Config> config_formatter_{new ConfigTOML()};
6072 
6074 
6076  App(std::string app_description, std::string app_name, App *parent)
6077  : name_(std::move(app_name)), description_(std::move(app_description)),
6078  parent_(parent) {
6079  // Inherit if not from a nullptr
6080  if (parent_ != nullptr) {
6081  if (parent_->help_ptr_ != nullptr)
6082  set_help_flag(parent_->help_ptr_->get_name(false, true),
6083  parent_->help_ptr_->get_description());
6084  if (parent_->help_all_ptr_ != nullptr)
6085  set_help_all_flag(parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_name(false, true),
6086  parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_description());
6087 
6089  option_defaults_ = parent_->option_defaults_;
6090 
6091  // INHERITABLE
6092  failure_message_ = parent_->failure_message_;
6093  allow_extras_ = parent_->allow_extras_;
6094  allow_config_extras_ = parent_->allow_config_extras_;
6095  prefix_command_ = parent_->prefix_command_;
6096  immediate_callback_ = parent_->immediate_callback_;
6097  ignore_case_ = parent_->ignore_case_;
6098  ignore_underscore_ = parent_->ignore_underscore_;
6099  fallthrough_ = parent_->fallthrough_;
6100  validate_positionals_ = parent_->validate_positionals_;
6101  configurable_ = parent_->configurable_;
6102  allow_windows_style_options_ =
6103  parent_->allow_windows_style_options_;
6104  group_ = parent_->group_;
6105  footer_ = parent_->footer_;
6106  formatter_ = parent_->formatter_;
6107  config_formatter_ = parent_->config_formatter_;
6108  require_subcommand_max_ = parent_->require_subcommand_max_;
6109  }
6110  }
6111 
6112 public:
6115 
6118  explicit App(std::string app_description = "", std::string app_name = "")
6119  : App(app_description, app_name, nullptr) {
6120  set_help_flag("-h,--help", "Print this help message and exit");
6121  }
6122 
6123  App(const App &) = delete;
6124  App &operator=(const App &) = delete;
6125 
6127  virtual ~App() = default;
6128 
6136  App *callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
6137  if (immediate_callback_) {
6138  parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
6139  } else {
6140  final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
6141  }
6142  return this;
6143  }
6144 
6147  App *final_callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
6148  final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
6149  return this;
6150  }
6151 
6154  App *parse_complete_callback(std::function<void()> pc_callback) {
6155  parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(pc_callback);
6156  return this;
6157  }
6158 
6161  App *preparse_callback(std::function<void(std::size_t)> pp_callback) {
6162  pre_parse_callback_ = std::move(pp_callback);
6163  return this;
6164  }
6165 
6167  App *name(std::string app_name = "") {
6168 
6169  if (parent_ != nullptr) {
6170  auto oname = name_;
6171  name_ = app_name;
6172  auto &res =
6173  _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
6174  if (!res.empty()) {
6175  name_ = oname;
6176  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(
6177  app_name + " conflicts with existing subcommand names"));
6178  }
6179  } else {
6180  name_ = app_name;
6181  }
6182  has_automatic_name_ = false;
6183  return this;
6184  }
6185 
6187  App *alias(std::string app_name) {
6188  if (!detail::valid_name_string(app_name)) {
6189  if (app_name.empty()) {
6190  throw IncorrectConstruction("Empty aliases are not allowed");
6191  }
6192  if (!detail::valid_first_char(app_name[0])) {
6193  throw IncorrectConstruction(
6194  "Alias starts with invalid character, allowed characters "
6195  "are [a-zA-z0-9]+'_','?','@' ");
6196  }
6197  for (auto c : app_name) {
6198  if (!detail::valid_later_char(c)) {
6199  throw IncorrectConstruction(
6200  std::string("Alias contains invalid character ('") + c +
6201  "'), allowed characters are "
6202  "[a-zA-z0-9]+'_','?','@','.','-' ");
6203  }
6204  }
6205  }
6206 
6207  if (parent_ != nullptr) {
6208  aliases_.push_back(app_name);
6209  auto &res =
6210  _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
6211  if (!res.empty()) {
6212  aliases_.pop_back();
6213  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(
6214  "alias already matches an existing subcommand: " +
6215  app_name));
6216  }
6217  } else {
6218  aliases_.push_back(app_name);
6219  }
6220 
6221  return this;
6222  }
6223 
6225  App *allow_extras(bool allow = true) {
6226  allow_extras_ = allow;
6227  return this;
6228  }
6229 
6231  App *required(bool require = true) {
6232  required_ = require;
6233  return this;
6234  }
6235 
6237  App *disabled(bool disable = true) {
6238  disabled_ = disable;
6239  return this;
6240  }
6241 
6243  App *silent(bool silence = true) {
6244  silent_ = silence;
6245  return this;
6246  }
6247 
6250  App *disabled_by_default(bool disable = true) {
6251  if (disable) {
6252  default_startup = startup_mode::disabled;
6253  } else {
6254  default_startup = (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled)
6255  ? startup_mode::enabled
6256  : startup_mode::stable;
6257  }
6258  return this;
6259  }
6260 
6263  App *enabled_by_default(bool enable = true) {
6264  if (enable) {
6265  default_startup = startup_mode::enabled;
6266  } else {
6267  default_startup = (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled)
6268  ? startup_mode::disabled
6269  : startup_mode::stable;
6270  }
6271  return this;
6272  }
6273 
6276  App *immediate_callback(bool immediate = true) {
6277  immediate_callback_ = immediate;
6278  if (immediate_callback_) {
6279  if (final_callback_ && !(parse_complete_callback_)) {
6280  std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
6281  }
6282  } else if (!(final_callback_) && parse_complete_callback_) {
6283  std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
6284  }
6285  return this;
6286  }
6287 
6289  App *validate_positionals(bool validate = true) {
6290  validate_positionals_ = validate;
6291  return this;
6292  }
6293 
6295  App *allow_config_extras(bool allow = true) {
6296  if (allow) {
6297  allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::capture;
6298  allow_extras_ = true;
6299  } else {
6300  allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::error;
6301  }
6302  return this;
6303  }
6304 
6306  App *allow_config_extras(config_extras_mode mode) {
6307  allow_config_extras_ = mode;
6308  return this;
6309  }
6310 
6312  App *prefix_command(bool allow = true) {
6313  prefix_command_ = allow;
6314  return this;
6315  }
6316 
6318  App *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
6319  if (value && !ignore_case_) {
6320  ignore_case_ = true;
6321  auto *p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
6322  auto &match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
6323  if (!match.empty()) {
6324  ignore_case_ =
6325  false; // we are throwing so need to be exception invariant
6326  throw OptionAlreadyAdded(
6327  "ignore case would cause subcommand name conflicts: " +
6328  match);
6329  }
6330  }
6331  ignore_case_ = value;
6332  return this;
6333  }
6334 
6337  App *allow_windows_style_options(bool value = true) {
6338  allow_windows_style_options_ = value;
6339  return this;
6340  }
6341 
6344  App *positionals_at_end(bool value = true) {
6345  positionals_at_end_ = value;
6346  return this;
6347  }
6348 
6350  App *configurable(bool value = true) {
6351  configurable_ = value;
6352  return this;
6353  }
6354 
6356  App *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
6357  if (value && !ignore_underscore_) {
6358  ignore_underscore_ = true;
6359  auto *p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
6360  auto &match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
6361  if (!match.empty()) {
6362  ignore_underscore_ = false;
6363  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("ignore underscore would cause "
6364  "subcommand name conflicts: " +
6365  match);
6366  }
6367  }
6368  ignore_underscore_ = value;
6369  return this;
6370  }
6371 
6373  App *formatter(std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> fmt) {
6374  formatter_ = fmt;
6375  return this;
6376  }
6377 
6379  App *formatter_fn(
6380  std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)>
6381  fmt) {
6382  formatter_ = std::make_shared<FormatterLambda>(fmt);
6383  return this;
6384  }
6385 
6387  App *config_formatter(std::shared_ptr<Config> fmt) {
6388  config_formatter_ = fmt;
6389  return this;
6390  }
6391 
6394  bool parsed() const { return parsed_ > 0; }
6395 
6397  OptionDefaults *option_defaults() { return &option_defaults_; }
6398 
6402 
6418  Option *add_option(std::string option_name, callback_t option_callback,
6419  std::string option_description = "",
6420  bool defaulted = false,
6421  std::function<std::string()> func = {}) {
6422  Option myopt{option_name, option_description, option_callback, this};
6423 
6424  if (std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
6425  [&myopt](const Option_p &v) { return *v == myopt; }) ==
6426  std::end(options_)) {
6427  options_.emplace_back();
6428  Option_p &option = options_.back();
6429  option.reset(new Option(option_name, option_description,
6430  option_callback, this));
6431 
6432  // Set the default string capture function
6433  option->default_function(func);
6434 
6435  // For compatibility with CLI11 1.7 and before, capture the default
6436  // string here
6437  if (defaulted)
6438  option->capture_default_str();
6439 
6440  // Transfer defaults to the new option
6441  option_defaults_.copy_to(option.get());
6442 
6443  // Don't bother to capture if we already did
6444  if (!defaulted && option->get_always_capture_default())
6445  option->capture_default_str();
6446 
6447  return option.get();
6448  }
6449  // we know something matches now find what it is so we can produce more
6450  // error information
6451  for (auto &opt : options_) {
6452  auto &matchname = opt->matching_name(myopt);
6453  if (!matchname.empty()) {
6454  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(
6455  "added option matched existing option name: " + matchname));
6456  }
6457  }
6458  // this line should not be reached the above loop should trigger the
6459  // throw
6460  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(
6461  "added option matched existing option name")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
6462  }
6463 
6465  template <typename AssignTo, typename ConvertTo = AssignTo,
6466  enable_if_t<!std::is_const<ConvertTo>::value, detail::enabler> =
6467  detail::dummy>
6468  Option *add_option(std::string option_name,
6469  AssignTo &variable,
6470  std::string option_description = "") {
6471 
6472  auto fun = [&variable](
6473  const CLI::results_t &res) { // comment for spacing
6474  return detail::lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(res,
6475  variable);
6476  };
6477 
6478  Option *opt = add_option(
6479  option_name, fun, option_description, false, [&variable]() {
6480  return CLI::detail::checked_to_string<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(
6481  variable);
6482  });
6483  opt->type_name(detail::type_name<ConvertTo>());
6484  // these must be actual lvalues since (std::max) sometimes is defined in
6485  // terms of references and references to structs used in the evaluation
6486  // can be temporary so that would cause issues.
6487  auto Tcount = detail::type_count<AssignTo>::value;
6488  auto XCcount = detail::type_count<ConvertTo>::value;
6489  opt->type_size(detail::type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value,
6490  (std::max)(Tcount, XCcount));
6491  opt->expected(detail::expected_count<ConvertTo>::value);
6492  opt->run_callback_for_default();
6493  return opt;
6494  }
6495 
6497  template <typename AssignTo, enable_if_t<!std::is_const<AssignTo>::value,
6498  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6499  Option *add_option_no_stream(std::string option_name,
6500  AssignTo &variable,
6501  std::string option_description = "") {
6502 
6503  auto fun =
6504  [&variable](const CLI::results_t &res) { // comment for spacing
6505  return detail::lexical_conversion<AssignTo, AssignTo>(res,
6506  variable);
6507  };
6508 
6509  Option *opt = add_option(option_name, fun, option_description, false,
6510  []() { return std::string{}; });
6511  opt->type_name(detail::type_name<AssignTo>());
6512  opt->type_size(detail::type_count_min<AssignTo>::value,
6513  detail::type_count<AssignTo>::value);
6514  opt->expected(detail::expected_count<AssignTo>::value);
6515  opt->run_callback_for_default();
6516  return opt;
6517  }
6518 
6520  template <typename ArgType>
6521  Option *add_option_function(std::string option_name,
6522  const std::function<void(const ArgType &)>
6523  &func,
6524  std::string option_description = "") {
6525 
6526  auto fun = [func](const CLI::results_t &res) {
6527  ArgType variable;
6528  bool result =
6529  detail::lexical_conversion<ArgType, ArgType>(res, variable);
6530  if (result) {
6531  func(variable);
6532  }
6533  return result;
6534  };
6535 
6536  Option *opt =
6537  add_option(option_name, std::move(fun), option_description, false);
6538  opt->type_name(detail::type_name<ArgType>());
6539  opt->type_size(detail::type_count_min<ArgType>::value,
6540  detail::type_count<ArgType>::value);
6541  opt->expected(detail::expected_count<ArgType>::value);
6542  return opt;
6543  }
6544 
6546  Option *add_option(std::string option_name) {
6547  return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t{}, std::string{}, false);
6548  }
6549 
6551  template <typename T,
6552  enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value &&
6553  std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value,
6554  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6555  Option *add_option(std::string option_name, T &option_description) {
6556  return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t(), option_description,
6557  false);
6558  }
6559 
6561  Option *set_help_flag(std::string flag_name = "",
6562  const std::string &help_description = "") {
6563  // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to
6564  // assign to help_description
6565  if (help_ptr_ != nullptr) {
6566  remove_option(help_ptr_);
6567  help_ptr_ = nullptr;
6568  }
6569 
6570  // Empty name will simply remove the help flag
6571  if (!flag_name.empty()) {
6572  help_ptr_ = add_flag(flag_name, help_description);
6573  help_ptr_->configurable(false);
6574  }
6575 
6576  return help_ptr_;
6577  }
6578 
6580  Option *set_help_all_flag(std::string help_name = "",
6581  const std::string &help_description = "") {
6582  // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to
6583  // assign to flag_description
6584  if (help_all_ptr_ != nullptr) {
6585  remove_option(help_all_ptr_);
6586  help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
6587  }
6588 
6589  // Empty name will simply remove the help all flag
6590  if (!help_name.empty()) {
6591  help_all_ptr_ = add_flag(help_name, help_description);
6592  help_all_ptr_->configurable(false);
6593  }
6594 
6595  return help_all_ptr_;
6596  }
6597 
6600  Option *
6601  set_version_flag(std::string flag_name = "",
6602  const std::string &versionString = "",
6603  const std::string &version_help =
6604  "Display program version information and exit") {
6605  // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to
6606  // assign to version_description
6607  if (version_ptr_ != nullptr) {
6608  remove_option(version_ptr_);
6609  version_ptr_ = nullptr;
6610  }
6611 
6612  // Empty name will simply remove the version flag
6613  if (!flag_name.empty()) {
6614  version_ptr_ = add_flag_callback(
6615  flag_name,
6616  [versionString]() {
6617  throw(CLI::CallForVersion(versionString, 0));
6618  },
6619  version_help);
6620  version_ptr_->configurable(false);
6621  }
6622 
6623  return version_ptr_;
6624  }
6626  Option *
6627  set_version_flag(std::string flag_name, std::function<std::string()> vfunc,
6628  const std::string &version_help =
6629  "Display program version information and exit") {
6630  if (version_ptr_ != nullptr) {
6631  remove_option(version_ptr_);
6632  version_ptr_ = nullptr;
6633  }
6634 
6635  // Empty name will simply remove the version flag
6636  if (!flag_name.empty()) {
6637  version_ptr_ = add_flag_callback(
6638  flag_name,
6639  [vfunc]() { throw(CLI::CallForVersion(vfunc(), 0)); },
6640  version_help);
6641  version_ptr_->configurable(false);
6642  }
6643 
6644  return version_ptr_;
6645  }
6646 
6647 private:
6649  Option *_add_flag_internal(std::string flag_name, CLI::callback_t fun,
6650  std::string flag_description) {
6651  Option *opt;
6652  if (detail::has_default_flag_values(flag_name)) {
6653  // check for default values and if it has them
6654  auto flag_defaults = detail::get_default_flag_values(flag_name);
6655  detail::remove_default_flag_values(flag_name);
6656  opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun),
6657  std::move(flag_description), false);
6658  for (const auto &fname : flag_defaults)
6659  opt->fnames_.push_back(fname.first);
6660  opt->default_flag_values_ = std::move(flag_defaults);
6661  } else {
6662  opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun),
6663  std::move(flag_description), false);
6664  }
6665  // flags cannot have positional values
6666  if (opt->get_positional()) {
6667  auto pos_name = opt->get_name(true);
6668  remove_option(opt);
6669  throw IncorrectConstruction::PositionalFlag(pos_name);
6670  }
6671  opt->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
6672  opt->expected(0);
6673  opt->required(false);
6674  return opt;
6675  }
6676 
6677 public:
6679  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name) {
6680  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(), std::string{});
6681  }
6682 
6686  template <typename T,
6687  enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value &&
6688  std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value,
6689  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6690  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name, T &flag_description) {
6691  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(),
6692  flag_description);
6693  }
6694 
6698  template <typename T,
6699  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<T, std::int64_t>::value &&
6700  !is_bool<T>::value,
6701  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6702  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
6703  T &flag_count,
6704  std::string flag_description = "") {
6705  flag_count = 0;
6706  CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_count](const CLI::results_t &res) {
6707  try {
6708  detail::sum_flag_vector(res, flag_count);
6709  } catch (const std::invalid_argument &) {
6710  return false;
6711  }
6712  return true;
6713  };
6714  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun),
6715  std::move(flag_description))
6716  ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
6717  }
6718 
6721  template <typename T,
6722  enable_if_t<!detail::is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
6723  !std::is_const<T>::value &&
6724  (!std::is_constructible<T, std::int64_t>::value ||
6725  is_bool<T>::value) &&
6726  !std::is_constructible<std::function<void(int)>,
6727  T>::value,
6728  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6729  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
6730  T &flag_result,
6731  std::string flag_description = "") {
6732 
6733  CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_result](const CLI::results_t &res) {
6734  return CLI::detail::lexical_cast(res[0], flag_result);
6735  };
6736  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun),
6737  std::move(flag_description))
6738  ->run_callback_for_default();
6739  }
6740 
6742  template <typename T,
6743  enable_if_t<!std::is_assignable<
6744  std::function<void(std::int64_t)> &, T>::value,
6745  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6746  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
6747  std::vector<T> &flag_results,
6748  std::string flag_description = "") {
6750  CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_results](const CLI::results_t &res) {
6751  bool retval = true;
6752  for (const auto &elem : res) {
6753  flag_results.emplace_back();
6754  retval &= detail::lexical_cast(elem, flag_results.back());
6755  }
6756  return retval;
6757  };
6758  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun),
6759  std::move(flag_description))
6760  ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll)
6761  ->run_callback_for_default();
6762  }
6763 
6766  Option *add_flag_callback(
6767  std::string flag_name,
6768  std::function<void(void)> function,
6769  std::string flag_description = "") {
6770 
6771  CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t &res) {
6772  bool trigger{false};
6773  auto result = CLI::detail::lexical_cast(res[0], trigger);
6774  if (result && trigger) {
6775  function();
6776  }
6777  return result;
6778  };
6779  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun),
6780  std::move(flag_description));
6781  }
6782 
6784  Option *add_flag_function(std::string flag_name,
6785  std::function<void(std::int64_t)>
6786  function,
6787  std::string flag_description = "") {
6788 
6789  CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t &res) {
6790  std::int64_t flag_count = 0;
6791  detail::sum_flag_vector(res, flag_count);
6792  function(flag_count);
6793  return true;
6794  };
6795  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun),
6796  std::move(flag_description))
6797  ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
6798  }
6799 
6800 #ifdef CLI11_CPP14
6801  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
6803  std::function<void(std::int64_t)>
6804  function,
6805  std::string flag_description = "") {
6806  return add_flag_function(std::move(flag_name), std::move(function),
6807  std::move(flag_description));
6808  }
6809 #endif
6810 
6812  Option *set_config(std::string option_name = "",
6813  std::string default_filename = "",
6814  const std::string &help_message = "Read an ini file",
6815  bool config_required = false) {
6816 
6817  // Remove existing config if present
6818  if (config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
6819  remove_option(config_ptr_);
6820  config_ptr_ = nullptr; // need to remove the config_ptr completely
6821  }
6822 
6823  // Only add config if option passed
6824  if (!option_name.empty()) {
6825  config_ptr_ = add_option(option_name, help_message);
6826  if (config_required) {
6827  config_ptr_->required();
6828  }
6829  if (!default_filename.empty()) {
6830  config_ptr_->default_str(std::move(default_filename));
6831  }
6832  config_ptr_->configurable(false);
6833  }
6834 
6835  return config_ptr_;
6836  }
6837 
6840  bool remove_option(Option *opt) {
6841  // Make sure no links exist
6842  for (Option_p &op : options_) {
6843  op->remove_needs(opt);
6844  op->remove_excludes(opt);
6845  }
6846 
6847  if (help_ptr_ == opt)
6848  help_ptr_ = nullptr;
6849  if (help_all_ptr_ == opt)
6850  help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
6851 
6852  auto iterator =
6853  std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
6854  [opt](const Option_p &v) { return v.get() == opt; });
6855  if (iterator != std::end(options_)) {
6856  options_.erase(iterator);
6857  return true;
6858  }
6859  return false;
6860  }
6861 
6863  template <typename T = Option_group>
6864  T *add_option_group(std::string group_name,
6865  std::string group_description = "") {
6866  auto option_group =
6867  std::make_shared<T>(std::move(group_description), group_name, this);
6868  auto ptr = option_group.get();
6869  // move to App_p for overload resolution on older gcc versions
6870  App_p app_ptr = std::dynamic_pointer_cast<App>(option_group);
6871  add_subcommand(std::move(app_ptr));
6872  return ptr;
6873  }
6874 
6878 
6880  App *add_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name = "",
6881  std::string subcommand_description = "") {
6882  if (!subcommand_name.empty() &&
6883  !detail::valid_name_string(subcommand_name)) {
6884  if (!detail::valid_first_char(subcommand_name[0])) {
6885  throw IncorrectConstruction(
6886  "Subcommand name starts with invalid character, allowed "
6887  "characters are [a-zA-z0-9]+'_','?','@' ");
6888  }
6889  for (auto c : subcommand_name) {
6890  if (!detail::valid_later_char(c)) {
6891  throw IncorrectConstruction(
6892  std::string(
6893  "Subcommand name contains invalid character ('") +
6894  c +
6895  "'), allowed characters are "
6896  "[a-zA-z0-9]+'_','?','@','.','-' ");
6897  }
6898  }
6899  }
6900  CLI::App_p subcom = std::shared_ptr<App>(
6901  new App(std::move(subcommand_description), subcommand_name, this));
6902  return add_subcommand(std::move(subcom));
6903  }
6904 
6906  App *add_subcommand(CLI::App_p subcom) {
6907  if (!subcom)
6908  throw IncorrectConstruction("passed App is not valid");
6909  auto ckapp = (name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr)
6910  ? _get_fallthrough_parent()
6911  : this;
6912  auto &mstrg = _compare_subcommand_names(*subcom, *ckapp);
6913  if (!mstrg.empty()) {
6914  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(
6915  "subcommand name or alias matches existing subcommand: " +
6916  mstrg));
6917  }
6918  subcom->parent_ = this;
6919  subcommands_.push_back(std::move(subcom));
6920  return subcommands_.back().get();
6921  }
6922 
6925  bool remove_subcommand(App *subcom) {
6926  // Make sure no links exist
6927  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6928  sub->remove_excludes(subcom);
6929  sub->remove_needs(subcom);
6930  }
6931 
6932  auto iterator = std::find_if(
6933  std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_),
6934  [subcom](const App_p &v) { return v.get() == subcom; });
6935  if (iterator != std::end(subcommands_)) {
6936  subcommands_.erase(iterator);
6937  return true;
6938  }
6939  return false;
6940  }
6943  App *get_subcommand(const App *subcom) const {
6944  if (subcom == nullptr)
6945  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
6946  for (const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
6947  if (subcomptr.get() == subcom)
6948  return subcomptr.get();
6949  throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
6950  }
6951 
6953  App *get_subcommand(std::string subcom) const {
6954  auto subc = _find_subcommand(subcom, false, false);
6955  if (subc == nullptr)
6956  throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
6957  return subc;
6958  }
6960  App *get_subcommand(int index = 0) const {
6961  if (index >= 0) {
6962  auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
6963  if (uindex < subcommands_.size())
6964  return subcommands_[uindex].get();
6965  }
6966  throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
6967  }
6968 
6971  CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(App *subcom) const {
6972  if (subcom == nullptr)
6973  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
6974  for (const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
6975  if (subcomptr.get() == subcom)
6976  return subcomptr;
6977  throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
6978  }
6979 
6981  CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(std::string subcom) const {
6982  for (const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
6983  if (subcomptr->check_name(subcom))
6984  return subcomptr;
6985  throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
6986  }
6987 
6989  CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(int index = 0) const {
6990  if (index >= 0) {
6991  auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
6992  if (uindex < subcommands_.size())
6993  return subcommands_[uindex];
6994  }
6995  throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
6996  }
6997 
6999  App *get_option_group(std::string group_name) const {
7000  for (const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
7001  if (app->name_.empty() && app->group_ == group_name) {
7002  return app.get();
7003  }
7004  }
7005  throw OptionNotFound(group_name);
7006  }
7007 
7011  std::size_t count() const { return parsed_; }
7012 
7015  std::size_t count_all() const {
7016  std::size_t cnt{0};
7017  for (auto &opt : options_) {
7018  cnt += opt->count();
7019  }
7020  for (auto &sub : subcommands_) {
7021  cnt += sub->count_all();
7022  }
7023  if (!get_name().empty()) { // for named subcommands add the number of
7024  // times the subcommand was called
7025  cnt += parsed_;
7026  }
7027  return cnt;
7028  }
7029 
7031  App *group(std::string group_name) {
7032  group_ = group_name;
7033  return this;
7034  }
7035 
7038  App *require_subcommand() {
7039  require_subcommand_min_ = 1;
7040  require_subcommand_max_ = 0;
7041  return this;
7042  }
7043 
7047  App *require_subcommand(int value) {
7048  if (value < 0) {
7049  require_subcommand_min_ = 0;
7050  require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
7051  } else {
7052  require_subcommand_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
7053  require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
7054  }
7055  return this;
7056  }
7057 
7060  App *require_subcommand(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
7061  require_subcommand_min_ = min;
7062  require_subcommand_max_ = max;
7063  return this;
7064  }
7065 
7068  App *require_option() {
7069  require_option_min_ = 1;
7070  require_option_max_ = 0;
7071  return this;
7072  }
7073 
7077  App *require_option(int value) {
7078  if (value < 0) {
7079  require_option_min_ = 0;
7080  require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
7081  } else {
7082  require_option_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
7083  require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
7084  }
7085  return this;
7086  }
7087 
7090  App *require_option(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
7091  require_option_min_ = min;
7092  require_option_max_ = max;
7093  return this;
7094  }
7095 
7098  App *fallthrough(bool value = true) {
7099  fallthrough_ = value;
7100  return this;
7101  }
7102 
7105  explicit operator bool() const { return parsed_ > 0; }
7106 
7110 
7114  virtual void pre_callback() {}
7115 
7119  //
7121  void clear() {
7122 
7123  parsed_ = 0;
7124  pre_parse_called_ = false;
7125 
7126  missing_.clear();
7127  parsed_subcommands_.clear();
7128  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7129  opt->clear();
7130  }
7131  for (const App_p &subc : subcommands_) {
7132  subc->clear();
7133  }
7134  }
7135 
7139  void parse(int argc, const char *const *argv) {
7140  // If the name is not set, read from command line
7141  if (name_.empty() || has_automatic_name_) {
7142  has_automatic_name_ = true;
7143  name_ = argv[0];
7144  }
7145 
7146  std::vector<std::string> args;
7147  args.reserve(static_cast<std::size_t>(argc) - 1);
7148  for (int i = argc - 1; i > 0; i--)
7149  args.emplace_back(argv[i]);
7150  parse(std::move(args));
7151  }
7152 
7158  void parse(std::string commandline, bool program_name_included = false) {
7159 
7160  if (program_name_included) {
7161  auto nstr = detail::split_program_name(commandline);
7162  if ((name_.empty()) || (has_automatic_name_)) {
7163  has_automatic_name_ = true;
7164  name_ = nstr.first;
7165  }
7166  commandline = std::move(nstr.second);
7167  } else {
7168  detail::trim(commandline);
7169  }
7170  // the next section of code is to deal with quoted arguments after an
7171  // '=' or ':' for windows like operations
7172  if (!commandline.empty()) {
7173  commandline = detail::find_and_modify(commandline, "=",
7174  detail::escape_detect);
7175  if (allow_windows_style_options_)
7176  commandline = detail::find_and_modify(commandline, ":",
7177  detail::escape_detect);
7178  }
7179 
7180  auto args = detail::split_up(std::move(commandline));
7181  // remove all empty strings
7182  args.erase(std::remove(args.begin(), args.end(), std::string{}),
7183  args.end());
7184  std::reverse(args.begin(), args.end());
7185 
7186  parse(std::move(args));
7187  }
7188 
7191  void parse(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
7192  // Clear if parsed
7193  if (parsed_ > 0)
7194  clear();
7195 
7196  // parsed_ is incremented in commands/subcommands,
7197  // but placed here to make sure this is cleared when
7198  // running parse after an error is thrown, even by _validate or
7199  // _configure.
7200  parsed_ = 1;
7201  _validate();
7202  _configure();
7203  // set the parent as nullptr as this object should be the top now
7204  parent_ = nullptr;
7205  parsed_ = 0;
7206 
7207  _parse(args);
7208  run_callback();
7209  }
7210 
7212  void parse(std::vector<std::string> &&args) {
7213  // Clear if parsed
7214  if (parsed_ > 0)
7215  clear();
7216 
7217  // parsed_ is incremented in commands/subcommands,
7218  // but placed here to make sure this is cleared when
7219  // running parse after an error is thrown, even by _validate or
7220  // _configure.
7221  parsed_ = 1;
7222  _validate();
7223  _configure();
7224  // set the parent as nullptr as this object should be the top now
7225  parent_ = nullptr;
7226  parsed_ = 0;
7227 
7228  _parse(std::move(args));
7229  run_callback();
7230  }
7231 
7234  void failure_message(
7235  std::function<std::string(const App *, const Error &e)> function) {
7236  failure_message_ = function;
7237  }
7238 
7240  int exit(const Error &e, std::ostream &out = std::cout,
7241  std::ostream &err = std::cerr) const {
7242 
7244  if (e.get_name() == "RuntimeError")
7245  return e.get_exit_code();
7246 
7247  if (e.get_name() == "CallForHelp") {
7248  out << help();
7249  return e.get_exit_code();
7250  }
7251 
7252  if (e.get_name() == "CallForAllHelp") {
7253  out << help("", AppFormatMode::All);
7254  return e.get_exit_code();
7255  }
7256 
7257  if (e.get_name() == "CallForVersion") {
7258  out << e.what() << std::endl;
7259  return e.get_exit_code();
7260  }
7261 
7262  if (e.get_exit_code() != static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::Success)) {
7263  if (failure_message_)
7264  err << failure_message_(this, e) << std::flush;
7265  }
7266 
7267  return e.get_exit_code();
7268  }
7269 
7273 
7275  std::size_t count(std::string option_name) const {
7276  return get_option(option_name)->count();
7277  }
7278 
7282  std::vector<App *> get_subcommands() const { return parsed_subcommands_; }
7283 
7286  std::vector<const App *>
7287  get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(const App *)> &filter) const {
7288  std::vector<const App *> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
7289  std::transform(std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_),
7290  std::begin(subcomms),
7291  [](const App_p &v) { return v.get(); });
7292 
7293  if (filter) {
7294  subcomms.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms),
7295  std::end(subcomms),
7296  [&filter](const App *app) {
7297  return !filter(app);
7298  }),
7299  std::end(subcomms));
7300  }
7301 
7302  return subcomms;
7303  }
7304 
7307  std::vector<App *>
7308  get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(App *)> &filter) {
7309  std::vector<App *> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
7310  std::transform(std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_),
7311  std::begin(subcomms),
7312  [](const App_p &v) { return v.get(); });
7313 
7314  if (filter) {
7315  subcomms.erase(
7316  std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms), std::end(subcomms),
7317  [&filter](App *app) { return !filter(app); }),
7318  std::end(subcomms));
7319  }
7320 
7321  return subcomms;
7322  }
7323 
7325  bool got_subcommand(const App *subcom) const {
7326  // get subcom needed to verify that this was a real subcommand
7327  return get_subcommand(subcom)->parsed_ > 0;
7328  }
7329 
7331  bool got_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name) const {
7332  return get_subcommand(subcommand_name)->parsed_ > 0;
7333  }
7334 
7336  App *excludes(Option *opt) {
7337  if (opt == nullptr) {
7338  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7339  }
7340  exclude_options_.insert(opt);
7341  return this;
7342  }
7343 
7345  App *excludes(App *app) {
7346  if (app == nullptr) {
7347  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7348  }
7349  if (app == this) {
7350  throw OptionNotFound("cannot self reference in needs");
7351  }
7352  auto res = exclude_subcommands_.insert(app);
7353  // subcommand exclusion should be symmetric
7354  if (res.second) {
7355  app->exclude_subcommands_.insert(this);
7356  }
7357  return this;
7358  }
7359 
7360  App *needs(Option *opt) {
7361  if (opt == nullptr) {
7362  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7363  }
7364  need_options_.insert(opt);
7365  return this;
7366  }
7367 
7368  App *needs(App *app) {
7369  if (app == nullptr) {
7370  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7371  }
7372  if (app == this) {
7373  throw OptionNotFound("cannot self reference in needs");
7374  }
7375  need_subcommands_.insert(app);
7376  return this;
7377  }
7378 
7380  bool remove_excludes(Option *opt) {
7381  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_options_),
7382  std::end(exclude_options_), opt);
7383  if (iterator == std::end(exclude_options_)) {
7384  return false;
7385  }
7386  exclude_options_.erase(iterator);
7387  return true;
7388  }
7389 
7391  bool remove_excludes(App *app) {
7392  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_subcommands_),
7393  std::end(exclude_subcommands_), app);
7394  if (iterator == std::end(exclude_subcommands_)) {
7395  return false;
7396  }
7397  auto other_app = *iterator;
7398  exclude_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
7399  other_app->remove_excludes(this);
7400  return true;
7401  }
7402 
7404  bool remove_needs(Option *opt) {
7405  auto iterator =
7406  std::find(std::begin(need_options_), std::end(need_options_), opt);
7407  if (iterator == std::end(need_options_)) {
7408  return false;
7409  }
7410  need_options_.erase(iterator);
7411  return true;
7412  }
7413 
7415  bool remove_needs(App *app) {
7416  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(need_subcommands_),
7417  std::end(need_subcommands_), app);
7418  if (iterator == std::end(need_subcommands_)) {
7419  return false;
7420  }
7421  need_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
7422  return true;
7423  }
7424 
7428 
7430  App *footer(std::string footer_string) {
7431  footer_ = std::move(footer_string);
7432  return this;
7433  }
7435  App *footer(std::function<std::string()> footer_function) {
7436  footer_callback_ = std::move(footer_function);
7437  return this;
7438  }
7443  std::string config_to_str(bool default_also = false,
7444  bool write_description = false) const {
7445  return config_formatter_->to_config(this, default_also,
7446  write_description, "");
7447  }
7448 
7451  std::string help(std::string prev = "",
7452  AppFormatMode mode = AppFormatMode::Normal) const {
7453  if (prev.empty())
7454  prev = get_name();
7455  else
7456  prev += " " + get_name();
7457 
7458  // Delegate to subcommand if needed
7459  auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
7460  if (!selected_subcommands.empty()) {
7461  return selected_subcommands.at(0)->help(prev, mode);
7462  }
7463  return formatter_->make_help(this, prev, mode);
7464  }
7465 
7467  std::string version() const {
7468  std::string val;
7469  if (version_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7470  auto rv = version_ptr_->results();
7471  version_ptr_->clear();
7472  version_ptr_->add_result("true");
7473  try {
7474  version_ptr_->run_callback();
7475  } catch (const CLI::CallForVersion &cfv) {
7476  val = cfv.what();
7477  }
7478  version_ptr_->clear();
7479  version_ptr_->add_result(rv);
7480  }
7481  return val;
7482  }
7486 
7488  std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> get_formatter() const { return formatter_; }
7489 
7491  std::shared_ptr<Config> get_config_formatter() const {
7492  return config_formatter_;
7493  }
7494 
7496  std::shared_ptr<ConfigBase> get_config_formatter_base() const {
7497  // This is safer as a dynamic_cast if we have RTTI, as Config ->
7498  // ConfigBase
7499 #if defined(__cpp_rtti) || (defined(__GXX_RTTI) && __GXX_RTTI) || \
7500  (defined(_HAS_STATIC_RTTI) && (_HAS_STATIC_RTTI == 0))
7501  return std::dynamic_pointer_cast<ConfigBase>(config_formatter_);
7502 #else
7503  return std::static_pointer_cast<ConfigBase>(config_formatter_);
7504 #endif
7505  }
7506 
7508  std::string get_description() const { return description_; }
7509 
7511  App *description(std::string app_description) {
7512  description_ = std::move(app_description);
7513  return this;
7514  }
7515 
7518  std::vector<const Option *>
7519  get_options(const std::function<bool(const Option *)> filter = {}) const {
7520  std::vector<const Option *> options(options_.size());
7521  std::transform(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
7522  std::begin(options),
7523  [](const Option_p &val) { return val.get(); });
7524 
7525  if (filter) {
7526  options.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(options), std::end(options),
7527  [&filter](const Option *opt) {
7528  return !filter(opt);
7529  }),
7530  std::end(options));
7531  }
7532 
7533  return options;
7534  }
7535 
7537  std::vector<Option *>
7538  get_options(const std::function<bool(Option *)> filter = {}) {
7539  std::vector<Option *> options(options_.size());
7540  std::transform(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
7541  std::begin(options),
7542  [](const Option_p &val) { return val.get(); });
7543 
7544  if (filter) {
7545  options.erase(
7546  std::remove_if(std::begin(options), std::end(options),
7547  [&filter](Option *opt) { return !filter(opt); }),
7548  std::end(options));
7549  }
7550 
7551  return options;
7552  }
7553 
7555  Option *get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) noexcept {
7556  for (Option_p &opt : options_) {
7557  if (opt->check_name(option_name)) {
7558  return opt.get();
7559  }
7560  }
7561  for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7562  // also check down into nameless subcommands
7563  if (subc->get_name().empty()) {
7564  auto opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7565  if (opt != nullptr) {
7566  return opt;
7567  }
7568  }
7569  }
7570  return nullptr;
7571  }
7572 
7574  const Option *get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) const noexcept {
7575  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7576  if (opt->check_name(option_name)) {
7577  return opt.get();
7578  }
7579  }
7580  for (const auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7581  // also check down into nameless subcommands
7582  if (subc->get_name().empty()) {
7583  auto opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7584  if (opt != nullptr) {
7585  return opt;
7586  }
7587  }
7588  }
7589  return nullptr;
7590  }
7591 
7593  const Option *get_option(std::string option_name) const {
7594  auto opt = get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7595  if (opt == nullptr) {
7596  throw OptionNotFound(option_name);
7597  }
7598  return opt;
7599  }
7600 
7602  Option *get_option(std::string option_name) {
7603  auto opt = get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7604  if (opt == nullptr) {
7605  throw OptionNotFound(option_name);
7606  }
7607  return opt;
7608  }
7609 
7611  const Option *operator[](const std::string &option_name) const {
7612  return get_option(option_name);
7613  }
7614 
7616  const Option *operator[](const char *option_name) const {
7617  return get_option(option_name);
7618  }
7619 
7621  bool get_ignore_case() const { return ignore_case_; }
7622 
7624  bool get_ignore_underscore() const { return ignore_underscore_; }
7625 
7627  bool get_fallthrough() const { return fallthrough_; }
7628 
7630  bool get_allow_windows_style_options() const {
7631  return allow_windows_style_options_;
7632  }
7633 
7635  bool get_positionals_at_end() const { return positionals_at_end_; }
7636 
7638  bool get_configurable() const { return configurable_; }
7639 
7641  const std::string &get_group() const { return group_; }
7642 
7644  std::string get_footer() const {
7645  return (footer_callback_) ? footer_callback_() + '\n' + footer_
7646  : footer_;
7647  }
7648 
7650  std::size_t get_require_subcommand_min() const {
7651  return require_subcommand_min_;
7652  }
7653 
7655  std::size_t get_require_subcommand_max() const {
7656  return require_subcommand_max_;
7657  }
7658 
7660  std::size_t get_require_option_min() const { return require_option_min_; }
7661 
7663  std::size_t get_require_option_max() const { return require_option_max_; }
7664 
7666  bool get_prefix_command() const { return prefix_command_; }
7667 
7669  bool get_allow_extras() const { return allow_extras_; }
7670 
7672  bool get_required() const { return required_; }
7673 
7675  bool get_disabled() const { return disabled_; }
7676 
7678  bool get_silent() const { return silent_; }
7679 
7681  bool get_immediate_callback() const { return immediate_callback_; }
7682 
7684  bool get_disabled_by_default() const {
7685  return (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled);
7686  }
7687 
7689  bool get_enabled_by_default() const {
7690  return (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled);
7691  }
7693  bool get_validate_positionals() const { return validate_positionals_; }
7694 
7696  config_extras_mode get_allow_config_extras() const {
7697  return allow_config_extras_;
7698  }
7699 
7701  Option *get_help_ptr() { return help_ptr_; }
7702 
7704  const Option *get_help_ptr() const { return help_ptr_; }
7705 
7707  const Option *get_help_all_ptr() const { return help_all_ptr_; }
7708 
7710  Option *get_config_ptr() { return config_ptr_; }
7711 
7713  const Option *get_config_ptr() const { return config_ptr_; }
7714 
7716  Option *get_version_ptr() { return version_ptr_; }
7717 
7719  const Option *get_version_ptr() const { return version_ptr_; }
7720 
7722  App *get_parent() { return parent_; }
7723 
7726  const App *get_parent() const { return parent_; }
7727 
7729  const std::string &get_name() const { return name_; }
7730 
7732  const std::vector<std::string> &get_aliases() const { return aliases_; }
7733 
7735  App *clear_aliases() {
7736  aliases_.clear();
7737  return this;
7738  }
7739 
7741  std::string get_display_name(bool with_aliases = false) const {
7742  if (name_.empty()) {
7743  return std::string("[Option Group: ") + get_group() + "]";
7744  }
7745  if (aliases_.empty() || !with_aliases || aliases_.empty()) {
7746  return name_;
7747  }
7748  std::string dispname = name_;
7749  for (const auto &lalias : aliases_) {
7750  dispname.push_back(',');
7751  dispname.push_back(' ');
7752  dispname.append(lalias);
7753  }
7754  return dispname;
7755  }
7756 
7758  bool check_name(std::string name_to_check) const {
7759  std::string local_name = name_;
7760  if (ignore_underscore_) {
7761  local_name = detail::remove_underscore(name_);
7762  name_to_check = detail::remove_underscore(name_to_check);
7763  }
7764  if (ignore_case_) {
7765  local_name = detail::to_lower(name_);
7766  name_to_check = detail::to_lower(name_to_check);
7767  }
7768 
7769  if (local_name == name_to_check) {
7770  return true;
7771  }
7772  for (auto les : aliases_) {
7773  if (ignore_underscore_) {
7774  les = detail::remove_underscore(les);
7775  }
7776  if (ignore_case_) {
7777  les = detail::to_lower(les);
7778  }
7779  if (les == name_to_check) {
7780  return true;
7781  }
7782  }
7783  return false;
7784  }
7785 
7787  std::vector<std::string> get_groups() const {
7788  std::vector<std::string> groups;
7789 
7790  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7791  // Add group if it is not already in there
7792  if (std::find(groups.begin(), groups.end(), opt->get_group()) ==
7793  groups.end()) {
7794  groups.push_back(opt->get_group());
7795  }
7796  }
7797 
7798  return groups;
7799  }
7800 
7802  const std::vector<Option *> &parse_order() const { return parse_order_; }
7803 
7805  std::vector<std::string> remaining(bool recurse = false) const {
7806  std::vector<std::string> miss_list;
7807  for (const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &miss :
7808  missing_) {
7809  miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
7810  }
7811  // Get from a subcommand that may allow extras
7812  if (recurse) {
7813  if (!allow_extras_) {
7814  for (const auto &sub : subcommands_) {
7815  if (sub->name_.empty() && !sub->missing_.empty()) {
7816  for (const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>
7817  &miss : sub->missing_) {
7818  miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
7819  }
7820  }
7821  }
7822  }
7823  // Recurse into subcommands
7824 
7825  for (const App *sub : parsed_subcommands_) {
7826  std::vector<std::string> output = sub->remaining(recurse);
7827  std::copy(std::begin(output), std::end(output),
7828  std::back_inserter(miss_list));
7829  }
7830  }
7831  return miss_list;
7832  }
7833 
7836  std::vector<std::string>
7837  remaining_for_passthrough(bool recurse = false) const {
7838  std::vector<std::string> miss_list = remaining(recurse);
7839  std::reverse(std::begin(miss_list), std::end(miss_list));
7840  return miss_list;
7841  }
7842 
7844  std::size_t remaining_size(bool recurse = false) const {
7845  auto remaining_options = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::count_if(
7846  std::begin(missing_), std::end(missing_),
7847  [](const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &val) {
7848  return val.first != detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
7849  }));
7850 
7851  if (recurse) {
7852  for (const App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
7853  remaining_options += sub->remaining_size(recurse);
7854  }
7855  }
7856  return remaining_options;
7857  }
7858 
7860 
7861 protected:
7866  void _validate() const {
7867  // count the number of positional only args
7868  auto pcount = std::count_if(
7869  std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [](const Option_p &opt) {
7870  return opt->get_items_expected_max() >=
7871  detail::expected_max_vector_size &&
7872  !opt->nonpositional();
7873  });
7874  if (pcount > 1) {
7875  auto pcount_req =
7876  std::count_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
7877  [](const Option_p &opt) {
7878  return opt->get_items_expected_max() >=
7879  detail::expected_max_vector_size &&
7880  !opt->nonpositional() &&
7881  opt->get_required();
7882  });
7883  if (pcount - pcount_req > 1) {
7884  throw InvalidError(name_);
7885  }
7886  }
7887 
7888  std::size_t nameless_subs{0};
7889  for (const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
7890  app->_validate();
7891  if (app->get_name().empty())
7892  ++nameless_subs;
7893  }
7894 
7895  if (require_option_min_ > 0) {
7896  if (require_option_max_ > 0) {
7897  if (require_option_max_ < require_option_min_) {
7898  throw(InvalidError("Required min options greater than "
7899  "required max options",
7900  ExitCodes::InvalidError));
7901  }
7902  }
7903  if (require_option_min_ > (options_.size() + nameless_subs)) {
7904  throw(InvalidError("Required min options greater than number "
7905  "of available options",
7906  ExitCodes::InvalidError));
7907  }
7908  }
7909  }
7910 
7915  void _configure() {
7916  if (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled) {
7917  disabled_ = false;
7918  } else if (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled) {
7919  disabled_ = true;
7920  }
7921  for (const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
7922  if (app->has_automatic_name_) {
7923  app->name_.clear();
7924  }
7925  if (app->name_.empty()) {
7926  app->fallthrough_ = false; // make sure fallthrough_ is false to
7927  // prevent infinite loop
7928  app->prefix_command_ = false;
7929  }
7930  // make sure the parent is set to be this object in preparation for
7931  // parse
7932  app->parent_ = this;
7933  app->_configure();
7934  }
7935  }
7936 
7938  void run_callback(bool final_mode = false,
7939  bool suppress_final_callback = false) {
7940  pre_callback();
7941  // in the main app if immediate_callback_ is set it runs the main
7942  // callback before the used subcommands
7943  if (!final_mode && parse_complete_callback_) {
7944  parse_complete_callback_();
7945  }
7946  // run the callbacks for the received subcommands
7947  for (App *subc : get_subcommands()) {
7948  subc->run_callback(true, suppress_final_callback);
7949  }
7950  // now run callbacks for option_groups
7951  for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7952  if (subc->name_.empty() && subc->count_all() > 0) {
7953  subc->run_callback(true, suppress_final_callback);
7954  }
7955  }
7956 
7957  // finally run the main callback
7958  if (final_callback_ && (parsed_ > 0) && (!suppress_final_callback)) {
7959  if (!name_.empty() || count_all() > 0 || parent_ == nullptr) {
7960  final_callback_();
7961  }
7962  }
7963  }
7964 
7967  bool _valid_subcommand(const std::string &current,
7968  bool ignore_used = true) const {
7969  // Don't match if max has been reached - but still check parents
7970  if (require_subcommand_max_ != 0 &&
7971  parsed_subcommands_.size() >= require_subcommand_max_) {
7972  return parent_ != nullptr &&
7973  parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
7974  }
7975  auto com = _find_subcommand(current, true, ignore_used);
7976  if (com != nullptr) {
7977  return true;
7978  }
7979  // Check parent if exists, else return false
7980  return parent_ != nullptr &&
7981  parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
7982  }
7983 
7985  detail::Classifier _recognize(const std::string &current,
7986  bool ignore_used_subcommands = true) const {
7987  std::string dummy1, dummy2;
7988 
7989  if (current == "--")
7990  return detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
7991  if (_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used_subcommands))
7992  return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND;
7993  if (detail::split_long(current, dummy1, dummy2))
7994  return detail::Classifier::LONG;
7995  if (detail::split_short(current, dummy1, dummy2)) {
7996  if (dummy1[0] >= '0' && dummy1[0] <= '9') {
7997  if (get_option_no_throw(std::string{'-', dummy1[0]}) ==
7998  nullptr) {
7999  return detail::Classifier::NONE;
8000  }
8001  }
8002  return detail::Classifier::SHORT;
8003  }
8004  if ((allow_windows_style_options_) &&
8005  (detail::split_windows_style(current, dummy1, dummy2)))
8006  return detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE;
8007  if ((current == "++") && !name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr)
8008  return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR;
8009  return detail::Classifier::NONE;
8010  }
8011 
8012  // The parse function is now broken into several parts, and part of process
8013 
8015  void _process_config_file() {
8016  if (config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
8017  bool config_required = config_ptr_->get_required();
8018  auto file_given = config_ptr_->count() > 0;
8019  auto config_files = config_ptr_->as<std::vector<std::string>>();
8020  if (config_files.empty() || config_files.front().empty()) {
8021  if (config_required) {
8022  throw FileError::Missing("no specified config file");
8023  }
8024  return;
8025  }
8026  for (auto rit = config_files.rbegin(); rit != config_files.rend();
8027  ++rit) {
8028  const auto &config_file = *rit;
8029  auto path_result = detail::check_path(config_file.c_str());
8030  if (path_result == detail::path_type::file) {
8031  try {
8032  std::vector<ConfigItem> values =
8033  config_formatter_->from_file(config_file);
8034  _parse_config(values);
8035  if (!file_given) {
8036  config_ptr_->add_result(config_file);
8037  }
8038  } catch (const FileError &) {
8039  if (config_required || file_given)
8040  throw;
8041  }
8042  } else if (config_required || file_given) {
8043  throw FileError::Missing(config_file);
8044  }
8045  }
8046  }
8047  }
8048 
8050  void _process_env() {
8051  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8052  if (opt->count() == 0 && !opt->envname_.empty()) {
8053  char *buffer = nullptr;
8054  std::string ename_string;
8055 
8056 #ifdef _MSC_VER
8057  // Windows version
8058  std::size_t sz = 0;
8059  if (_dupenv_s(&buffer, &sz, opt->envname_.c_str()) == 0 &&
8060  buffer != nullptr) {
8061  ename_string = std::string(buffer);
8062  free(buffer);
8063  }
8064 #else
8065  // This also works on Windows, but gives a warning
8066  buffer = std::getenv(opt->envname_.c_str());
8067  if (buffer != nullptr)
8068  ename_string = std::string(buffer);
8069 #endif
8070 
8071  if (!ename_string.empty()) {
8072  opt->add_result(ename_string);
8073  }
8074  }
8075  }
8076 
8077  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8078  if (sub->get_name().empty() || !sub->parse_complete_callback_)
8079  sub->_process_env();
8080  }
8081  }
8082 
8084  void _process_callbacks() {
8085 
8086  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8087  // process the priority option_groups first
8088  if (sub->get_name().empty() && sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
8089  if (sub->count_all() > 0) {
8090  sub->_process_callbacks();
8091  sub->run_callback();
8092  }
8093  }
8094  }
8095 
8096  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8097  if (opt->count() > 0 && !opt->get_callback_run()) {
8098  opt->run_callback();
8099  }
8100  }
8101  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8102  if (!sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
8103  sub->_process_callbacks();
8104  }
8105  }
8106  }
8107 
8112  void _process_help_flags(bool trigger_help = false,
8113  bool trigger_all_help = false) const {
8114  const Option *help_ptr = get_help_ptr();
8115  const Option *help_all_ptr = get_help_all_ptr();
8116 
8117  if (help_ptr != nullptr && help_ptr->count() > 0)
8118  trigger_help = true;
8119  if (help_all_ptr != nullptr && help_all_ptr->count() > 0)
8120  trigger_all_help = true;
8121 
8122  // If there were parsed subcommands, call those. First subcommand wins
8123  // if there are multiple ones.
8124  if (!parsed_subcommands_.empty()) {
8125  for (const App *sub : parsed_subcommands_)
8126  sub->_process_help_flags(trigger_help, trigger_all_help);
8127 
8128  // Only the final subcommand should call for help. All help wins
8129  // over help.
8130  } else if (trigger_all_help) {
8131  throw CallForAllHelp();
8132  } else if (trigger_help) {
8133  throw CallForHelp();
8134  }
8135  }
8136 
8139  void _process_requirements() {
8140  // check excludes
8141  bool excluded{false};
8142  std::string excluder;
8143  for (auto &opt : exclude_options_) {
8144  if (opt->count() > 0) {
8145  excluded = true;
8146  excluder = opt->get_name();
8147  }
8148  }
8149  for (auto &subc : exclude_subcommands_) {
8150  if (subc->count_all() > 0) {
8151  excluded = true;
8152  excluder = subc->get_display_name();
8153  }
8154  }
8155  if (excluded) {
8156  if (count_all() > 0) {
8157  throw ExcludesError(get_display_name(), excluder);
8158  }
8159  // if we are excluded but didn't receive anything, just return
8160  return;
8161  }
8162 
8163  // check excludes
8164  bool missing_needed{false};
8165  std::string missing_need;
8166  for (auto &opt : need_options_) {
8167  if (opt->count() == 0) {
8168  missing_needed = true;
8169  missing_need = opt->get_name();
8170  }
8171  }
8172  for (auto &subc : need_subcommands_) {
8173  if (subc->count_all() == 0) {
8174  missing_needed = true;
8175  missing_need = subc->get_display_name();
8176  }
8177  }
8178  if (missing_needed) {
8179  if (count_all() > 0) {
8180  throw RequiresError(get_display_name(), missing_need);
8181  }
8182  // if we missing something but didn't have any options, just return
8183  return;
8184  }
8185 
8186  std::size_t used_options = 0;
8187  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8188 
8189  if (opt->count() != 0) {
8190  ++used_options;
8191  }
8192  // Required but empty
8193  if (opt->get_required() && opt->count() == 0) {
8194  throw RequiredError(opt->get_name());
8195  }
8196  // Requires
8197  for (const Option *opt_req : opt->needs_)
8198  if (opt->count() > 0 && opt_req->count() == 0)
8199  throw RequiresError(opt->get_name(), opt_req->get_name());
8200  // Excludes
8201  for (const Option *opt_ex : opt->excludes_)
8202  if (opt->count() > 0 && opt_ex->count() != 0)
8203  throw ExcludesError(opt->get_name(), opt_ex->get_name());
8204  }
8205  // check for the required number of subcommands
8206  if (require_subcommand_min_ > 0) {
8207  auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
8208  if (require_subcommand_min_ > selected_subcommands.size())
8209  throw RequiredError::Subcommand(require_subcommand_min_);
8210  }
8211 
8212  // Max error cannot occur, the extra subcommand will parse as an
8213  // ExtrasError or a remaining item.
8214 
8215  // run this loop to check how many unnamed subcommands were actually
8216  // used since they are considered options from the perspective of an App
8217  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8218  if (sub->disabled_)
8219  continue;
8220  if (sub->name_.empty() && sub->count_all() > 0) {
8221  ++used_options;
8222  }
8223  }
8224 
8225  if (require_option_min_ > used_options ||
8226  (require_option_max_ > 0 && require_option_max_ < used_options)) {
8227  auto option_list =
8228  detail::join(options_, [this](const Option_p &ptr) {
8229  if (ptr.get() == help_ptr_ || ptr.get() == help_all_ptr_) {
8230  return std::string{};
8231  }
8232  return ptr->get_name(false, true);
8233  });
8234 
8235  auto subc_list = get_subcommands([](App *app) {
8236  return ((app->get_name().empty()) && (!app->disabled_));
8237  });
8238  if (!subc_list.empty()) {
8239  option_list +=
8240  "," + detail::join(subc_list, [](const App *app) {
8241  return app->get_display_name();
8242  });
8243  }
8244  throw RequiredError::Option(require_option_min_,
8245  require_option_max_, used_options,
8246  option_list);
8247  }
8248 
8249  // now process the requirements for subcommands if needed
8250  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8251  if (sub->disabled_)
8252  continue;
8253  if (sub->name_.empty() && sub->required_ == false) {
8254  if (sub->count_all() == 0) {
8255  if (require_option_min_ > 0 &&
8256  require_option_min_ <= used_options) {
8257  continue;
8258  // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing
8259  // in this option group skip checking requirements
8260  }
8261  if (require_option_max_ > 0 &&
8262  used_options >= require_option_min_) {
8263  continue;
8264  // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing
8265  // in this option group skip checking requirements
8266  }
8267  }
8268  }
8269  if (sub->count() > 0 || sub->name_.empty()) {
8270  sub->_process_requirements();
8271  }
8272 
8273  if (sub->required_ && sub->count_all() == 0) {
8274  throw(CLI::RequiredError(sub->get_display_name()));
8275  }
8276  }
8277  }
8278 
8280  void _process() {
8281  CLI::FileError fe("ne");
8282  bool caught_error{false};
8283  try {
8284  // the config file might generate a FileError but that should not be
8285  // processed until later in the process to allow for help, version
8286  // and other errors to generate first.
8287  _process_config_file();
8288  // process env shouldn't throw but no reason to process it if config
8289  // generated an error
8290  _process_env();
8291  } catch (const CLI::FileError &fe2) {
8292  fe = fe2;
8293  caught_error = true;
8294  }
8295  // callbacks and help_flags can generate exceptions which should take
8296  // priority over the config file error if one exists
8297  _process_callbacks();
8298  _process_help_flags();
8299 
8300  if (caught_error) {
8301  throw CLI::FileError(std::move(fe));
8302  }
8303 
8304  _process_requirements();
8305  }
8306 
8308  void _process_extras() {
8309  if (!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
8310  std::size_t num_left_over = remaining_size();
8311  if (num_left_over > 0) {
8312  throw ExtrasError(name_, remaining(false));
8313  }
8314  }
8315 
8316  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8317  if (sub->count() > 0)
8318  sub->_process_extras();
8319  }
8320  }
8321 
8324  void _process_extras(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
8325  if (!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
8326  std::size_t num_left_over = remaining_size();
8327  if (num_left_over > 0) {
8328  args = remaining(false);
8329  throw ExtrasError(name_, args);
8330  }
8331  }
8332 
8333  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8334  if (sub->count() > 0)
8335  sub->_process_extras(args);
8336  }
8337  }
8338 
8341  void increment_parsed() {
8342  ++parsed_;
8343  for (App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8344  if (sub->get_name().empty())
8345  sub->increment_parsed();
8346  }
8347  }
8349  void _parse(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
8350  increment_parsed();
8351  _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8352  bool positional_only = false;
8353 
8354  while (!args.empty()) {
8355  if (!_parse_single(args, positional_only)) {
8356  break;
8357  }
8358  }
8359 
8360  if (parent_ == nullptr) {
8361  _process();
8362 
8363  // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
8364  _process_extras(args);
8365 
8366  // Convert missing (pairs) to extras (string only) ready for
8367  // processing in another app
8368  args = remaining_for_passthrough(false);
8369  } else if (parse_complete_callback_) {
8370  _process_env();
8371  _process_callbacks();
8372  _process_help_flags();
8373  _process_requirements();
8374  run_callback(false, true);
8375  }
8376  }
8377 
8379  void _parse(std::vector<std::string> &&args) {
8380  // this can only be called by the top level in which case parent ==
8381  // nullptr by definition operation is simplified
8382  increment_parsed();
8383  _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8384  bool positional_only = false;
8385 
8386  while (!args.empty()) {
8387  _parse_single(args, positional_only);
8388  }
8389  _process();
8390 
8391  // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
8392  _process_extras();
8393  }
8394 
8401  void _parse_config(const std::vector<ConfigItem> &args) {
8402  for (const ConfigItem &item : args) {
8403  if (!_parse_single_config(item) &&
8404  allow_config_extras_ == config_extras_mode::error)
8405  throw ConfigError::Extras(item.fullname());
8406  }
8407  }
8408 
8410  bool _parse_single_config(const ConfigItem &item, std::size_t level = 0) {
8411  if (level < item.parents.size()) {
8412  try {
8413  auto subcom = get_subcommand(item.parents.at(level));
8414  auto result = subcom->_parse_single_config(item, level + 1);
8415 
8416  return result;
8417  } catch (const OptionNotFound &) {
8418  return false;
8419  }
8420  }
8421  // check for section open
8422  if (item.name == "++") {
8423  if (configurable_) {
8424  increment_parsed();
8425  _trigger_pre_parse(2);
8426  if (parent_ != nullptr) {
8427  parent_->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(this);
8428  }
8429  }
8430  return true;
8431  }
8432  // check for section close
8433  if (item.name == "--") {
8434  if (configurable_) {
8435  _process_callbacks();
8436  _process_requirements();
8437  run_callback();
8438  }
8439  return true;
8440  }
8441  Option *op = get_option_no_throw("--" + item.name);
8442  if (op == nullptr) {
8443  if (item.name.size() == 1) {
8444  op = get_option_no_throw("-" + item.name);
8445  }
8446  }
8447  if (op == nullptr) {
8448  op = get_option_no_throw(item.name);
8449  }
8450  if (op == nullptr) {
8451  // If the option was not present
8452  if (get_allow_config_extras() == config_extras_mode::capture)
8453  // Should we worry about classifying the extras properly?
8454  missing_.emplace_back(detail::Classifier::NONE,
8455  item.fullname());
8456  return false;
8457  }
8458 
8459  if (!op->get_configurable())
8460  throw ConfigError::NotConfigurable(item.fullname());
8461 
8462  if (op->empty()) {
8463  // Flag parsing
8464  if (op->get_expected_min() == 0) {
8465  auto res = config_formatter_->to_flag(item);
8466  res = op->get_flag_value(item.name, res);
8467 
8468  op->add_result(res);
8469 
8470  } else {
8471  op->add_result(item.inputs);
8472  op->run_callback();
8473  }
8474  }
8475 
8476  return true;
8477  }
8478 
8482  bool _parse_single(std::vector<std::string> &args, bool &positional_only) {
8483  bool retval = true;
8484  detail::Classifier classifier = positional_only
8485  ? detail::Classifier::NONE
8486  : _recognize(args.back());
8487  switch (classifier) {
8488  case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
8489  args.pop_back();
8490  positional_only = true;
8491  if ((!_has_remaining_positionals()) && (parent_ != nullptr)) {
8492  retval = false;
8493  } else {
8494  _move_to_missing(classifier, "--");
8495  }
8496  break;
8497  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
8498  // treat this like a positional mark if in the parent app
8499  args.pop_back();
8500  retval = false;
8501  break;
8502  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
8503  retval = _parse_subcommand(args);
8504  break;
8505  case detail::Classifier::LONG:
8506  case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
8507  case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE:
8508  // If already parsed a subcommand, don't accept options_
8509  _parse_arg(args, classifier);
8510  break;
8511  case detail::Classifier::NONE:
8512  // Probably a positional or something for a parent (sub)command
8513  retval = _parse_positional(args, false);
8514  if (retval && positionals_at_end_) {
8515  positional_only = true;
8516  }
8517  break;
8518  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8519  default:
8520  throw HorribleError(
8521  "unrecognized classifier (you should not see this!)");
8522  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8523  }
8524  return retval;
8525  }
8526 
8528  std::size_t _count_remaining_positionals(bool required_only = false) const {
8529  std::size_t retval = 0;
8530  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8531  if (opt->get_positional() &&
8532  (!required_only || opt->get_required())) {
8533  if (opt->get_items_expected_min() > 0 &&
8534  static_cast<int>(opt->count()) <
8535  opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
8536  retval += static_cast<std::size_t>(
8537  opt->get_items_expected_min()) -
8538  opt->count();
8539  }
8540  }
8541  }
8542  return retval;
8543  }
8544 
8546  bool _has_remaining_positionals() const {
8547  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8548  if (opt->get_positional() && ((static_cast<int>(opt->count()) <
8549  opt->get_items_expected_min()))) {
8550  return true;
8551  }
8552  }
8553 
8554  return false;
8555  }
8556 
8561  bool _parse_positional(std::vector<std::string> &args,
8562  bool haltOnSubcommand) {
8563 
8564  const std::string &positional = args.back();
8565 
8566  if (positionals_at_end_) {
8567  // deal with the case of required arguments at the end which should
8568  // take precedence over other arguments
8569  auto arg_rem = args.size();
8570  auto remreq = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
8571  if (arg_rem <= remreq) {
8572  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8573  if (opt->get_positional() && opt->required_) {
8574  if (static_cast<int>(opt->count()) <
8575  opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
8576  if (validate_positionals_) {
8577  std::string pos = positional;
8578  pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
8579  if (!pos.empty()) {
8580  continue;
8581  }
8582  }
8583  opt->add_result(positional);
8584  parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
8585  args.pop_back();
8586  return true;
8587  }
8588  }
8589  }
8590  }
8591  }
8592  for (const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8593  // Eat options, one by one, until done
8594  if (opt->get_positional() && (static_cast<int>(opt->count()) <
8595  opt->get_items_expected_min() ||
8596  opt->get_allow_extra_args())) {
8597  if (validate_positionals_) {
8598  std::string pos = positional;
8599  pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
8600  if (!pos.empty()) {
8601  continue;
8602  }
8603  }
8604  opt->add_result(positional);
8605  parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
8606  args.pop_back();
8607  return true;
8608  }
8609  }
8610 
8611  for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
8612  if ((subc->name_.empty()) && (!subc->disabled_)) {
8613  if (subc->_parse_positional(args, false)) {
8614  if (!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
8615  subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8616  }
8617  return true;
8618  }
8619  }
8620  }
8621  // let the parent deal with it if possible
8622  if (parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
8623  return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_positional(
8624  args, static_cast<bool>(parse_complete_callback_));
8625 
8627  auto com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
8628  if (com != nullptr &&
8629  (require_subcommand_max_ == 0 ||
8630  require_subcommand_max_ > parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
8631  if (haltOnSubcommand) {
8632  return false;
8633  }
8634  args.pop_back();
8635  com->_parse(args);
8636  return true;
8637  }
8641  auto parent_app =
8642  (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
8643  com = parent_app->_find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
8644  if (com != nullptr && (com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ == 0 ||
8645  com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ >
8646  com->parent_->parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
8647  return false;
8648  }
8649 
8650  if (positionals_at_end_) {
8651  throw CLI::ExtrasError(name_, args);
8652  }
8654  if (parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
8655  return false;
8656  }
8658  _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, positional);
8659  args.pop_back();
8660  if (prefix_command_) {
8661  while (!args.empty()) {
8662  _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, args.back());
8663  args.pop_back();
8664  }
8665  }
8666 
8667  return true;
8668  }
8669 
8672  App *_find_subcommand(const std::string &subc_name, bool ignore_disabled,
8673  bool ignore_used) const noexcept {
8674  for (const App_p &com : subcommands_) {
8675  if (com->disabled_ && ignore_disabled)
8676  continue;
8677  if (com->get_name().empty()) {
8678  auto subc = com->_find_subcommand(subc_name, ignore_disabled,
8679  ignore_used);
8680  if (subc != nullptr) {
8681  return subc;
8682  }
8683  }
8684  if (com->check_name(subc_name)) {
8685  if ((!*com) || !ignore_used)
8686  return com.get();
8687  }
8688  }
8689  return nullptr;
8690  }
8691 
8696  bool _parse_subcommand(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
8697  if (_count_remaining_positionals(/* required */ true) > 0) {
8698  _parse_positional(args, false);
8699  return true;
8700  }
8701  auto com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, true);
8702  if (com != nullptr) {
8703  args.pop_back();
8704  if (!com->silent_) {
8705  parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
8706  }
8707  com->_parse(args);
8708  auto parent_app = com->parent_;
8709  while (parent_app != this) {
8710  parent_app->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8711  if (!com->silent_) {
8712  parent_app->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
8713  }
8714  parent_app = parent_app->parent_;
8715  }
8716  return true;
8717  }
8718 
8719  if (parent_ == nullptr)
8720  throw HorribleError("Subcommand " + args.back() + " missing");
8721  return false;
8722  }
8723 
8727  bool _parse_arg(std::vector<std::string> &args,
8728  detail::Classifier current_type) {
8729 
8730  std::string current = args.back();
8731 
8732  std::string arg_name;
