8733  std::string value;
8734  std::string rest;
8735 
8736  switch (current_type) {
8737  case detail::Classifier::LONG:
8738  if (!detail::split_long(current, arg_name, value))
8739  throw HorribleError(
8740  "Long parsed but missing (you should not see this):" +
8741  args.back());
8742  break;
8743  case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
8744  if (!detail::split_short(current, arg_name, rest))
8745  throw HorribleError(
8746  "Short parsed but missing! You should not see this");
8747  break;
8748  case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE:
8749  if (!detail::split_windows_style(current, arg_name, value))
8750  throw HorribleError("windows option parsed but missing! You "
8751  "should not see this");
8752  break;
8753  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
8754  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
8755  case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
8756  case detail::Classifier::NONE:
8757  default:
8758  throw HorribleError("parsing got called with invalid option! You "
8759  "should not see this");
8760  }
8761 
8762  auto op_ptr = std::find_if(
8763  std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
8764  [arg_name, current_type](const Option_p &opt) {
8765  if (current_type == detail::Classifier::LONG)
8766  return opt->check_lname(arg_name);
8767  if (current_type == detail::Classifier::SHORT)
8768  return opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8769  // this will only get called for
8770  // detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE
8771  return opt->check_lname(arg_name) || opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8772  });
8773 
8774  // Option not found
8775  if (op_ptr == std::end(options_)) {
8776  for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
8777  if (subc->name_.empty() && !subc->disabled_) {
8778  if (subc->_parse_arg(args, current_type)) {
8779  if (!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
8780  subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8781  }
8782  return true;
8783  }
8784  }
8785  }
8786  // If a subcommand, try the master command
8787  if (parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
8788  return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_arg(args,
8789  current_type);
8790  // don't capture missing if this is a nameless subcommand
8791  if (parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
8792  return false;
8793  }
8794  // Otherwise, add to missing
8795  args.pop_back();
8796  _move_to_missing(current_type, current);
8797  return true;
8798  }
8799 
8800  args.pop_back();
8801 
8802  // Get a reference to the pointer to make syntax bearable
8803  Option_p &op = *op_ptr;
8805  if (op->get_inject_separator()) {
8806  if (!op->results().empty() && !op->results().back().empty()) {
8807  op->add_result(std::string{});
8808  }
8809  }
8810  int min_num =
8811  (std::min)(op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_items_expected_min());
8812  int max_num = op->get_items_expected_max();
8813  // check container like options to limit the argument size to a single
8814  // type if the allow_extra_flags argument is set. 16 is somewhat
8815  // arbitrary (needs to be at least 4)
8816  if (max_num >= detail::expected_max_vector_size / 16 &&
8817  !op->get_allow_extra_args()) {
8818  auto tmax = op->get_type_size_max();
8819  max_num = detail::checked_multiply(tmax, op->get_expected_min())
8820  ? tmax
8821  : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
8822  }
8823  // Make sure we always eat the minimum for unlimited vectors
8824  int collected = 0; // total number of arguments collected
8825  int result_count =
8826  0; // local variable for number of results in a single arg string
8827  // deal with purely flag like things
8828  if (max_num == 0) {
8829  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, value);
8830  op->add_result(res);
8831  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8832  } else if (!value.empty()) { // --this=value
8833  op->add_result(value, result_count);
8834  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8835  collected += result_count;
8836  // -Trest
8837  } else if (!rest.empty()) {
8838  op->add_result(rest, result_count);
8839  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8840  rest = "";
8841  collected += result_count;
8842  }
8843 
8844  // gather the minimum number of arguments
8845  while (min_num > collected && !args.empty()) {
8846  std::string current_ = args.back();
8847  args.pop_back();
8848  op->add_result(current_, result_count);
8849  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8850  collected += result_count;
8851  }
8852 
8853  if (min_num > collected) { // if we have run out of arguments and the
8854  // minimum was not met
8855  throw ArgumentMismatch::TypedAtLeast(op->get_name(), min_num,
8856  op->get_type_name());
8857  }
8858 
8859  if (max_num > collected ||
8860  op->get_allow_extra_args()) { // we allow optional arguments
8861  auto remreqpos = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
8862  // we have met the minimum now optionally check up to the maximum
8863  while ((collected < max_num || op->get_allow_extra_args()) &&
8864  !args.empty() &&
8865  _recognize(args.back(), false) == detail::Classifier::NONE) {
8866  // If any required positionals remain, don't keep eating
8867  if (remreqpos >= args.size()) {
8868  break;
8869  }
8870 
8871  op->add_result(args.back(), result_count);
8872  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8873  args.pop_back();
8874  collected += result_count;
8875  }
8876 
8877  // Allow -- to end an unlimited list and "eat" it
8878  if (!args.empty() &&
8879  _recognize(args.back()) == detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK)
8880  args.pop_back();
8881  // optional flag that didn't receive anything now get the default
8882  // value
8883  if (min_num == 0 && max_num > 0 && collected == 0) {
8884  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, std::string{});
8885  op->add_result(res);
8886  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8887  }
8888  }
8889 
8890  // if we only partially completed a type then add an empty string for
8891  // later processing
8892  if (min_num > 0 && op->get_type_size_max() != min_num &&
8893  (collected % op->get_type_size_max()) != 0) {
8894  op->add_result(std::string{});
8895  }
8896 
8897  if (!rest.empty()) {
8898  rest = "-" + rest;
8899  args.push_back(rest);
8900  }
8901  return true;
8902  }
8903 
8905  void _trigger_pre_parse(std::size_t remaining_args) {
8906  if (!pre_parse_called_) {
8907  pre_parse_called_ = true;
8908  if (pre_parse_callback_) {
8909  pre_parse_callback_(remaining_args);
8910  }
8911  } else if (immediate_callback_) {
8912  if (!name_.empty()) {
8913  auto pcnt = parsed_;
8914  auto extras = std::move(missing_);
8915  clear();
8916  parsed_ = pcnt;
8917  pre_parse_called_ = true;
8918  missing_ = std::move(extras);
8919  }
8920  }
8921  }
8922 
8925  App *_get_fallthrough_parent() {
8926  if (parent_ == nullptr) {
8927  throw(HorribleError("No Valid parent"));
8928  }
8929  auto fallthrough_parent = parent_;
8930  while ((fallthrough_parent->parent_ != nullptr) &&
8931  (fallthrough_parent->get_name().empty())) {
8932  fallthrough_parent = fallthrough_parent->parent_;
8933  }
8934  return fallthrough_parent;
8935  }
8936 
8939  const std::string &_compare_subcommand_names(const App &subcom,
8940  const App &base) const {
8941  static const std::string estring;
8942  if (subcom.disabled_) {
8943  return estring;
8944  }
8945  for (auto &subc : base.subcommands_) {
8946  if (subc.get() != &subcom) {
8947  if (subc->disabled_) {
8948  continue;
8949  }
8950  if (!subcom.get_name().empty()) {
8951  if (subc->check_name(subcom.get_name())) {
8952  return subcom.get_name();
8953  }
8954  }
8955  if (!subc->get_name().empty()) {
8956  if (subcom.check_name(subc->get_name())) {
8957  return subc->get_name();
8958  }
8959  }
8960  for (const auto &les : subcom.aliases_) {
8961  if (subc->check_name(les)) {
8962  return les;
8963  }
8964  }
8965  // this loop is needed in case of ignore_underscore or
8966  // ignore_case on one but not the other
8967  for (const auto &les : subc->aliases_) {
8968  if (subcom.check_name(les)) {
8969  return les;
8970  }
8971  }
8972  // if the subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
8973  if (subc->get_name().empty()) {
8974  auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(subcom, *subc);
8975  if (!cmpres.empty()) {
8976  return cmpres;
8977  }
8978  }
8979  // if the test subcommand is an option group we need to check
8980  // deeper
8981  if (subcom.get_name().empty()) {
8982  auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(*subc, subcom);
8983  if (!cmpres.empty()) {
8984  return cmpres;
8985  }
8986  }
8987  }
8988  }
8989  return estring;
8990  }
8992  void _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier val_type, const std::string &val) {
8993  if (allow_extras_ || subcommands_.empty()) {
8994  missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
8995  return;
8996  }
8997  // allow extra arguments to be places in an option group if it is
8998  // allowed there
8999  for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
9000  if (subc->name_.empty() && subc->allow_extras_) {
9001  subc->missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9002  return;
9003  }
9004  }
9005  // if we haven't found any place to put them yet put them in missing
9006  missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9007  }
9008 
9009 public:
9012  void _move_option(Option *opt, App *app) {
9013  if (opt == nullptr) {
9014  throw OptionNotFound("the option is NULL");
9015  }
9016  // verify that the give app is actually a subcommand
9017  bool found = false;
9018  for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
9019  if (app == subc.get()) {
9020  found = true;
9021  }
9022  }
9023  if (!found) {
9024  throw OptionNotFound("The Given app is not a subcommand");
9025  }
9026 
9027  if ((help_ptr_ == opt) || (help_all_ptr_ == opt))
9028  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move help options");
9029 
9030  if (config_ptr_ == opt)
9031  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move config file options");
9032 
9033  auto iterator =
9034  std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
9035  [opt](const Option_p &v) { return v.get() == opt; });
9036  if (iterator != std::end(options_)) {
9037  const auto &opt_p = *iterator;
9038  if (std::find_if(std::begin(app->options_), std::end(app->options_),
9039  [&opt_p](const Option_p &v) {
9040  return (*v == *opt_p);
9041  }) == std::end(app->options_)) {
9042  // only erase after the insertion was successful
9043  app->options_.push_back(std::move(*iterator));
9044  options_.erase(iterator);
9045  } else {
9046  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("option was not located: " +
9047  opt->get_name());
9048  }
9049  } else {
9050  throw OptionNotFound("could not locate the given Option");
9051  }
9052  }
9053 }; // namespace CLI
9054 
9056 class Option_group : public App {
9057 public:
9058  Option_group(std::string group_description, std::string group_name,
9059  App *parent)
9060  : App(std::move(group_description), "", parent) {
9061  group(group_name);
9062  // option groups should have automatic fallthrough
9063  }
9064  using App::add_option;
9066  Option *add_option(Option *opt) {
9067  if (get_parent() == nullptr) {
9068  throw OptionNotFound("Unable to locate the specified option");
9069  }
9070  get_parent()->_move_option(opt, this);
9071  return opt;
9072  }
9074  void add_options(Option *opt) { add_option(opt); }
9076  template <typename... Args> void add_options(Option *opt, Args... args) {
9077  add_option(opt);
9078  add_options(args...);
9079  }
9080  using App::add_subcommand;
9082  App *add_subcommand(App *subcom) {
9083  App_p subc = subcom->get_parent()->get_subcommand_ptr(subcom);
9084  subc->get_parent()->remove_subcommand(subcom);
9085  add_subcommand(std::move(subc));
9086  return subcom;
9087  }
9088 };
9090 inline void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
9091  app_to_enable->enabled_by_default(false);
9092  app_to_enable->disabled_by_default();
9093  trigger_app->preparse_callback(
9094  [app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(false); });
9095 }
9096 
9098 inline void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
9099  for (auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9100  app->enabled_by_default(false);
9101  app->disabled_by_default();
9102  }
9103 
9104  trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9105  for (auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9106  app->disabled(false);
9107  }
9108  });
9109 }
9110 
9112 inline void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
9113  app_to_enable->disabled_by_default(false);
9114  app_to_enable->enabled_by_default();
9115  trigger_app->preparse_callback(
9116  [app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(); });
9117 }
9118 
9120 inline void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
9121  for (auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9122  app->disabled_by_default(false);
9123  app->enabled_by_default();
9124  }
9125 
9126  trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9127  for (auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9128  app->disabled();
9129  }
9130  });
9131 }
9132 
9134 inline void deprecate_option(Option *opt, const std::string &replacement = "") {
9135  Validator deprecate_warning{[opt, replacement](std::string &) {
9136  std::cout << opt->get_name()
9137  << " is deprecated please use '"
9138  << replacement << "' instead\n";
9139  return std::string();
9140  },
9141  "DEPRECATED"};
9142  deprecate_warning.application_index(0);
9143  opt->check(deprecate_warning);
9144  if (!replacement.empty()) {
9145  opt->description(opt->get_description() + " DEPRECATED: please use '" +
9146  replacement + "' instead");
9147  }
9148 }
9149 
9151 inline void deprecate_option(App *app, const std::string &option_name,
9152  const std::string &replacement = "") {
9153  auto opt = app->get_option(option_name);
9154  deprecate_option(opt, replacement);
9155 }
9156 
9158 inline void deprecate_option(App &app, const std::string &option_name,
9159  const std::string &replacement = "") {
9160  auto opt = app.get_option(option_name);
9161  deprecate_option(opt, replacement);
9162 }
9163 
9165 inline void retire_option(App *app, Option *opt) {
9166  App temp;
9167  auto option_copy =
9168  temp.add_option(opt->get_name(false, true))
9169  ->type_size(opt->get_type_size_min(), opt->get_type_size_max())
9170  ->expected(opt->get_expected_min(), opt->get_expected_max())
9171  ->allow_extra_args(opt->get_allow_extra_args());
9172 
9173  app->remove_option(opt);
9174  auto opt2 = app->add_option(option_copy->get_name(false, true),
9175  "option has been retired and has no effect")
9176  ->type_name("RETIRED")
9177  ->default_str("RETIRED")
9178  ->type_size(option_copy->get_type_size_min(),
9179  option_copy->get_type_size_max())
9180  ->expected(option_copy->get_expected_min(),
9181  option_copy->get_expected_max())
9182  ->allow_extra_args(option_copy->get_allow_extra_args());
9183 
9184  Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
9185  std::cout
9186  << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name()
9187  << " is retired and has no effect\n";
9188  return std::string();
9189  },
9190  ""};
9191  retired_warning.application_index(0);
9192  opt2->check(retired_warning);
9193 }
9194 
9196 inline void retire_option(App &app, Option *opt) { retire_option(&app, opt); }
9197 
9199 inline void retire_option(App *app, const std::string &option_name) {
9200 
9201  auto opt = app->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
9202  if (opt != nullptr) {
9203  retire_option(app, opt);
9204  return;
9205  }
9206  auto opt2 = app->add_option(option_name,
9207  "option has been retired and has no effect")
9208  ->type_name("RETIRED")
9209  ->expected(0, 1)
9210  ->default_str("RETIRED");
9211  Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
9212  std::cout
9213  << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name()
9214  << " is retired and has no effect\n";
9215  return std::string();
9216  },
9217  ""};
9218  retired_warning.application_index(0);
9219  opt2->check(retired_warning);
9220 }
9221 
9223 inline void retire_option(App &app, const std::string &option_name) {
9224  retire_option(&app, option_name);
9225 }
9226 
9227 namespace FailureMessage {
9228 
9230 inline std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e) {
9231  std::string header = std::string(e.what()) + "\n";
9232  std::vector<std::string> names;
9233 
9234  // Collect names
9235  if (app->get_help_ptr() != nullptr)
9236  names.push_back(app->get_help_ptr()->get_name());
9237 
9238  if (app->get_help_all_ptr() != nullptr)
9239  names.push_back(app->get_help_all_ptr()->get_name());
9240 
9241  // If any names found, suggest those
9242  if (!names.empty())
9243  header += "Run with " + detail::join(names, " or ") +
9244  " for more information.\n";
9245 
9246  return header;
9247 }
9248 
9251 inline std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e) {
9252  std::string header =
9253  std::string("ERROR: ") + e.get_name() + ": " + e.what() + "\n";
9254  header += app->help();
9255  return header;
9256 }
9257 
9258 } // namespace FailureMessage
9259 
9260 namespace detail {
9262 struct AppFriend {
9263 #ifdef CLI11_CPP14
9264 
9266  template <typename... Args>
9267  static decltype(auto) parse_arg(App *app, Args &&... args) {
9268  return app->_parse_arg(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
9269  }
9270 
9272  template <typename... Args>
9273  static decltype(auto) parse_subcommand(App *app, Args &&... args) {
9274  return app->_parse_subcommand(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
9275  }
9276 #else
9277  template <typename... Args>
9279  static auto parse_arg(App *app, Args &&... args) ->
9280  typename std::result_of<decltype (&App::_parse_arg)(App,
9281  Args...)>::type {
9282  return app->_parse_arg(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
9283  }
9284 
9286  template <typename... Args>
9287  static auto parse_subcommand(App *app, Args &&... args) ->
9288  typename std::result_of<
9289  decltype (&App::_parse_subcommand)(App, Args...)>::type {
9290  return app->_parse_subcommand(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
9291  }
9292 #endif
9293  static App *get_fallthrough_parent(App *app) {
9296  return app->_get_fallthrough_parent();
9297  }
9298 };
9299 } // namespace detail
9300 
9301 namespace detail {
9302 
9303 inline std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string &arg,
9304  char stringQuote = '"',
9305  char characterQuote = '\'') {
9306  if (arg.empty()) {
9307  return std::string(2, stringQuote);
9308  }
9309  // some specifically supported strings
9310  if (arg == "true" || arg == "false" || arg == "nan" || arg == "inf") {
9311  return arg;
9312  }
9313  // floating point conversion can convert some hex codes, but don't try that
9314  // here
9315  if (arg.compare(0, 2, "0x") != 0 && arg.compare(0, 2, "0X") != 0) {
9316  double val;
9317  if (detail::lexical_cast(arg, val)) {
9318  return arg;
9319  }
9320  }
9321  // just quote a single non numeric character
9322  if (arg.size() == 1) {
9323  return std::string(1, characterQuote) + arg + characterQuote;
9324  }
9325  // handle hex, binary or octal arguments
9326  if (arg.front() == '0') {
9327  if (arg[1] == 'x') {
9328  if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) {
9329  return (x >= '0' && x <= '9') || (x >= 'A' && x <= 'F') ||
9330  (x >= 'a' && x <= 'f');
9331  })) {
9332  return arg;
9333  }
9334  } else if (arg[1] == 'o') {
9335  if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(),
9336  [](char x) { return (x >= '0' && x <= '7'); })) {
9337  return arg;
9338  }
9339  } else if (arg[1] == 'b') {
9340  if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(),
9341  [](char x) { return (x == '0' || x == '1'); })) {
9342  return arg;
9343  }
9344  }
9345  }
9346  if (arg.find_first_of(stringQuote) == std::string::npos) {
9347  return std::string(1, stringQuote) + arg + stringQuote;
9348  } else {
9349  return characterQuote + arg + characterQuote;
9350  }
9351 }
9352 
9354 inline std::string ini_join(const std::vector<std::string> &args,
9355  char sepChar = ',', char arrayStart = '[',
9356  char arrayEnd = ']', char stringQuote = '"',
9357  char characterQuote = '\'') {
9358  std::string joined;
9359  if (args.size() > 1 && arrayStart != '\0') {
9360  joined.push_back(arrayStart);
9361  }
9362  std::size_t start = 0;
9363  for (const auto &arg : args) {
9364  if (start++ > 0) {
9365  joined.push_back(sepChar);
9366  if (isspace(sepChar) == 0) {
9367  joined.push_back(' ');
9368  }
9369  }
9370  joined.append(convert_arg_for_ini(arg, stringQuote, characterQuote));
9371  }
9372  if (args.size() > 1 && arrayEnd != '\0') {
9373  joined.push_back(arrayEnd);
9374  }
9375  return joined;
9376 }
9377 
9378 inline std::vector<std::string> generate_parents(const std::string &section,
9379  std::string &name) {
9380  std::vector<std::string> parents;
9381  if (detail::to_lower(section) != "default") {
9382  if (section.find('.') != std::string::npos) {
9383  parents = detail::split(section, '.');
9384  } else {
9385  parents = {section};
9386  }
9387  }
9388  if (name.find('.') != std::string::npos) {
9389  std::vector<std::string> plist = detail::split(name, '.');
9390  name = plist.back();
9391  detail::remove_quotes(name);
9392  plist.pop_back();
9393  parents.insert(parents.end(), plist.begin(), plist.end());
9394  }
9395 
9396  // clean up quotes on the parents
9397  for (auto &parent : parents) {
9398  detail::remove_quotes(parent);
9399  }
9400  return parents;
9401 }
9402 
9405 inline void checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem> &output,
9406  const std::string &currentSection) {
9407 
9408  std::string estring;
9409  auto parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, estring);
9410  if (!output.empty() && output.back().name == "--") {
9411  std::size_t msize = (parents.size() > 1U) ? parents.size() : 2;
9412  while (output.back().parents.size() >= msize) {
9413  output.push_back(output.back());
9414  output.back().parents.pop_back();
9415  }
9416 
9417  if (parents.size() > 1) {
9418  std::size_t common = 0;
9419  std::size_t mpair =
9420  (std::min)(output.back().parents.size(), parents.size() - 1);
9421  for (std::size_t ii = 0; ii < mpair; ++ii) {
9422  if (output.back().parents[ii] != parents[ii]) {
9423  break;
9424  }
9425  ++common;
9426  }
9427  if (common == mpair) {
9428  output.pop_back();
9429  } else {
9430  while (output.back().parents.size() > common + 1) {
9431  output.push_back(output.back());
9432  output.back().parents.pop_back();
9433  }
9434  }
9435  for (std::size_t ii = common; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
9436  output.emplace_back();
9437  output.back().parents.assign(
9438  parents.begin(),
9439  parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
9440  output.back().name = "++";
9441  }
9442  }
9443  } else if (parents.size() > 1) {
9444  for (std::size_t ii = 0; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
9445  output.emplace_back();
9446  output.back().parents.assign(
9447  parents.begin(),
9448  parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
9449  output.back().name = "++";
9450  }
9451  }
9452 
9453  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9454  output.emplace_back();
9455  output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
9456  output.back().name = "++";
9457 }
9458 } // namespace detail
9459 
9460 inline std::vector<ConfigItem>
9461 ConfigBase::from_config(std::istream &input) const {
9462  std::string line;
9463  std::string section = "default";
9464 
9465  std::vector<ConfigItem> output;
9466  bool isDefaultArray =
9467  (arrayStart == '[' && arrayEnd == ']' && arraySeparator == ',');
9468  bool isINIArray =
9469  (arrayStart == '\0' || arrayStart == ' ') && arrayStart == arrayEnd;
9470  char aStart = (isINIArray) ? '[' : arrayStart;
9471  char aEnd = (isINIArray) ? ']' : arrayEnd;
9472  char aSep = (isINIArray && arraySeparator == ' ') ? ',' : arraySeparator;
9473 
9474  while (getline(input, line)) {
9475  std::vector<std::string> items_buffer;
9476  std::string name;
9477 
9478  detail::trim(line);
9479  std::size_t len = line.length();
9480  if (len > 1 && line.front() == '[' && line.back() == ']') {
9481  if (section != "default") {
9482  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9483  output.emplace_back();
9484  output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(section, name);
9485  output.back().name = "--";
9486  }
9487  section = line.substr(1, len - 2);
9488  // deal with double brackets for TOML
9489  if (section.size() > 1 && section.front() == '[' &&
9490  section.back() == ']') {
9491  section = section.substr(1, section.size() - 2);
9492  }
9493  if (detail::to_lower(section) == "default") {
9494  section = "default";
9495  } else {
9496  detail::checkParentSegments(output, section);
9497  }
9498  continue;
9499  }
9500  if (len == 0) {
9501  continue;
9502  }
9503  // comment lines
9504  if (line.front() == ';' || line.front() == '#' ||
9505  line.front() == commentChar) {
9506  continue;
9507  }
9508 
9509  // Find = in string, split and recombine
9510  auto pos = line.find(valueDelimiter);
9511  if (pos != std::string::npos) {
9512  name = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(0, pos));
9513  std::string item = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(pos + 1));
9514  if (item.size() > 1 && item.front() == aStart) {
9515  for (std::string multiline;
9516  item.back() != aEnd && std::getline(input, multiline);) {
9517  detail::trim(multiline);
9518  item += multiline;
9519  }
9520  items_buffer =
9521  detail::split_up(item.substr(1, item.length() - 2), aSep);
9522  } else if ((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) &&
9523  item.find_first_of(aSep) != std::string::npos) {
9524  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item, aSep);
9525  } else if ((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) &&
9526  item.find_first_of(' ') != std::string::npos) {
9527  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item);
9528  } else {
9529  items_buffer = {item};
9530  }
9531  } else {
9532  name = detail::trim_copy(line);
9533  items_buffer = {"true"};
9534  }
9535  if (name.find('.') == std::string::npos) {
9536  detail::remove_quotes(name);
9537  }
9538  // clean up quotes on the items
9539  for (auto &it : items_buffer) {
9540  detail::remove_quotes(it);
9541  }
9542 
9543  std::vector<std::string> parents =
9544  detail::generate_parents(section, name);
9545 
9546  if (!output.empty() && name == output.back().name &&
9547  parents == output.back().parents) {
9548  output.back().inputs.insert(output.back().inputs.end(),
9549  items_buffer.begin(),
9550  items_buffer.end());
9551  } else {
9552  output.emplace_back();
9553  output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
9554  output.back().name = std::move(name);
9555  output.back().inputs = std::move(items_buffer);
9556  }
9557  }
9558  if (section != "default") {
9559  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9560  std::string ename;
9561  output.emplace_back();
9562  output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(section, ename);
9563  output.back().name = "--";
9564  while (output.back().parents.size() > 1) {
9565  output.push_back(output.back());
9566  output.back().parents.pop_back();
9567  }
9568  }
9569  return output;
9570 }
9571 
9572 inline std::string ConfigBase::to_config(const App *app, bool default_also,
9573  bool write_description,
9574  std::string prefix) const {
9575  std::stringstream out;
9576  std::string commentLead;
9577  commentLead.push_back(commentChar);
9578  commentLead.push_back(' ');
9579 
9580  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9581  bool defaultUsed = false;
9582  groups.insert(groups.begin(), std::string("Options"));
9583  if (write_description &&
9584  (app->get_configurable() || app->get_parent() == nullptr ||
9585  app->get_name().empty())) {
9586  out << commentLead
9587  << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, app->get_description())
9588  << '\n';
9589  }
9590  for (auto &group : groups) {
9591  if (group == "Options" || group.empty()) {
9592  if (defaultUsed) {
9593  continue;
9594  }
9595  defaultUsed = true;
9596  }
9597  if (write_description && group != "Options" && !group.empty()) {
9598  out << '\n' << commentLead << group << " Options\n";
9599  }
9600  for (const Option *opt : app->get_options({})) {
9601 
9602  // Only process options that are configurable
9603  if (opt->get_configurable()) {
9604  if (opt->get_group() != group) {
9605  if (!(group == "Options" && opt->get_group().empty())) {
9606  continue;
9607  }
9608  }
9609  std::string name = prefix + opt->get_single_name();
9610  std::string value = detail::ini_join(
9611  opt->reduced_results(), arraySeparator, arrayStart,
9612  arrayEnd, stringQuote, characterQuote);
9613 
9614  if (value.empty() && default_also) {
9615  if (!opt->get_default_str().empty()) {
9616  value = detail::convert_arg_for_ini(
9617  opt->get_default_str(), stringQuote,
9618  characterQuote);
9619  } else if (opt->get_expected_min() == 0) {
9620  value = "false";
9621  } else if (opt->get_run_callback_for_default()) {
9622  value = "\"\""; // empty string default value
9623  }
9624  }
9625 
9626  if (!value.empty()) {
9627  if (write_description && opt->has_description()) {
9628  out << '\n';
9629  out << commentLead
9630  << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead,
9631  opt->get_description())
9632  << '\n';
9633  }
9634  out << name << valueDelimiter << value << '\n';
9635  }
9636  }
9637  }
9638  }
9639  auto subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
9640  for (const App *subcom : subcommands) {
9641  if (subcom->get_name().empty()) {
9642  if (write_description && !subcom->get_group().empty()) {
9643  out << '\n'
9644  << commentLead << subcom->get_group() << " Options\n";
9645  }
9646  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix);
9647  }
9648  }
9649 
9650  for (const App *subcom : subcommands) {
9651  if (!subcom->get_name().empty()) {
9652  if (subcom->get_configurable() && app->got_subcommand(subcom)) {
9653  if (!prefix.empty() || app->get_parent() == nullptr) {
9654  out << '[' << prefix << subcom->get_name() << "]\n";
9655  } else {
9656  std::string subname =
9657  app->get_name() + "." + subcom->get_name();
9658  auto p = app->get_parent();
9659  while (p->get_parent() != nullptr) {
9660  subname = p->get_name() + "." + subname;
9661  p = p->get_parent();
9662  }
9663  out << '[' << subname << "]\n";
9664  }
9665  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, "");
9666  } else {
9667  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description,
9668  prefix + subcom->get_name() + ".");
9669  }
9670  }
9671  }
9672 
9673  return out.str();
9674 }
9675 
9676 inline std::string
9677 Formatter::make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional,
9678  std::vector<const Option *> opts) const {
9679  std::stringstream out;
9680 
9681  out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
9682  for (const Option *opt : opts) {
9683  out << make_option(opt, is_positional);
9684  }
9685 
9686  return out.str();
9687 }
9688 
9689 inline std::string Formatter::make_positionals(const App *app) const {
9690  std::vector<const Option *> opts = app->get_options([](const Option *opt) {
9691  return !opt->get_group().empty() && opt->get_positional();
9692  });
9693 
9694  if (opts.empty())
9695  return std::string();
9696 
9697  return make_group(get_label("Positionals"), true, opts);
9698 }
9699 
9700 inline std::string Formatter::make_groups(const App *app,
9701  AppFormatMode mode) const {
9702  std::stringstream out;
9703  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9704 
9705  // Options
9706  for (const std::string &group : groups) {
9707  std::vector<const Option *> opts =
9708  app->get_options([app, mode, &group](const Option *opt) {
9709  return opt->get_group() == group // Must be in the right group
9710  && opt->nonpositional() // Must not be a positional
9711  && (mode != AppFormatMode::Sub // If mode is Sub, then
9712  || (app->get_help_ptr() != opt // Ignore help pointer
9713  && app->get_help_all_ptr() !=
9714  opt)); // Ignore help all pointer
9715  });
9716  if (!group.empty() && !opts.empty()) {
9717  out << make_group(group, false, opts);
9718 
9719  if (group != groups.back())
9720  out << "\n";
9721  }
9722  }
9723 
9724  return out.str();
9725 }
9726 
9727 inline std::string Formatter::make_description(const App *app) const {
9728  std::string desc = app->get_description();
9729  auto min_options = app->get_require_option_min();
9730  auto max_options = app->get_require_option_max();
9731  if (app->get_required()) {
9732  desc += " REQUIRED ";
9733  }
9734  if ((max_options == min_options) && (min_options > 0)) {
9735  if (min_options == 1) {
9736  desc += " \n[Exactly 1 of the following options is required]";
9737  } else {
9738  desc += " \n[Exactly " + std::to_string(min_options) +
9739  "options from the following list are required]";
9740  }
9741  } else if (max_options > 0) {
9742  if (min_options > 0) {
9743  desc += " \n[Between " + std::to_string(min_options) + " and " +
9744  std::to_string(max_options) +
9745  " of the follow options are required]";
9746  } else {
9747  desc += " \n[At most " + std::to_string(max_options) +
9748  " of the following options are allowed]";
9749  }
9750  } else if (min_options > 0) {
9751  desc += " \n[At least " + std::to_string(min_options) +
9752  " of the following options are required]";
9753  }
9754  return (!desc.empty()) ? desc + "\n" : std::string{};
9755 }
9756 
9757 inline std::string Formatter::make_usage(const App *app,
9758  std::string name) const {
9759  std::stringstream out;
9760 
9761  out << get_label("Usage") << ":" << (name.empty() ? "" : " ") << name;
9762 
9763  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9764 
9765  // Print an Options badge if any options exist
9766  std::vector<const Option *> non_pos_options = app->get_options(
9767  [](const Option *opt) { return opt->nonpositional(); });
9768  if (!non_pos_options.empty())
9769  out << " [" << get_label("OPTIONS") << "]";
9770 
9771  // Positionals need to be listed here
9772  std::vector<const Option *> positionals = app->get_options(
9773  [](const Option *opt) { return opt->get_positional(); });
9774 
9775  // Print out positionals if any are left
9776  if (!positionals.empty()) {
9777  // Convert to help names
9778  std::vector<std::string> positional_names(positionals.size());
9779  std::transform(
9780  positionals.begin(), positionals.end(), positional_names.begin(),
9781  [this](const Option *opt) { return make_option_usage(opt); });
9782 
9783  out << " " << detail::join(positional_names, " ");
9784  }
9785 
9786  // Add a marker if subcommands are expected or optional
9787  if (!app->get_subcommands([](const CLI::App *subc) {
9788  return ((!subc->get_disabled()) && (!subc->get_name().empty()));
9789  })
9790  .empty()) {
9791  out << " " << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "[" : "")
9792  << get_label(app->get_require_subcommand_max() < 2 ||
9793  app->get_require_subcommand_min() > 1
9794  ? "SUBCOMMAND"
9795  : "SUBCOMMANDS")
9796  << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "]" : "");
9797  }
9798 
9799  out << std::endl;
9800 
9801  return out.str();
9802 }
9803 
9804 inline std::string Formatter::make_footer(const App *app) const {
9805  std::string footer = app->get_footer();
9806  if (footer.empty()) {
9807  return std::string{};
9808  }
9809  return footer + "\n";
9810 }
9811 
9812 inline std::string Formatter::make_help(const App *app, std::string name,
9813  AppFormatMode mode) const {
9814 
9815  // This immediately forwards to the make_expanded method. This is done this
9816  // way so that subcommands can have overridden formatters
9817  if (mode == AppFormatMode::Sub)
9818  return make_expanded(app);
9819 
9820  std::stringstream out;
9821  if ((app->get_name().empty()) && (app->get_parent() != nullptr)) {
9822  if (app->get_group() != "Subcommands") {
9823  out << app->get_group() << ':';
9824  }
9825  }
9826 
9827  out << make_description(app);
9828  out << make_usage(app, name);
9829  out << make_positionals(app);
9830  out << make_groups(app, mode);
9831  out << make_subcommands(app, mode);
9832  out << '\n' << make_footer(app);
9833 
9834  return out.str();
9835 }
9836 
9837 inline std::string Formatter::make_subcommands(const App *app,
9838  AppFormatMode mode) const {
9839  std::stringstream out;
9840 
9841  std::vector<const App *> subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
9842 
9843  // Make a list in definition order of the groups seen
9844  std::vector<std::string> subcmd_groups_seen;
9845  for (const App *com : subcommands) {
9846  if (com->get_name().empty()) {
9847  if (!com->get_group().empty()) {
9848  out << make_expanded(com);
9849  }
9850  continue;
9851  }
9852  std::string group_key = com->get_group();
9853  if (!group_key.empty() &&
9854  std::find_if(subcmd_groups_seen.begin(), subcmd_groups_seen.end(),
9855  [&group_key](std::string a) {
9856  return detail::to_lower(a) ==
9857  detail::to_lower(group_key);
9858  }) == subcmd_groups_seen.end())
9859  subcmd_groups_seen.push_back(group_key);
9860  }
9861 
9862  // For each group, filter out and print subcommands
9863  for (const std::string &group : subcmd_groups_seen) {
9864  out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
9865  std::vector<const App *> subcommands_group =
9866  app->get_subcommands([&group](const App *sub_app) {
9867  return detail::to_lower(sub_app->get_group()) ==
9868  detail::to_lower(group);
9869  });
9870  for (const App *new_com : subcommands_group) {
9871  if (new_com->get_name().empty())
9872  continue;
9873  if (mode != AppFormatMode::All) {
9874  out << make_subcommand(new_com);
9875  } else {
9876  out << new_com->help(new_com->get_name(), AppFormatMode::Sub);
9877  out << "\n";
9878  }
9879  }
9880  }
9881 
9882  return out.str();
9883 }
9884 
9885 inline std::string Formatter::make_subcommand(const App *sub) const {
9886  std::stringstream out;
9887  detail::format_help(out, sub->get_display_name(true),
9888  sub->get_description(), column_width_);
9889  return out.str();
9890 }
9891 
9892 inline std::string Formatter::make_expanded(const App *sub) const {
9893  std::stringstream out;
9894  out << sub->get_display_name(true) << "\n";
9895 
9896  out << make_description(sub);
9897  if (sub->get_name().empty() && !sub->get_aliases().empty()) {
9898  detail::format_aliases(out, sub->get_aliases(), column_width_ + 2);
9899  }
9900  out << make_positionals(sub);
9901  out << make_groups(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
9902  out << make_subcommands(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
9903 
9904  // Drop blank spaces
9905  std::string tmp = detail::find_and_replace(out.str(), "\n\n", "\n");
9906  tmp = tmp.substr(0, tmp.size() - 1); // Remove the final '\n'
9907 
9908  // Indent all but the first line (the name)
9909  return detail::find_and_replace(tmp, "\n", "\n ") + "\n";
9910 }
9911 
9912 inline std::string Formatter::make_option_name(const Option *opt,
9913  bool is_positional) const {
9914  if (is_positional)
9915  return opt->get_name(true, false);
9916 
9917  return opt->get_name(false, true);
9918 }
9919 
9920 inline std::string Formatter::make_option_opts(const Option *opt) const {
9921  std::stringstream out;
9922 
9923  if (!opt->get_option_text().empty()) {
9924  out << " " << opt->get_option_text();
9925  } else {
9926  if (opt->get_type_size() != 0) {
9927  if (!opt->get_type_name().empty())
9928  out << " " << get_label(opt->get_type_name());
9929  if (!opt->get_default_str().empty())
9930  out << "=" << opt->get_default_str();
9931  if (opt->get_expected_max() == detail::expected_max_vector_size)
9932  out << " ...";
9933  else if (opt->get_expected_min() > 1)
9934  out << " x " << opt->get_expected();
9935 
9936  if (opt->get_required())
9937  out << " " << get_label("REQUIRED");
9938  }
9939  if (!opt->get_envname().empty())
9940  out << " (" << get_label("Env") << ":" << opt->get_envname() << ")";
9941  if (!opt->get_needs().empty()) {
9942  out << " " << get_label("Needs") << ":";
9943  for (const Option *op : opt->get_needs())
9944  out << " " << op->get_name();
9945  }
9946  if (!opt->get_excludes().empty()) {
9947  out << " " << get_label("Excludes") << ":";
9948  for (const Option *op : opt->get_excludes())
9949  out << " " << op->get_name();
9950  }
9951  }
9952  return out.str();
9953 }
9954 
9955 inline std::string Formatter::make_option_desc(const Option *opt) const {
9956  return opt->get_description();
9957 }
9958 
9959 inline std::string Formatter::make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const {
9960  // Note that these are positionals usages
9961  std::stringstream out;
9962  out << make_option_name(opt, true);
9963  if (opt->get_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size)
9964  out << "...";
9965  else if (opt->get_expected_max() > 1)
9966  out << "(" << opt->get_expected() << "x)";
9967 
9968  return opt->get_required() ? out.str() : "[" + out.str() + "]";
9969 }
9970 
9971 } // namespace CLI
